Reviews.Title: “Another Kimpton Gem”
Reviews.Author: ThurmanMurman
Reviews.Content: Solamar is by far one of the nicest Kimpton properties I've stayed in. Greeted by very friendly staff who were helpful in getting me into my room 3 hours before the 3:00 checkin. Room was HUGE. So much room to spread out. Bathroom was very spacious and bright. Speakman shower heads. Bed was immensely comfortable. View was looking out over the 4th floor rooftop pool and bar. Wine hour from 5-6 was great and then moseyed up to the bar where John the bartender took care of my beverage needs! Pool and bar area are bustling around 7, but a great place to catch some rays and enjoy some conversation. I will definitely make this my San Diego hotel of choice after my stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: Shaquan
Reviews.Content: Outstanding Hotel, with the service and amenities to match. Centrally located in the heart of San Diego's Gas Lamp District; everything I wanted - nightlife, shopping, dinning - was within walking distance. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: prettybullet
Reviews.Content: This was our final destination on our trip down the Pacific Coast Highway and I was pleasantly surprised. I am not sure what I had expected but after some wonderful stays in B&B's I thought this would be a rather soulless city centre hotel. I was wrong. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was very smart, with a great bathroom attached, and the bed was comfortable. We were on the 9th floor (pet free) and had good views of Petco Park, although the Padres weren't doing very well when we were there!! The pool area (on the fourth floor) was inviting and we spent a lovely afternoon just soaking up the sun around the small heated pool. We didn't breakfast in the hotel, although you could. We walked one block to "The Broken Yolk" cafe every morning. You must give this place a try, its a great place to start your day. Lovely staff, great food, and a never ending supply of coffee ( a novelty for us Brits!) All in all, this was a very pleasant experience, and I wouldn't hesitate to try another Kimpton Hotel if this is the standard they achieve. P.S. The free glass of wine at 5.00pm was great too!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service”
Reviews.Author: elitetravelerPhoenix
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel "accidentally" through Priceline with the name your price option. I go on there sometimes and enter a really low price for a 4 or 5 star hotel in a place I'd like to go, this was the first time it actually worked. I originally booked 2 nights but my wife thought that was too short and added another night at the same price. I had never heard of Hotel Solamar or kimpton before (I'm usually a Marriott person), but I really enjoyed our stay. This hotel is in a great location and is within easy walking distance to many restaurants, stores, and attractions. The beds are comfortable (a bit noisy when you'd get in/out or roll over) and the rooms are very well appointed. The view from our 10th floor room was pretty great. We could see the bay and it overlooked the pool on the 4th floor. My 2 year old son enjoyed looking out the window in the morning and watching all of the delivery trucks making their morning runs. I took the advice of one of the reviewers on here and signed up for their InTouch rewards program before I left. It didn't get me an upgrade (they said they were booked), but I did get free wi-fi and got to "raid the minibar". The heated pool was great as was lounging in one of the cabanas. We stayed during the week so we didn't have the weekend crowds. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The only downside was the parking. $40+tips per night to valet. Other hotels in the area were about the same price. Neighboring lots were about $25 for overnight parking, or if you could find a place on the street, it was free between 6pm and 8am and 1.25/hour during the day. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others, especially if you don't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Dark Lobby, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasLaura69
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business during an industry convention. The lobby was nice and modern, but dark. We had a nice room. The only real issue was the Jacuzzi bath, which had a window that required you to step into the Jacuzzi each time you wanted to close the curtains. I love taking baths, but did not want to use this tub since I stepped into each night to close the curtains.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeFromNY418
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Solamar a number of times and each times is better tha the last. It is in a great location in the Gas Lamp, close to where the Padres play . The staff are extremely helpful and friendly, beds are great, rooms are very clean, bathroom is nice. The pool bar is a nice place to wind down although it can get windy. Make sure to join the Kimpton loyalty program even if you are going just once as it gives you free internet, free drink coupons, and a couple of other things. There is also a nice breakfast place a block down (although I have forgotten the name). When leaving the hotel turn left and it is on the next block. Only sort of negative is the expensive valet parking biut I guess that is at all of the San Diego hotels downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Jryculand
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 2 night girls weekend and it did not disappoint!! From the moment we arrived the service was 5 star. We just stayed in the standard room with 2 Queens beds and it was so nice, new, and modern. The location of the hotel is the best! You are in walking distance from all the Gaslamp Restaurants and Shops, Petco is right around the corner, and the Zoo is a 2 minute drive. I have stayed at many hotels in the Gaslamp and I will be returning to the Solamar! Also, if you are traveling with a dog this seems to be the place to stay. Such cute dog amentities and adorable welcome sign out front. Can't wait to bring my little Jack Russell here.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: YaleDad
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several San Diego hotels but normally near the convention center- this was my first time staying in the Gaslamp area. Our group checked in late to a welcoming, receptive staff but when I got to my room it had a distinct odor of rotten eggs! I called down, and within five minutes a staff member came up with keys for a new room who took one whiff, confirmed my dislike about the odor, and apologized for the inconvenience. I was transferred from the 9th floor to a similar area on the 5th floor directly overlooking the pool area where a lively bar/pool party seemed to be in full swing. The noise was not troublesome to me at all, and I got a great night's sleep. I was up early for a trip to Coronado and the following morning to head back to the airport. I love the hotel's green initiative, funky interior design, the original local artwork on the walls, the room amenities, and the coffee, tea, and iced lemon water available in the lobby. I saw the hotel is animal friendly and I was happy to see this, but more happy that I didn't hear or experience any animal noise or disruptions during my stay. I had brief but warm experiences with all the staff at the hotel, and I'm sad I wasn't there to take advantage of their wine hour, something I would have enjoyed greatly! The hotel is located in the middle of all the action- close to theatre, sporting arenas, and surrounded by restaurants and clubs. It can get loud in the evenings and weekend, but that was never a distraction. We had a great dinner at Donovan's Steak House, a three minute walk from the hotel. I would certainly consider staying at the Hotel Solamar again, and if you like an active nightlife, this is a perfect hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “A lot to love, and a little to dislike”
Reviews.Author: BellatrixBabe
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband and two kids stayed here for a long weekend over spring break, for the opener of the Padres game and take in Balboa park. First things first, the location of this hotel is spectacular, its a block away from Petco Park and near every restaurant you want eat at in Gaslamp and across the street from a cupcake bakery. Starbucks is about 5 blocks away though, but good news is they serve coffee in the lobby in the morning (bad news, no in-room coffee maker!) and down the street is a greasy spoon called the Broken Yolk. The valet boys are very nice and super accomodating, however the valet area is very very small, so be prepared to wait if you are there on a busy weekend like we were. Check in is very casual, and note that if you book through a third party site like I did and try to add a second name to the registration in case they are arriving seperately, when the record is transferred over, the second name will become the first and they will only be able to see that name. Its a glitch that could become a serious problem for some. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite (which is decorated in a beachy modern pottery barn style- even my husband liked it), which was great since it had a door, but bathroom only accessible through the bedroom. Everything was nice in the bedroom, the pull out sofa, as usual, was not made up and we had to call for blankets. The mini bar is extra nice and they leave room in the mini fridge for your drinks and leftovers. Theres a hall closet with safe and two leopard print robes. Also they had put a dog bed in our room because we said we were bringing the dog. The bathroom had the BIGGEST, DEEPEST jacuzzi tub I've ever seen, it was truly amazing!! LOVE it!, The glassed in shower also nice. However the room was not made up the first day, even though we were out of the room from 9am-4pm and then again when we went to the pool, it meant we had no clean towels :( Huge oversight, yuck! We called for towels and they brought us two, but who wants to go on vacation and have to do their own cleaning.. so we were stuck all night in a messy hotel room. Boo boo boo. The pool area is interesting, as its really meant to accomodate the nightly bar scene of young singles who come to socialize, its very pretty with alot of sitting tables and beautiful views. The pool itself is very small and no hot tub, very limited lounge chairs, but we didn't have a problem getting one. If you're single and looking to mingle, the pool area after 8 looked great :)! As this hotel is VERY dog friendly, there is a nightly free wine hour between 5-6pm, which we partook of every night, most people sit in the gorgeous lobby with their laptop and/or friends and their dogs and drink. Its very nice, but it was slightly awkward with chlidren, we felt a little old for the hotel at that time, even thought we're not. Many of the visitors were late 20s or early 30s. They will put the wine in plastic cups if you ask so you can take up to your room or by the pool more easily. We drove to Balboa park one day and it was easy and fast, and we walked to Petco park 2 nights, don't forget theres a grassy area at Petco where you can go watch the game for $5 on the jumbotron and also the "beachers" which is a sand area for kids and benches for the parents. And there's sort of secret restaurant on the 5th floor I think that has two seatings 1-3 innings and 4-7 innings... the terrace there is very nice. We also took the Petco Park tour and I enjoyed it very much, you get to tour the exclusive Sony lounges and home plate club areas, plus see all the inner workings of the stadium. Its a must for any true baseball lover, just make sure to bring your regular tickets with you as well. All in all, love this hotel, there's a tiny bit of room for improvement, but I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel, Fine City”
Reviews.Author: SirMrMits
Reviews.Content: Hotel Solamar is overall a top notch hotel, with excellent facilities and customer service. We stayed here during our trip across California, and this hotel met all our expectations. We travelled with a toddler and the room provided was of excellent size and quality (although only a standard room). The hotel had a fantastic pool and a roof terrace bar, and the overall facilities of the hotel were excellent. And the hotel also has excellent spa services and general health and well-being. The staff as mentioned were excellent, and that includes all staff from the porters to the bar staff to the concierge, all very helpful and accommodating. Another bonus was that the staff were knowledgeable of the local area, recommended some excellent restaurants and excursions. The hotel is in an excellent location, with lots of restaurants nearby, and the Mexican restaurants in the area are extra special. We stayed here for three nights and visited San Diego Zoo, Sea World, Waterfront and other cultural sites. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would not hesitate staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: Workerbee3
Reviews.Content: Okay maybe this makes me officially old and cranky, but if you stay here on the weekends you should expect A LOT of noise from the surrounding neighborhood bars. I've traveled to a lot of cities and do not consider myself extremely sensitive to city noise, but the evolution of the rooftop bar concept in the Gaslamp quarter means that you really can't sleep well until after the bars close. This really ruins staying in downtown San Diego for me, I'll go to La Jolla or elsewhere on the coast next time. Not really a fault of the hotel, but something you should consider when choosing a place to stay. If you're here to party like a 20 something then this is probably the place for you! Just not for me.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Staff & Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: AlanaHastings1
Reviews.Content: I recenlty stayed at the Hotel Solomar for a small bachelorette party in San Diego. Aside from the hotel being beautiful, and the great down town location (Gaslamp), the staff was great! They were by far the most competent, helpful, and friendly group of young professionals that I have experienced in the customer service/hospitality industry. From the moment we got out of the car we were greeted by Nick Mcqueen who helped us with our bags and graciously showed us to our room with a smile. He was hilariously funny and kind, yet patient and professional despite the disorganized state of our group (he even offered to buy us more queso dip and salsa when we dropped it on the ground outside our car..eek). Throughout our stay he was present to help us get more room keys and to atttend to our bags at the end of the stay. Jose Amador was also very helpful. He was friendly, proficient and made sure that we had everything we needed. He was very welcoming and provided directions for the group. We loved his spunky, upbeat personality; he was awesome! We laughed as he shared his love of designer clothing to us and suggested places to go out! I was most impressed by the seemless efficency of the on-the-job duties coupled with the impression that the staff was actually having fun. It became clear that they REALLY were! Marisa White, Suzy Quist and Katie (?) also manned the front desk and were equally amazing! They were very helpful, yet quick to attend to our needs. Cheers to having a GREAT staff who made our experience the best!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Beat Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: punkinlr
Reviews.Content: As our previous experience with Kimpton, the Solamar is just fantastic. Located within walking distance to Petco Park, the USS Midway (1.6 miles), and many of San Diego's fine restaurants. The staff are totally amazing and helpful. The room very clean, spacious, and comfortable. Plenty of amenities, to include a small refrigerator. Although the hotel is pet friendly, they have three floors that are pet free. A bit pricey maybe, but with a military rate it is very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “a great stay”
Reviews.Author: ohana
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying here for my 3 nights in San Diego. It's very convenient to the Gaslamp area and other attractions. The staff was professional and friendly. The wine Happy Hour was wonderful! I would have given it 5 stars except for parking: expensive, I went to a city lot and paid a lot less but had to walk a short distance to the hotel. Otherwise, I look forward to returning to this hotel again. I got it through Priceline at a very good rate and I think that may be the only way I could afford it again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cozziad
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two days on business. The location is in the gas lamp district, close to the baseball park and convention centres and also the main restaurant bar strip. The rooms are very nice and the outdoor pool/bar area is also very good. The main lobby is a bit dark to the point where walking in from a bright day causes a logistical challenge. Well worth $200/night if you can get that price.

Reviews.Title: “Best of San Diego, By Far”
Reviews.Author: SeanTrey
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to San Diego for a medical convention. The host hotel choices were Hyatt, Hilton, and the Hotel Solamar. I chose the Solamar because of the funky decor and the Gaslamp District location. I was not disappointed. I'll start with the location. The hotel is only 2 blocks from Petco Park and 1 block from all that the Gaslamp District has to offer. Additionally, it is only a 5 minute walk to the convention center. If you are headed to San Diego for a convention, this is a much better location to the hotels on the water. If you are going to see a Padres game, you will be in heaven. About the hotel: The door personnel were extremely friendly. The front desk customer service representatives greeted me and checked me in quickly. I even received an upgrade to a nicer room as a Kimpton Rewards member. The room was gorgeous with a large flat-screen TV and beautiful decor on the 9th floor. There was a wine social in the hotel lobby each afternoon which was very nice. Overall, I could not have made a better choice than the Solamar. If I ever return to San Diego, this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leila L
Reviews.Content: It was our first stay in the Kimpton Hotel, and we would immediatly go there for a second stay. The bright room was very stylish but also comfortable, we really liked the soft light atmosphere in the bathroom. We really enjoyed spending one evening in the pool on the rooftop, the water was heated and it was a great possibility to relax after sightseeing and walking around all day. They offer you free organic coffee and a great variety of tee every day from 7 till 10.30, that is a perfect way how a day could get started! Also the Restaurant JSix ist absolutely recommendable. We were having some wine during the free wine offering from 5-6 when the head cook invited us to have some snacks at the bar during happy hour. We wanted to have dinner anyway so we decided to go there. We were sitting about 3 hours next to the really nice barkeeper and enjoyed the wonderful fresh (mostly organic) food and had several cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: BananaJazz
Reviews.Content: I know the Kimpton hotels and I was expecting a much better service. Nothing outstanding excepted the nice location in San Diego. The pool is small and dirtty. At the pool and bar lounge Nice staff but overloaded. Noboday is cleaning up the pool area after people left their empty glasses and dirty towels around. No need to say that I will not swim in this pool where people don't even clean their feets or the rest prior to enter the pool. The rest was pretty basic service as you can expect for this hotel catgeory. OH by the way don't show up before 3pm for the check-in (even at 2:45pm, the rooms are not ready! that what they said!!) a bit ridiculous to me.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and stylish”
Reviews.Author: IainER
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, great staff, highly recommended. The staff are friendly and couldn't be more helpful. Our corner suite was huge and very comfortable. The decor is distinctive and somewhat quirky. Not your run-of-the-mill hotel. Would I stay here again? Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel with personalized service!”
Reviews.Author: VenessaT
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at a Kimpton Hotel, and I am sold! I stayed at Hotel Solamar for a conference taking place at the San Diego Convention Center, which is a pleasant five minute walk from the hotel. The Gaslamp District, which the hotel is located in, is a great shopping and dining center - lots of very trendy and tasty restaurants & cool stores. For convenience, there's a huge CVS just a block away from the hotel. Incredibly, the hotel is also just two blocks away from Petco Park - while we had tickets to an exhibition game one night, I could have easily just watched the scoreboard from my room! Sign up to be a Kimpton Rewards Member before booking your room - lots of benefits offered to me, including a free room upgrade and a small minibar credit. Also, being a member allows you to access their wifi for free, which offered a good reliable internet connection. The staff is exceptionally wonderful - the bellboy greeted me by name the moment I arrived and the front desk was very professional. Because I arrived early, they made it a point to call me to let me know when my room was available. My room was extremely clean with a fully stocked minibar, a super comfy bed, a huge tub with bath salts, and a yoga mat with resistance band. I do echo another visitor's sentiment that the bathroom sink is annoying - it's flat, so water splatters everywhere and it's too high up for a short person like me. (Good) coffee and tea are served every morning, and wine every evening. (I'm told this happens at all Kimptons.) NY Times delivery to the room every morning was a nice touch. The hotel bar was nice - not too loud/crazy, and Brian the bartender was super cool. Overall, a very comfortable stay - looking forward to staying at another Kimpton in the future, and hope to have a reason for visiting Solamar again!

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the guests”
Reviews.Author: kc1101
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that excels with providing excellent customer service from the time you enter the lobby until you reluctantly leave with their parting gift of homemade cookies. Very attentive, helpful staff whlo never acts as though they don't want to be here or they are doing you a favor. We definitely plan to return here the next timewe are in San Diego! Well done, Hotel Solamar!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights for a combination business and leisure trip. I like kimpton hotels in general, and this one did not disappoint. Nothing major to complain about. I do think that this hotel is a little overrated on tripadvisor, however. Pros: free morning coffee (good coffee too), evening wine hour, complimentary wifi (which worked well most of the time), friendly staff, well maintained common areas, very nice pool patio area, clean rooms. location was also great: less than 5 min walk to convention center, steps to restaurants and shopping, and in the middle of it all. Cons: I was woken up twice by the alarm clock of the room next to me (at 5am): good thing i was still on eastern standard time. i could also hear what was going on in the room across the hall on several evenings (it was either the TV turned on loudly or a very loud speakerphone conversation). it seemed that the elevators were always full. there were no drawers to store clothes in our room. the bathroom was small, and the sink annoyed me because although nice to look at, everytime i washed my face i would get water all over me. Overall, I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: gal11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Solamar during a business trip and chose it in part because I have stayed at other Kimptom properties - and have had great experiences. Solamar did not disappoint. The staff were friendly, very helpful and quite professional. Room was lovely and comfortable. Food was excellent as was the pool bar. I will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: camjwg
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, wonderful location and unbelievably friendly staff. Love the loyalty program with free wifi , new york times and free minibar gift. Excellent organic coffee in the morning, iced lemon water all day and wine reception each evening is very nice too. Loved walking to a charming little French cafe for breakfast or lunch - Cafe Chloe - only about 4 or 5 blocks away - fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “So relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: lalabecky
Reviews.Content: The service is superb, the little extras, like the wine reception, appreciated, the property well kept and pretty, the location is fantastic, and best of all, we got a chance to really, truly relax! We chose the master suite, which had a private patio, large bedroom and doors that could close off the living area. This was essential because we had our 18 month old with us and it was so nice to be able to put him to bed and still be able to stay up and enjoy a bottle of wine, a movie, and grab drinks from the pool bar and hang on our patio. It was almost like we were on an actual date. The pool was lovely, and yes, the whole family was there, including the dog. The front desk staff was won over by his scruffy ways and kept giving him treats. He was in heaven - especially when we took him to Ocean Dog Beach, just a short drive away. We love Kimptons! I just wish the rooms with separate living area weren't sooooo much more $. It's worth it when you have a little one - otherwise we'd have to tiptoe around in the dark for fear of waking him up or go to bed at 8pm - but it's harder on a family budget to spend that much extra on the room. Still...we had a fantastic time!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like Home”
Reviews.Author: mimivan
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is so friendly that you feel like you live here! Beautifully appointed boutique hotel owned by Kimpton chain, the Hotel Solamar is up-scale and it a great part of San Diego, near Petco Park and the Gas Lamp district...all walking distance. Onsite parking and a wonderful restaurant are a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault this property”
Reviews.Author: CaptainPepper
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel in a good location 3 minutes walk to the busy gaslamp district. Close enough to join in but far enough out so that noise is not an issue. Staff gave us a late check out (4pm) for no charge. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful. The free wine hour is a bonus. It was strange to see everyone with their dogs, we're not used to that in England. The valet parkers pointed out a free parking place in the street for me.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: DesignGirl214
Reviews.Content: We were staying in LA last week for my son's spring break and decided to spend a couple of days in San Diego. After researching areas and hotels we chose the Gaslamp Quarter of the city for it's character and cost as compared to the more expensive hotels on the beach. I had read other reviews of the Solamar and while most were good, I was a bit concerned about the area. Boy was I surprised! What a fabulous location close to everything! The hotel is in great shape with very modern decorating and amenities. The rooms were all updated, clean & comfortable. We were on the 9th floor which I would recommend as it was a non-pet floor. The rooftop pool and bar were absolutely beautiful and I wish I'd had more time to spend there. We went to the hotel restaurant Jsix for breakfast and while they had a very limited menu and it was a bit expensive, the food was excellent. The hotel has a wine hour in their lobby from 5-6 with complimentary wine. We did this both nights we were there. What a nice way to start our evening! We met so many nice people from all over the world. The area was a bit touristy and the restaurants a bit spendy, but it's not anything we didn't expect. The "barkers" at the front doors of every restaurant were a bit obnoxious, but the food was delicious and the bars were fun. The hotel valet parking was expensive, but there are much cheaper options conveniently located within a block of the hotel &I didn't mind not parking on site. Overall our stay here at the Solamar was a wonderful experience that I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a great place to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego trip”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at the Kimpton Solamar, San Diego. Room was very nice, good sound proofing when the window ws closed. Great view of the pool. Staff was very nice and helpful. Plenty of great restaurants within walking distance. There is a CVS pharmacy one block away and a grocery stor about 6 blocks. Parking is valet only at the hotel, $40/day. You can park across the street but it is inconvenient. There is free coffee and tea in the morning. The coffee is stronger than Starbucks, only drank it the first day, there is a Starbucks about 2 blocks over. There is also a free wine hour every evening. I hope to stay at this hotel on my next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay, incredible staff”
Reviews.Author: 2travelingscientists
Reviews.Content: Close to convention center in gas lamp area. I had a wonderful king suite, loved modern yet sea inspired decor. Huge tub in bathroom. Comfy bed. Enjoyed free wine in evening and coffee in the morning. Weather was bad so could not check out terrace. The valets were helpful and great at getting taxi cabs. Loved front desk staff. Only negatives were the workout facility was tiny tiny, outside street noise loud on Fri & Sat nights, and JSix restaurant was not good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, not long enough.”
Reviews.Author: donotwantone1
Reviews.Content: Just had 3 nights here and it was brill from start to finish. Great staff in all depts, terrific decor, food, room and ambiance and as for location there cannot be a better one as it's in the Gaslamp quarter which has all you want in a city stay. We wish we had longer to stay in the hotel, abso fab place.

Reviews.Title: “Lively and welcoming with a personal touch.”
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with friendly staff. Only con is that there were no slippers in the room and room was a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Place to Stay...”
Reviews.Author: Jne3140
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive, after ready other reviews, that this hotel would be dirty and noisy...that couldn't be further from the truth! Although our first night was a Saturday, and there was a little of the "fraternity party" feel (and some loud voices), it was nothing we hadn't experienced before. Otherwise, the room was spotless, the service was excellent, and our stay was memorable. It was our first trip to San Diego, and this was the perfect spot to stay...great central locale!

Reviews.Title: “Not my type of hotel, but OK”
Reviews.Author: parslane
Reviews.Content: After staying here, my husband and I decided this just isn't our type of hotel. Keeping that in mind, here are the pros and cons. Pros: Free tea and (good!) coffee in the morning, along with a variety of newpapers, including New York Times. Free wine and bruschetta in the evenings. Lovely rooms. Friendly doormen. Great location for walking to top-notch restaurants. Cons: Upon check-in, the front desk guy with the mustache was quite patronizing in his unsolicited explanations to us of "city life" and "quality beer" (both of which we are quite familiar with, thank you). We couldn't get a room that was quiet and pet free. Our first room on the 10th floor was under the AC exchange, which made a jet-taking-off noise 24/7. They switched us to an 8th floor room, which had the weird smell of whatever "natural products" they use to clean up after the pets, and also happened to be overlooking the pool, where a party was being held. We were told there were no other options. In our first room, my contact case fell under the sink, and I discovered that area quite unclean when I reach under to retrieve it. The second room was clean in that area. Perhaps the pet rooms get a more thorough cleaning than the others? Mattress not that great; I could feel my husband moving around on his side. It's probably a great stay if your priorities as a hotel guest are style and freebies. I guess I'm more a small, friendly, personalized service type of hotel customer, and this didn't fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: VacaBoy
Reviews.Content: Kimpton, block off Fifth, great location on south end of Gaslamp. Dog-friendly, living room style seating area in lobby, public areas very comfortable. Staff over the top cordial and guest-oriented. No gift shop, but front desk person offered to go to drug store two blocks away if there was anything I needed they did not have. Complimentary WSJ and NYT, coffee in the lobby in the morning, wine in the evening. Sleeping room comfortable, clean, well-equipped. Meeting room okay, friendly and helpful banquet staff. Jsix restaurant food okay, again excellent staff. My second say here. We loved it and we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tiglao
Reviews.Content: We stayed in November 2011. I was not disappointed with this hotel. The customer service we received from concierge, guest services, valet and housekeeping was superb. We felt very welcome here. I love the fact that my doggies are "greeted". Kinda heartwarming to me. You have to walk the dogs at the side of the building to relieve themselves.. it isn't too far. I used a AAA discount. Valet not included with this one though. It ended to be almost $180/night. Most restaurants and bars a just a few minutes walk away. Great location that you do not have to drive home after having a couple of drinks.

Reviews.Title: “What a more-than-pleasant surprise!!”
Reviews.Author: queenie77
Reviews.Content: Solamar was in a prime location. Literally, walking distance (just minutes) to all the downtown restauarants, clubs, bars, or anything you want to do in Gaslamp District. It was right next to the Convention Center, where a little water taxi/Ferry can take you to Coronado. The hospitality was more than obliging, welcoming and accomodating with any and all needs. Our first day, the girl at the front desk booked our rental car, made restaurant reservations and spent an hour going over all the main attractions. I can't remember her name, but she was there the morning of Feb 18th (brown hair). She was amazing! She never made us feel rushed, nor did she make us feel we were bothering her. The complimentary contintental breakfast was a big plus. The Jsix Restaurant was more than stellar in their service, as well as quality of food. I will definitely try other Kimpton Hotels, as well as Solamar if I go back to San Diego. Thanks, Solamar!

Reviews.Title: “Another Kimpton Hotel Gem”
Reviews.Author: Cinderzz
Reviews.Content: The Kimpton hotels never disappoint and the Solamar is in a great downtown location, walking distance to several good restaurants. One of the best San Diego restaurants is in the Solamar Hotel - JSix. Walking through the lobby to the restrooms is worth the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent San Diego experience, from resturant service to room service.”
Reviews.Author: Krendrapretarus
Reviews.Content: As a San Diego, resident of eleven years, I must say the Solamar is exceptional service in every way. Where do I begin? Well, my wife and I experienced the food first. Absolutely bomb! I ordered the apple cider (so perfectly sweet) and she had the Stone IPA pale ale (so deliciously San Diegan.) Our taste buds fell in love with the exquisite house-made ravoili. To our delight, the chef introduced himself to us (we love that) at our table, and our personable and perfectly attentive waitress, Jaimie, made the experience warm and friendly, which is often lost at exquisite resturants. Our man of the night, Angel, provided us with exceptional customer service, and made sure each of our accommodations were in perfect order. The rooms are very tastefully done, and the little mini bar in our 7th floor corner room was very reasonably priced. Fifteen dollars for a medium-sized bottle of Ketel. I love that this Kimpton line of hotels favors a green way of business. They buy exclusively local, and they have a rooftop garden, which the chef pointed out, provides many greens for the kitchen. We did notice signs about that noted pet friendlyness. The staff informed us that there is no extra charge for dog guests, to our surprise. The hotel is impeccably clean, with no trace of animals visiting. I love this hotel. Even though we live in San Diego, we are already talking about our next mini-vacation at Solamar!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: katpag1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Solamar for 1 night while on a trip to San Diego. We have stayed at Kimpton Hotels in the past (Boston) and were very pleased, so when we saw this property located in San Diego, we booked. We were not disappointed! The hotel is well designed – something we have come to expect from a Kimpton. The decor in the room was funky and well-appointed; very clean and the bathrooms are high end. The hotel bar/pool area is the best in the city... located on the rooftop of the hotel. The staff at the hotel is very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is also very convenient-we were able to cover a lot of ground on foot because of the central location downtown and near the Gaslamp District. After our last stay in the Kimpton Nine-Zero in Boston, I joined Kimpton's "In-touch Program", which offers free wi-fi and a $10 "raid the mini bar" coupon (We used ours for bottled water to keep with us while we were touring San Diego). Parking is sort of expensive ($40), but competitive with other hotels in the area. I would recommend this hotel if for a stay in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “If you stay anywhere else in San Diego, you're short changing yourself!”
Reviews.Author: Shugsterhibs
Reviews.Content: We're lucky as a family to get to travel all over the world to different places, and because of that different hotels. We've been to good and bad, but the Solamar is right up there with the best we've been to. It was the first time we'd been to San Diego so we booked this place on the back of reviews and it's central location, initially for a couple of days until we got our bearings. It was that good we ended booking a further two, then another day to make five in total - the only reason we didn't stay on Saturday was that it was fully booked! The rooms are a great size - we had a room with two super comfy queen beds - and the bathroom is nice too. The design of the rooms and hotel is very 'boutique' and it was right in the Gaslamp Quarter near bars and restaurants, virtually all of which are kid friendly. Despite the location, we never had any problem with noise at all. The local public transport system is excellent, a $5 pass got us on and off trolleys and buses all day to places like Sea World, SD Zoo and the outlet shopping centre on the border (well worth visiting for shopping bargains). What sets this hotel apart from other good places though is the staff - from the moment we walked in until the moment we left they made us feel like we were the only people staying. Our seven year old was asked every morning where we were off to that day, and how she'd got on when we got back every evening. No question was too much hassle, and they went out of their way to look after us, especially the girls on the front desk who re-booked us in each time for our extra nights. In an industry where too often customers are just numbers, it's a real welcome change to go somewhere where customer service is clearly something they believe in 100%. The wine at night and coffee in the mornings were nice touches too. In short, this may not be the cheapest hotel in town but we got a good deal off a late booking website for the first few days and then through the hotel themselves after that. But if you stay anywhere else, it will need to be phenomenal to beat the Solamar. We can;t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: brad2k
Reviews.Content: Clean, well-appointed rooms with a nice beachy theme (even if there's no beach in sight). Staff was very accommodating and we enjoyed the wine happy hour and their acceptance of dogs. Free Wi-fi (after registering for their loyalty program) was a nice perk. My only complaints: parking is stupidly expensive, but what kills me is the pool. It was totally unusable because guests come downstairs early in the morning, toss their belongings on several lounge chairs, and disappear until the sun has hit the pool (several hours later). I watched this ridiculous scene unfold for nearly all of the unreserved spaces (of which there are precious few) and the staff seemed entirely indifferent, which was shocking considering that half of them weren't even staying at the hotel. Perhaps this is just a So Cal thing that we Nor Cal-ers just don't understand, but it's unfortunate that they allow it to continue.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to the ultra-expensive bayside hotels!”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: I visit San Diego each year for an event at the San Diego Convention Center. This last time I discovered the Hotel Solamar - a perfect alternative to the far more expensive hotels next to the bay. Located only a short 3 blocks from the Convention Center, it's actually closer than many of the bayside options! Funky and fun ... with excellent comfort and care. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Grknyc
Reviews.Content: Came to San Diego with my wife to attend a convention. The location of the Hotel can't be beat ! Walking distance to the Convention Center, about 8 minutes. In the Gaslamp District ! Great Bars, shoppes, etc. The room was clean, spacious, and modern. The soaking tub was very relaxing. Rooftop bar makes a great margarita !

Reviews.Title: “Nestled in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Carie F
Reviews.Content: Great location with great staff. Food was locale, organic and good.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Expedia- Great Rate- Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BiotechCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Fair warning: Parking is $40 valet- now, I was aware of this before going so I was fine with it. This hotel is in a great location- surrounded by the finest dining est. - Palm, Flemings, Oceannaire, and the whole gaslamp area. And the mall! Rooms are great, terrific shower.... Will return, Coffe/tea service in te am, wine tasting in the pm...

Reviews.Title: “Super nice staff super dog friendly”
Reviews.Author: Anosila
Reviews.Content: The staff here can't be beat, they bend over backwards to help. We stayed here with our newborn and dog. We were greeted with the dog's name and welcome on a chalkboard and a bowl of water outside the hotel (make a reservation for the dog when you reserve your room). We also had my 9 foot surfboard which the valets stored for me with no problems at all- they were so accommodating even while super busy (we took a lot of time between the baby seat and dog.) The hotel is nice looking and our room was more than adequate- super bed and spacious feel as well as nice views. This was our first trip with the baby and the location and comfort and friendliness of this hotel made it a breeze. The room service was delicious too. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect staycation”
Reviews.Author: smassey1
Reviews.Content: wanted to get away with wife for quick getaway of all places we could go she chose gaslamp got solamar on expedia didn't know what hotel that was what they gave us great rate and right within walking distance of all. rooms were nice, clean and staff was extra friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Top-Notch, as always...”
Reviews.Author: KevinB01
Reviews.Content: I just returned after spending a few weeks for work at the Hotel Solamar in San Diego. Whenever my wife and I travel, we first check to see if there are any Kimpton hotels in the cities we're traveling to. We love the brand and are always impressed with their style, their rooms, their restaurants, and their perks (free coffee, wine happy hour, pet friendly, etc.). I was super impressed with the Solamar and would highly recommend the hotel to anyone visiting SD. It's especially conducive for couples, but solo travelers, business travelers, and families would also find this to be a great hotel. Being that I was there for a few weeks, I got to know the hotel staff and the valets extremely well. Everyone was also very professional and extremely courteous. I often asked for recommendations for coffee, restaurants, pubs, and such and their suggestions were always very reliable. The staff was always quick to act on any requests that I made and went out of their way on multiple occasions to make my stay as comfortable and convenient as possible. The location of the hotel is super convenient to the Gaslamp District, about a block off the main drag which was a benefit because it wasn't right on top of all the activity of 5th Street. Everything is within walking distance - theatre, shopping, restaurants, groceries, and more. Petco Park is just about two blocks away too. I also took advantage of the fourth floor terrace pool and lounge area, which was also an excellent spot to have some lunch or grab a drink. Thanks again Solamar!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Darin P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, but that creates the first and most notable drawbacks of our stay. First, as we pulled in the driveway, we see that it costs $40 a day to park your car. This would have been nice to know while booking, but it's nowhere on the booking portion of the site despite the front desks insistence that we should have known. It created a very sour taste in my mouth that our stay had a $200 surcharge. Second, the location is so near clubs and bars that there is an ever present noise in the rooms. Cars, sirens, loud people....this is near the top floor. The noise goes until at least one in the morning. The last piece that was disappointing is the quality of beds. For the price, the mattresses are junk. You can feel each individual spring. I have never tossed and turned so much for lack of comfort. It's subjective, I know, but for the room rate and parking charges, this place can afford some better mattresses than these. Overall, the rooms are nice though. They're clean and well stocked. The staff was helpful and friendly besides the front desk guy who was determined to make us publicly shamed for not being happy about the parking charge. Probably won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Jamboysf
Reviews.Content: Gaslamp Quarter location is ideal; not far from Petco Park and the harbor. My room (1026) was comfortable, quiet, with quirky decor and decent (though not spectacular) view. As a newly joined Kimpton rewards member, the lights were on in my room when I arrived, along with a personal note from the manager and a coupon for $10 off anything from the minibar (and free Wi-Fi, with a strong signal). The restaurant has good food (organic meats, etc.), and the 4th floor pool deck is a fun place to hang out. Try the lavender lemon drop cocktail. Yum. The staff is what really makes this property a place I'll return to. Angel and Seth, at the front desk, were particularly helpful. Angel told me about a cool speakeasy-style bar not far away, and Seth gave me extra-late checkout when I really needed it. Usually when you ask for late check out, a hotel's front desk clerk MAY begrudgingly give you until 1 p.m., but Seth gave me until 3:30. My only complaint, and it's a small one, was that on a Thursday afternoon in early February, there was no food service at the pool. (It was a beautiful, warm, sunny afternoon.) Nor was there even a menu available to check, and you couldn't get room service at the pool. I had to go to my room, read the menu (the hotel web site doesn't even offer a menu), call the hotel restaurant, have them call my cell phone when my food was ready, then go down and pick it up. Again, it's a small complaint. To summarize: Excellent service, ideal location, comfortable and slightly hip place to stay, with reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort of home”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn L
Reviews.Content: I'm quite particular concerning hotels but was not at all disappointed at Hotel Solamar. The bed was wonderful, room was perfect, the TV was bigger than some and the dinner we ordered from room service was great. The morning coffee in the lobby is a nice touch. Great location for walking but parking is $40 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room, decent price”
Reviews.Author: BrownNutOnion
Reviews.Content: Well located for the Gaslamp District, the hotel had decent sized and quiet rooms at good prices. Staff very helpful but valet parking expensive; save 35% by parking in the lot directly opposite the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Bub's is across the street”
Reviews.Author: GirlyBob33
Reviews.Content: Want to know how I know this? Our room was facing Bub's and apparently over top some dumpsters that were emptied very early in the morning. We were unable to use the pool for a night because it was booked for a private party. As a guest coming from Anchorage, not being able to use the pool was a big deal to us.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DSV_Pilot
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many of the Hotels in downtown San Diego over the years, from the Hyatt, Marriott, Westin, Envy, Hilton, etc. This by far was the worst experience so far of any of our stays. We have received better customer service at a Holiday Inn express off the Freeway in Madera, Ca then we have here. This was supposed to be romantic getaway for my wife's birthday and we had reserved the Choreographer Suite and upon check-in was informed, so sorry but it seems the room was overbooked and we were downgraded to a room not of our choice right outside the Hospitality Lounge which to say "noisey" was an understatement. We called and booked a in room massage for my wife for the next day at noon and were told no problem it would be taken care of. After returning from breakfast my wife stopped by the front desk to confirm the times only to find that the appointment had never been made. No hot water at the coffee bar for tea, and the coffee quality was worse than 7 eleven. The professionalism of the staff and management is far below the par that we expect from a fine hotel in the city. Would highly recommend folks seek other accomodations in the downtown area before booking here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable value, kind of loud”
Reviews.Author: LAS021
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2nights business travel. Good location, nice rooms. Major downside was the fitness center was under renovation and in a temporary location with one lamp for the whole room. So at 6am, it was so dark that you couldn't read and there were no tvs. Hopefully this is a temporary situation. I had a rental car for work meetings which I parked in a municipal garage 2blocks away for $23 versus the $80 the hotel wanted to charge for 2 nights. I'm a Kimpton rewards member, so I appreciated the raid the mini-bar coupon. Rooms were comfortable and in line with other similar properties. Walls were thin and I slept with earplugs in.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: 52yearoldskier
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed in on our first trip to the States, so will always be very special. Stayed on one of the upper animal free floors looking down on the pool. A nice room although the bathroom was quite small. Loved the location in the Gaslamp quarter with lots of restaurants, close to Petco Park where we went to our first Baseball game. It was also close enough to have a reasonable walk to San Diego's other attractions such as the Midway and boat trips and the ferry to Coronada. Loved the evening reception with drinks which we took full advantage of! We ate in the hotel restaurant the first evening which was really nice, although more expensive than we thought it would be.

Reviews.Title: “Funky chic in a fab location”
Reviews.Author: Runnergirl45
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into Hotel Solamar in San Diego a few days before Christmas for two nights away from the craziness and kids. It's located in a pretty cool area of San Diego's Gaslamp district, near Petco Park. We checked in and wandered the shops along the streets leading to Horton Plaza then finished our shopping at the mall. We headed back to the hotel for the complimentary, nightly wine tasting from 5-6pm, with a featured wine label of the month and light appetizers. Nice touch. The lobby is fairly modern and elegant with a huge fireplace. Our room, however, was kind of funky, in need of an update. An oversize, shabby chic white mirror dominated the room--which was nothing like the photos online and totally unlike the inviting, chic lobby. We couldn't get the thermostat to work correctly, either, so we were really hot at night. The hallway carpeting was also worn looking. Perhaps they're in the middle of a renovation and haven't finished? We hit the poolside bar after dinner and it was okay...there were no fire pits burning and very few people there. In the summer, it's surely a hotspot, though. Oh, and morning coffee and hot chocolate brought us downstairs bright and early to find families in pajamas getting theirs. That gave a cozy, holiday feeling. Overall, it was a good place to stay--if only the room was a touch more sophisticated. The location was perfect for waterfront runs and walks, as well as Gaslamp shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: GregRich
Reviews.Content: We always look for Kimpton properties when on vacation as they are good values and great rooms. This hotel didn't disappoint. They have a wonderful pool and lounge on the fourth floor roof that makes a great place to relax after a long day. Our room was fairly large and came with a sunken tub for two complete with jets. The only knock is the same thing I complain everywhere I go is the parking. It's a whopping $40 a night, however, if you aren't driving daily there are lots close by for cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Valentine's Day Special”
Reviews.Author: gmjpeach
Reviews.Content: This was a few years ago (2010?). The Kimpton hotels were running a great special, only $99 per night! Perfect for a romantic getaway! I was really excited, and it was a nice little property. Rooms are exactly as pictured on the website (which is rare), and they DID have all the little specials, like the free wine reception, which I tried once. The rooms were much smaller than at the Omni, but as this is a boutique hotel, I expected that. The location was...odd. It is considered in the heart of San Diego, but across the street is a big empty lot with trash and several night clubs. The biggest downside is this hotel has a nightclub by the pool atmosphere, and if your room over looks the pool, you might be disturbed by noise or lights. We were told this, and it didn't bother me when I closed the drapes, but it may bother others. Just down the street is an awesome cupcake shop that I recommend too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the center of the historic Gaslamp District of San Diego. We were treated like royalty by the hotel staff. It was fun watching the parking valets "run" to get our car. They care about their guests. Try upgrading to a suite, we appreciated the extra space. I we go back to San Diego we will stay here again. The Kimpton chain is becoming our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the top floor because of ac unit noise from the roof.”
Reviews.Author: toysforboys
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights for a conference at the convention center, which is in short walking distance. As with every Kimpton hotel, nice and small reception area, free wine tasting, and just a nice warm feeling. Parking easy and relatively cheap in the own hotel garage – only valet. Pool and fitness good for a downtown hotel. First had a room at the top floor, which is noisy because of the ac unit on the roof, which is very present all the time. Reception is aware of this problem, but did not warn you when you check in. Moved to a room with pool “view”. It is noisy till 11 PM, but then quite.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Gaslamp Quarter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KL-XVIII
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice hotel. The checking and later checkout was very fast. Front desk personnel were very friendly. I had breakfast in the attached restaurant and the food was good and reasonably priced. The location is great as mentioned in other reviews. My room was quiet and the beds were comfortable. I would give the cleanliness 8/10. The 4th floor rooftop bar/pool area is very nice and has heaters for nighttime. All the bars in the hotel close at 11pm, but there are plenty of choices nearby that stay open later.The valet parking is $40/night was 2X the daily cost of my car rental, but the attendants always had the car ready when I called from my room and immediately headed down. There is a self-park lo directly across the street for $25 but the lot closes at midnight and I don't think there are in/out privileges. The only hiccup to the stay was my room keys were deactivated in the middle of my stay. The one thing I really didn't like are the horrible soap dispensers. There is no bar soap provided, only poorly working pump dispensers in the shower (impossible to identify the soap form the shampoo from the conditioner if you wear glasses). The sink only had a pump bottle of soap and no other amenities - just a price list of items they sell. I ended up walking down to the nearby CVS drugstore and bought soap. Another thing, if you are travelling with kids, you might not like one aspect of the room set-up where they have a bar (not free) that has several mid-size bottles of liquor and wine sitting out in the open along with snacks. I'm sure the hotel would remove them prior to arrival if you requested that. I would overall give this place a 4.5 and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Gary G
Reviews.Content: The Solomar is well located for a visit to the Gaslamp District. We had a great room with a view of the Harbour. The staff is helpful and responsive. we've stayed here a number of times and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: Teegs2302
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel.very modern,bed incredibly comfortable,staff were nice and helpful.hotel is in good area close to many restaurants and horton plaza.would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: UndercoverReviewer
Reviews.Content: Okay, here is the GOOD: - the location is great and within easy walking distance to the baseball field, convention center, Seaport Village and all the wonderful restaurants/shopping of the Gaslamp area - the hotel is fairly modern and was mostly clean (just noticed some bits of paper down the hallway - but could have been a one time thing) - the rooms are nice - got a fantastic rate through Kayak.com - takes pets - complimentary reception in the evenings Here is the NOT SO GOOD: - the front desk is also the concierge. Sounds like a good concept except when you are trying to check out and there is only one front desk person who is helping someone decide what they want to do for the day. - valet parking is $40 per day which seems high. Recommend you park across the street in the parking lot (overnight was $25) - for us the worst part was the music across the street. We were in room 601 which is directly kitty-corner to the club. We finally changed rooms at 12:30am as the volume seemed to intensify through the night. If you are looking for a quiet room, let the front desk know it when you check in (that was our mistake) as the other side of the hotel is quieter. We were told the music shuts off at 1:30am. - Room 601 also had a very musty/mildew smell coming from the bathroom. The second room we moved into did not have that issue so it may have only been the one room. To their credit, the Solamar did comp continental breakfast and valet parking because of the inconvenience which we appreciated. We would stay there again but would definitely ask for quiet and park across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in gaslamp, but $40 for valet parking”
Reviews.Author: DabneyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We are also fans of the Kimpton chain, and they treat their members very well indeed. We love that we can walk to a huge selection of restaurants and bars in the always entertaining urban experience of San Diego's gaslamp area. My husband and I stayed at Solamar for my birthday weekend Jan. 13 & 14th. What we didn't like was that in-room movies are now $20 and no DVD players available; the bathroom pocket-door was misinstalled so that it was an inch out at bottom, and windows were dirty, and $40 for parking is outlandish. That said, we still love the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely decor, great location, a few service issues”
Reviews.Author: Gemma1977
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Argonaut in San Francisco I had high hopes for this hotel. I ended up feeling a little let down. It's a nice hotel and in a great location, but it was a bit lacking in the service department. Room wasn't ready when we arrived (early) and we were asked to come back at 3pm, which was fine. Still not ready when we returned at 3.30 which wasn't fine. As I inked down on seating in front of reception to wait, was soon noticed by manager (?) and within 20 mins had room on 10th floor and vouchers for complimentary drinks. This would have swayed things back in their favour except the safe didn't work and despite two phone calls no one ever arrived to look at it! Also had to call housekeeping as they left us without towels and it was the only hotel bar I've ever visited as a guest and been asked for my credit card before they'd serve me! Oh, and just arrived home and they've added an extra charge to my credit card. Not part of the bill they showed me on checkout...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: JK_Goldfish
Reviews.Content: I chose to wait for a bit before I posted a review of this hotel. I think I had a uniquely poor experience which I would perhaps blame on Murphy's Law and the Thanksgiving holiday. My boyfriend and I had Thanksgiving to ourselves - no kids, no family this year, so we decided to take a little adult vacation for turkey day. We arrived on Tuesday the 22nd of November, two days before the holiday. The hotel was located on the border of the up and coming East Side Village, the Gas Lamp, the ball park and the convention center. They do not have a parking garage unless you valet, but there are two or three parking lots, with varying daily rates, right near by. This was the first thing that struck me as unfortunate but not something that was worth much more thought. The hotel itself was nice, modern and clean. They also take pets here - which was really cool to see a nicely kept property to offer. They also keep the top two floors of the property absolutely free of pets, so if you are not a fan of pet hair and dander, you have your own sanctuary. That being said, I never heard a single pup nor did I witness or experience any poor interaction with any bad pet owners or pets. Our check in person was very sweet and explained to us that the hotel was taking advantage of the quiet time during the holiday to do some repairs and renovations. She offered us a bottle of wine to say thank you in advance for any inconvenience, she also offered us two complimentary continental breakfasts from the in house restaurant J-six. Unfortunately for the hotel, we are well versed in wine and I can promise you that we would not regift or even use this bottle of wine for sangria - it was shwag, but we appreciated the gesture. Overall, our stay at the hotel was great. It was a clean and quiet place to rest our head at the end of our nights. Our main issue really came down to a problem with the complimentary continental breakfast and the restaurant J-six. We came into the restaurant on the third day, on the 24th for our complimentary breakfast. We stood in a very empty restaurant that appeared to be without a hostess. We wanted to get our breakfast to-go so we could enjoy it back up in our room. We figured this would be easy to take care of. We waited for about 10 minutes at an empty bar until a hostess appeared. She apologized for the delayed attention and explained she was new and that the one server on hand was having a bad day. The hostess offered to take our order but was immediately confused and completely unknowledgeable about the comp. continental - or what a continental breakfast was comprised of. This was the first time in my relationship where I gave my boyfriend the green light to raise hell about this restaurants total incompetence; this was after I watched the hostess and the manager grab our food from the open kitchen with their bare hands and dumping our food into to-go containers. What freaked me out more was that the chef in the kitchen did not even try to stop them from putting their unwashed hands into his food. We did not eat the breakfast, nor did we ever step foot back into J-six. We also spoke to the front desk and said we were disappointed about the miscommunication about this complimentary breakfast program. The hotel tried their best to right the wrong with us by sending us another horrible bottle of wine and covering our valet parking for the entirety of our stay. The restaurant manager, the one who touched our food, gave my boyfriend a contrived apology by phone. So, we were miffed, hungry, and disappointed, but as for the hotel itself, I would not steer anyone away from the great value and location, but I would recommend dining at any of the many restaurants within walking distance over J-six. I'm not sure I would stay there again, but overall, the hotel itself was not bad.

Reviews.Title: “I always stay here when in San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: bpdatl
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel ... Hip, cool and great location in downtown San Diego. GREAT bar on the roof. Rooms are really cool and some have Japanese Tubs which are HUGE . Each night they offer free wine and apps in the lobby. THEY EVEN WELCOME PETS and post the dogs name at the entrance and have water bowl for their canine guests. Very nice policy and great staff. Good breakfast in the on-site restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “I'd like to keep this a secret it's so nice!”
Reviews.Author: Kayzzze
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was just great for me as a single traveler, I don't like huge hotels and look for smaller personal ones. The Solamar has 10 floors so it's perfect. The rooms are very nice & clean and good size, they upgraded me on my second day and moved my stuff to a spa room with a jet tub which was so very welcome after being on my feet all day at a conference. The walk to the Convention Center was easy and short. My only complaint as others have said was no coffee in room and the valet parking is $40 per night which won't set well with my boss! The staff at every level was great, the bartender on the 4th floor pool area reccomended the filet burger which I devoured and he moved the heater over to me so I would be comfortable. So very nice... they even gave me a coupon for a free drink so I had a martini! Yeah,,,it was wonderful so I hate to say it but keep it a secret so I can always get a room at a good rate!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: girlncalifornia
Reviews.Content: Close to everything within walking distance in the Gaslamp District and the convention center. Hip decor. Oustanding service! We stayed there in late December and they even had complimentary hot chocolate in the lobby in the morning. The restaurant was also great- too bad, no breakfast buffet.:-) Pet-friendly. I had problems with internet charges but they immediately resolved it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to go in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Doglover2011_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights at this hotel. We even took our Bernese Mountain Dog with us too. We forgot to check for events going on in the city though. The Holiday Bowl was going on. That meant more football fans in the city. However this hotel was our escape from the crowds. They gave us a free upgrade with a beautiful room with views of Petco Park, their pool area and another view of the city. (Ask for Room 835). The bed was very comfortable and the room was a corner room where there were three windows. The staff is very nice and helpful. They even made our dog feel friendly by offering a bed and bowls for her and she was on their VIP list (Very important pooch list). We enjoyed their coffee and tea service and room service too. We did not eat at their restaurant though but it looked nice. The location is great and close to the Gaslamp district where there are lots of restaurants and shops to visit. I would recommend going here and becoming a member of their frequent guest program. We were new to this but yet still got an upgrade and some money towards the minibar too. The only thing they might want to improve is the fitness room. It is kinda small. This was our second time staying here and we plan to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Really well done,,,, great staff....”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTraveler777
Reviews.Content: Went down to CA for a convention and was very pleased with the service and staff and location and especially the room, which was a "spa" room....a little too romantic for a solo traveler...but a couple would really enjoy it....but might not want to leave the room. Location is good for convention goers and for party goers looking for walking distance to gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “Hip but noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidbh1453
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, hip hotel. We were disappointed at the noise in the hallways (not from the outside) -- the room doors seemed thin. The bathroom was small for the large size of the room. Very comfortable bed. Loved wine hour in the lobby! Very friendly staff. Parking is expensive, but you can leave your car in the driveway to unload and park nearby. Can't beat the great Gaslamp location! All that said, we probably would not stay there again because of interior noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to celebrate an anniversary”
Reviews.Author: danielbalc
Reviews.Content: We got this place via priceline and stayed for our anniversary. Front desk agent (Marissa) was incredibly attentive. Cannot recommend enough.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: CBATO
Reviews.Content: The location is great...pretty much everything is within walking distance...restaurants, bars, shopping and the waterfront. The 4th floor pool and lounge is very cool during the day and at night! The free coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby each morning was nice too. However, hotel parking was pretty expensive at $36/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!! All Pros with only two cons.”
Reviews.Author: DWFRN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate the New Years weekend and had great time. The Pros: Staff- excellent!!! Top notch, very friendly, quick and helpful. Roof top lounge-was perfect with a pool, modern style decor consisting of fire pits, heat lamps, multiple cabanas, out door fire place, tables, couches, a great view of the gas lamp district below, out door shower (out of public view) to rinse after pool use, with a nice bar as well. Hotel lobby/lounge-VERY NICE, Beautifully done with with fire place, couches, chairs. A nice touch is the free wine hour from 5-6pm!! Be there about 5-minutes early to get a great place to sit, relax an enjoy your wine :). We had the Chilean Cab!!! Very good!! This place was pet friendly as well!! Perfect if you plan to bring your dog!! The Room was styled nice and cozy with comfortable beds and nice cushy sized chair!!. We had a room on the 6th floor over looking the pool and really enjoyed the view. Best of all was the location of this hotel to fine dining and all of what the Gas Lamp has to offer. You do not need your car if you only plan to visit nearby Seaport Village, Convention Center or the Gas Lamp district. The 2 Cons: First was the parking/vallet prices at $40/night. You do get in/out privileges at no extra charge though if you plan on using your car. We didn't use our car and parked right across the street for $25/night which was very convenient!! The other con was the walls and doors were so thin (maybe just our room) you could hear EVERYTHING including crying-barking dogs, people talking etc.out in the Hallway as well as the room next to ours. Security was very quick wonderful at quieting guest that were loud and disturbing others. So needless to say I had horrible sleep the first night and my Wife did the second night. Overall the place was nice and we'd come back. Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Cool”
Reviews.Author: Baybtt
Reviews.Content: Great location, great amenities. Unfortunately, I was only there for a short stay and couldn't use them. The room was fabulous. It had a great bed and awesome lighting. The downside was that they didn't have a coffee maker. They did have a bathrobe though. Overall, pretty cool place. (Oh yeah, and a great coffee/hot chocolate bar in the lobby in the morning.)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay; very pet friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pikake2010
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Solamar. We brought our two doggies and a rabbit. First time bringing all of them with us. We spent Christmas there and it was wonderful. The pets loved the vacation and the hotel. Took them on lots of walks. There's a really nice park close by at Petco Stadium. Dogs are allowed there and there is security walking around. Also, enjoyed taking the dogs to the Gaslamp district where we had lunch. We were able to tie them to the railing in the outdoor patio of the restaurant so the dogs could be with us. Had great food at La Fiesta (Mexican Cruisine and Lounge) and also at the Italian restaurant connected with it. One restaurant down. The hotel is really comfortable and give nice comfortable beds for the dogs which also match the decor of the room. Also furnished doggie food/water dishes and lots of tasty treats - a whole assortment of them. Loved the welcome VIP pet signs. Enjoyed seeing all the names of the pets staying there. Also, found the staff to be really friendly, customer focused and all seemed to love the pets too. You can tell the staff love working there. This is the third Kimpton hotel we have stayed at and we loved it. Love the out of the box ideas the hotel has like providing a goldfish for those who miss there pets, late checkout on Sundays, no parking fees for hybrid cars, etc. Kimpton hotels stand out from the rest. Oh! and they don't charge pet fees. Incredible. Another nice touch which was a surprise was that on Christmas day, since the restaurant was closed, they provided all the guests a complimentary continental breakfast. Really enjoyed it and got to meet some of the other guests while eating near the fireplace. Felt at home there and am looking forward to returning. Only wish there were more Kimpton hotels all over the place. Would always stay there if there was. This hotel does have a great location - walking distance to Petco Stadium, Convention center, Gaslamp district, Horton Plaza, etc. I think we could have walked to Seaport Village too but it would have been a little longer walk.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: S K
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a weekday. I had mentioned that it was out anniversary and we were pleasantly surprised with a bottle of champagne and a card. Great room, great amenities. Love their complimentary wine and tea/ coffee/ hot chocolate hours. The front desk was very helpful. The location is also fantastic- right in the middle of all the gas lamp quarters excitement. My only issue was the steep price for the parking at $36 so we parked at a public parking garage closely. I will be looking at Kimpton hotels for my future vacations - great place with a great style!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Cosy, Friendly and Functional.”
Reviews.Author: FussyButFair01
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for both conferencing in San Diego as it just around the corner from the convention center, as well as holidaying as its in the gas light area. The hotel has more character than a chain hotel and is smaller so the service from the front desk was great. The decor was cosy and a little bit querky. The room had everything you need including a safe (essential), ironing board & iron, hair dryer etc.This hotel feels like some thought has been put into everything to make your stay go well. I will definitely consider staying here again next time I visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Clean and Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Amy H
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at a Kimpton Hotel. I found a deal on a travel site and the price was perfect for the location. The hotel was very clean and the staff were always accommodating to any of our needs or requests. I like that the hotel is consciously green and environmentally friendly as well as being a pet-friendly hotel. The VIP (Very Important Poochies) was a nice touch. Our room was very comfortable and made us feel at home. In addition, the free coffee in the morning and wine in the evening were definitely a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpver
Reviews.Content: First nice and very friendly wellcome, in fact from all the staff who was in charge. Good location and facilities. We were only 2 days on a pre-cruise stay. Positive points: - excellent location in the Gaslamp district - friendly and helpfull staff - clean and well furnished rooms - facilities with nice swimming pool - public area nice, cosy and clean Negative point: - it is only a small one, but we where there on Thanksgiving and the restaurant was closed... even for breakfast that day!!! Agree that in the US it is a public holiday, but an International hotel should always provide the basic facilities even on a public holiday. Conclusion: it is an excellent choice and wud recommend this hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Would be a good hotel, but so uneven I can't recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: jaizee
Reviews.Content: I am re-writing a previous review on this hotel because my previous review was misinterpreted by the hotel in their response to my post. Let me start off by saying that there are a lot of positive things about the hotel. Great location in the heart of the Gaslamp district, if that is where you want to stay. Walking distance to shops, restaurants, ballpark, etc. Also, the staff is incredibly friendly in general. And there are lots of extras, like the happy hour in the lobby every evening, and coffee/tea in the morning.
