Rooms are pretty nice, not extremely luxurious, but there are some touches that put it above an average room, and well-maintained and clean. I wish that my review could end there. However, there were a lot of issues that occurred during our stay there that caused great frustration. The first thing that guests should be aware of is that the rooms are not that well-insulated from the noise from weekend partying. We had a supposedly "quiet" room, and even though our room was away from the main street, it was very loud in our room from the music blasting from the rooftop bar nearby. It kept us until 1 or 2 am! Also, we had some problems with the cable not working in one room, and the pocket doors from the suite not working in another room. It forced us to switch rooms which was inconvenient. But really the final straw is that one day we left our room at noon, REMOVED the "Do Not Disturb" sign from our door, and then came back to our room at 5pm. We called the front desk and said that nothing could be done for us except they could bring fresh towels. They said that it was hotel policy that once the housekeeping passes your room, we would have to make a request to have our room cleaned. We had no idea that housekeeping already passed our room! We were really upset about this. Later another staff person said that they cleaned our rooms early in the morning and then made another pass around our room (before 12 noon) but still saw the DND sign so left us alone. I have stayed at a LOT of hotels, many more than I have time to post about on TripAdvisor, and this has never happened to me - how was I supposed to know what time they went by our room and therefore was supposed to request housekeeping? I think leaving the room at noon is completely reasonable sometimes when you're on vacation - ESPECIALLY when you've been kept up until 1am with noise from the outside. I don't know why it wouldn't be hotel policy to just make sure all the rooms are cleaned until specifically requested otherwise? Very upsetting. The only reason this hotel didn't get two stars is that they handled the situation well afterwards. The front desk manager was very nice and made some appropriate accommodations. Just a final note: I think the parking rate is expensive, but completely within reason for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cute boutique hotel..”
Reviews.Author: JSanico
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice whenever I have to stay overnight in San Diego... Luv this place because it is right smack in Gaslamp District... Brought my friends from Sacramento and LA as well as my sister and cousin on two separate occasions and they like this hotel! Free coffeee. Cool trendy rooms, clean, comfortable beds.. nice views and upgrades... Awesome JSix Restaurant downstairs.. Friendly staff.. Clubs and rows of restaurants and bars are all walking distance... I love this hotel... Price is reasonable and not overinflated... They are environmentally conscious which is cool... Valet parking is a plus plus.. there is parking lot right in front of the hotel but they charge you $20 per day.. Outdoor pool with lounge area and bar is awesome!! Lots of cool things about this hotel and will definitely come back to stay there when im visiting San Deezy

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but not quite our style”
Reviews.Author: Love_Travel_39
Reviews.Content: This is a very trendy and cute boutique hotel, and it has a clean and unique style that we really like. The rooms are nice and the beds are comfortable, but the rooms are just average sized and they don't have suites, so if you like a bigger room to lounge-around in you might think that the rooms are not big enough. The staff is very friendly and professional, and of course the location is what makes this hotel so appealing. The prices at the Solamar can be quite high sometimes, so if you are just looking for a decent place in the Gaslamp district I would recommend checking out the many Hilton and Marriott hotels also located throughout the Gaslamp, because they often have much better prices. Hotel prices in San Diego fluctuate *dramatically* depending on the time of year, tourist season, and when the city is less full vs. the times it gets booked-up due to a large convention or major sporting event, so if the timing of your trip is flexible and the prices seem surprisingly high you might want to check the hotel prices for different possible times that work for you. The Solamar has a wine hour every evening, which is a nice thing to offer, and the wine was fine, but there wasn't quite enough room for all of the people so it was a little on the crowded side, and they shut that wine bar down the very second the scheduled hour is over. They also have a rooftop bar at night, out where the pool is, and we were looking forward to enjoying a drink there at the end of our day, but it was definitely not our scene - it was crowded with people in their 20's, dressed to get attention, dramatic and flirty, and the music they had was loud pumping club music. It was interesting people watching, but it was not our thing so we left after one quick drink. If you like a trendy place, in a great location, and might enjoy the club scene at their rooftop bar this would be a great place for you. If you are just looking for a nice clean place right in the middle of the Gaslamp district this can be a great choice, except for the fact that at times the prices at the Solamar are much higher than the other perfectly nice standard hotels nearby. If you are looking for a hotel with suite or a really big room, and you plan to spend a significant part of your day in your room I would not recommend the Solamar.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great time”
Reviews.Author: HankHenry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a staycation while we went out to the gaslamp with friends, since its just walking distance from restruants and bars. Beds are awesome, staff is friendly and helpful. The only thing that we didn't like is that charges from parking and mini-bar were quite high. But after a exciting night in the Gaslamp its a wonderful relaxing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: BSS9878
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. We had such a nice stay (my husband, myself, and our 5-year-old daughter). The staff is very friendly and helpful, the hotel has a relaxed, comfortable, stylish vibe, the location is superb (near pretty much everything), and we booked a Beat the Holidays Blues rate over Thanksgiving weekend, which was super competitive. I really have no complaints. Some people I spoke with said their rooms were noisy over the weekend but we did not have that problem, possibly because our room faced the pool rather than the street. I loved the complimentary NY Times and coffee in the lobby early in the morning and my daughter appreciated the free hot chocolate. She also loved the pool. On our last night we got some food from a couple of spots on Fifth Avenue and ate at one of the lobby tables. It was extremely comfortable and very easy and a lot less expensive than ordering room service. The only down side to this hotel is the expensive valet parking ($36/day) but that is probably not all that unusual for a downtown property.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Naccles Posted by a Cheaphotels.com.au traveler
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel as it was in a very convenient location. It had a lovely pool and excellent service with friendly staff. The complimentary drinks in the foyer were a nice gesture. My only complaint is that we only had one night there. I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bathroom needed some tlc”
Reviews.Author: mecanoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location in the Gaslamp district-plenty of bars and restaurants. It was a little loud in the evening on the weekends. The room was nice and stylish as we are used to seeing at other Kimpton hotels. The bathroom, however, really could have used a good cleaning and probably new grout to have made it feel as nice as the room (and rate we paid) deserved.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the centre of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Anonyma-NL
Reviews.Content: We love San Diego and the Solamar is our favorite hotel in San Diego. Excellent location, friendly staff and wonderful rooms and interior. The wine reception at the reception (end of every afternoon) is not bad either (great wines!). Our daughter just loved the pool. It's not a cheap place but worth every dollar! The only bad point was our wake-up call to catch our flight early in the morning. The reception made a mistake and we did not receive our call. Just bring your own alarm clock.

Reviews.Title: “discourtesy to "mature" guest”
Reviews.Author: Nancy S
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for myself and for my staff after a nice stay several years ago. Purpose of stay was a business meeting in San Diego. On check-in, the front desk person repeatedly called me "dearie." I didn't say anything at the time, but the comment is umprofessional, condescending, ageist and sexist. I doubt he would have called a male physician "dude" or "kiddo." Corporate bosses should educate/re-educate personnel to be professional to all guests. I know their target is young-hip professionals but those of us who frequently pay the bills need to be addressed with courtesy. BTW, I am not a grandmotherly type wearing outdated clothes. poorly groomed or decrepit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle W
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very clean with an okay location. For the price I could have stayed closer to the Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: speak2me2k2
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from a three night stay at the Solamar. It is a warm and welcoming hotel with friendly and helpful staff. The hotel is modern and trendy. The lobby is lively and they serve coffee, tea and hot chocolate in the morning with newspapers. In the evening, they have a happy hour with complimentary wine, apple cider or hot toddies. The room was also modern and clean with trendy fixtures and furniture. There is a roof top bar and pool with tented couches and lounges to relax. They are a pet friendly hotel and they welcomed pets with bowls of water and their names on a chalkboard. The location of the hotel was convenient and fun. It is in the historic Gaslamp District which is filled with restaurants and clubs. It is very easy to walk to the convention and the baseball stadium. There is also public transportation and cabs available. It a short ride from the airport...for $18.00 by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “impressive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dawn_St_Charles
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - rooms are clean and nicely appointed, staff are friendly. They have a rooftop bar/lounge near the pool and also a very nice restaurant. Wine is served in the lobby from 5 to 6 each day with mini appetizers for a social hour. The only thing unappealing at this hotel was the fitness room; everything else was very nicely done.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly elegance right in the middle of things”
Reviews.Author: lgreer12
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights while we enjoyed a trip planned around the Packers/Chargers game. The hotel desk help (they're all concierges) can answer anything you ask and make reservations while you wait. They seemed truly interested in our daily plans. Summer=Petco Park. Fall=Qualcomm Stadium. Balboa Park is an easy bus or trolley ride away, and you don't need to leave the Gaslamp Quarter to find lots to do. Shops, boutiques, restaurants and bars all easy to walk to, but check out the lounge and restaurant within the hotel! Hotel breakfasts are usually time consuming and ordinary, but this one is efficient with lovely & delicious food. Our server poured my juice from a carafe at the table--nice! The lounge was hopping at night, and there is an outdoor, 4th-floor bar with tables, cabanas, TVs and great service. STAY HERE !!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel near lots of restaurants”
Reviews.Author: baseball_dad
Reviews.Content: Very pleased by my quick 1-night stay here for a convention at the nearby San Diego Convention center. The rooms were stylishly appointed as are the lobby and bar/restaurant. Tons of nearby restaurants within walking distance. Solamar does something that I think every hotel should do: the shower has refillable soap, shampoo and conditioner dispensers mounted on the wall. I've always thought those little soap bars and shampoo bottles were a big waste. I would definitely go back here and wish I had more time to check out the fitness center and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place”
Reviews.Author: oc_bear
Reviews.Content: The Kimpton chain knows how to treat its guests right at whatever location you visit them; hotel Solamar is no exception. From the moment you arrive you feel welcome. The staff is friendly and goes out of their was to help. The hotel is in a good location near Petco Park and the Gaslamp District. It is ecco friendly which is always a plus. They have free coffee and tea in the morning, lemonade at 2:00pm and complimentary wine with hors d'oeuvres at 5:00pm. If you belong to their In Touch Program you get to raid the mini-bar for $10 worth of goodies, and also free internet. The only down side is the parking as it is $36 per night. I have a hybrid car so parking is half price. I highly recommend Hotel Solamar when visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - staff outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Bongo_Craigy
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our short stay in San Diego - everyone had told us we would have fun in San Diego and we did! The Hotel Solamar is in a good central location very close to the convention centre, Petco park and close to lots of shops and restaurants. Our room was very nice overlooking the swimming pool - we stayed midweek and it was very quiet. We had cocktails at the pool bar which were very nice and we took advantage of the very popular 5pm wine! We asked the staff for advice on where to go and what to do in San Diego, and also what restaurants to go to and they were incredibly helpful! I was showered with tourist leaflets and information and we ate in a great Mexican on the staff's advice.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seattle1313
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with this hotel. The room was huge, the lighting was very nice, the bathroom was fully equipped including a jetted tub. I ate lunch and then breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel and the food was amazing. I am a picky traveler and this met all of my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: canmac1617
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location right in heart of downtown district and an easy walk to all amentities. Room is very nice and spacious with internet. Bed is fantastic with awesome linens. Happy hour for guests is a nice touch. Only downside is valet parking is required and expensive. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “En el corazón de San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SusGS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel as part of a wonderful California trip. Friendly front desk staff, they even tried to speak in spanish. Good size rooms, super clean and modern. The only negative point, was that the room was overlooking the swimming pool, and it was a bit noisy. Good hotel good location,walking distance from the main restaurants area

Reviews.Title: “Polished Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa P
Reviews.Content: I randomly ran across the Solamar after an airport (flight delays) nightmare. I had originally planned to stay with friends in gaslamp, but after my adventure I just wanted to stay in my own space. The Solamar is centrally located right in all the action. I was able to walk everywhere all weekend! Loved it! The hotel was really chic and up to date. I loved the polish look to it. The employees were extremely professional and polite. I came in without a reservation, completely exhausted and the front desk staff was so helpful. The rooms are a bit smaller, but it is considered a boutique hotel. The bathroom was perfect! Nicer brand of shampoo and soap set. Also, if you forget certain items, they will bring them to you for FREE. Even use of a strait iron!! There are so many perks to this hotel! I will be staying there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a so-so city”
Reviews.Author: RamblingShirley
Reviews.Content: I met my son in Southern California in mid-October. We both wanted to visit San Diego and chose the Gas Lamp District based on Trip Advisor reviews. We also chose the Solamar for its great reviews and the fact that I am a Kimpton Rewards member and love the Kimptons. We loved the hotel with its cool pool area and great decor. Beds are amazingly comfortable and rooms are spacious. The only drawback is the weekend party scene at the pool bar area on the weekends. I was fortunate to asked to be moved and as the hotel was not full, they moved me to a quieter room on the side away from the pool. We found San Diego to be very touristy with mostly chain restaurants and convention type attractions with no authenticity or charm. We did love a little side trip out to Coronado Island. Would recommend the Solamar highly but probably won't go back to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “The people make this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly1130
Reviews.Content: I want to express my sincere thanks to the entire Hotel Solarmar staff, and especially Erica and Joseph at the front desk, for the most wonderful stay. It was my first occasion traveling with my dog to at Kimpton hotel and it couldn't have gone more smooth. The beds are comfortable, the room is stylish, and the hotel even provides dog bed and food/water bowls. At EVERY level the staff were friendly, accommodating and helpful, and I am looking forward to my next stay with you, which I expect will be soon. Five stars plus!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I cannot say enough about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: caffeitalia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last week of a 3 week holiday in California. This may have been the best hotel stay in my entire life, and certainly on this trip. The hotel obviously is aiming to go out of it's way to please it's guests and aim for return customers. I often joked with my wife that I felt like I could walk up to the front desk and ask for anything and my wish would be granted. First of all, the room: Perfect. We asked for a "quiet" room, an absolute must in this hotel. There are rooms facing the pool which will keep you up nights. y asking for a "quiet room" you will not have this problem. Our room faced the Gaslamp area, there was a nightclub across the street, but the room had some type of sound insulation so I didn't really hear any music from the outdoor nightclub. The bed was great, comfy chairs, and a minibar fridge I kept food in without any trouble. The pool area is fantastic. Every day I sat at the pool in a free cabana, read the paper, a book, or used the free internet service. At times I was alone at the pool, enjoying a drink or just cold water. There is a pool waitress but she doesn't bug you. At 5 pm everyday they have free wine. I usually got a glass, brought it to my room, and saved it for my wife, who was at a convention till 6 or 7 pm. One night she arrived at the wine tasting at 6:05 pm, they had closed, so the desk gave her coupons for 2 free glasses at the restaurant. THe service aspect is extraordinaire! I went to a number of amazing restaurants in San DIego (including the hotel's). A few times I brought back leftovers. The next day, I went to the front desk, I asked them to "warm up" the leftovers, and a few minutes later I was handed back the food on a tray with fine china, with utensils and a glass of ice water, all for free! The hotel is in an absolutely perfect spot, near the waterfront, the convention center, Petco Park, and about 300 restaurants in the gas-lamp. It is convenient to use public transportation to get to the zoo, Balboa park, or Seaworld. We liked the Solamar so much, when our trip was supposed to end, I went to the front desk and inquired about extending our stay for 2 extra days. The manager let us stay in the same room, and gave us a discounted rate due to our loyalty. I will stay at Kimpton hotels from now on and the Solamar whenever I return to San DIego. My wife often has business in San DIego and I look forward to accompanying her on future trips and we will definitely be staying at Solamar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Some Drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: jessicajds
Reviews.Content: As a DC area resident, I'm a fan of the Kimpton properties. The Solomar has some great pros and a few cons, which may be significant to you. Pros: Perhaps the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in - soft, but supportive; The decor (in the room and hotel) is very modern; An amazing number of electrical outlets, which is such a pleasure (usually I have to crawl under desks or unplug lamps); The windows actually open to get fresh air!!!!!!; Lots of mirrors; The location is great - just a block from the Gaslight District, and a few blocks from the Convention Center; The pool has a very cool vibe, and you can borrow towels to take to the beach; A VERY friendly and helpful staff. Cons: The modern bathroom sink has a high faucet and shallow sink, which means that water will ALWAYS splash on you/your clothes; The sink counter is simply too high for shorter people (I am 5'3") so it's very hard to use; The room had a musty smell; There is no coffee maker in the room - only in the lobby - so if you need coffee before you face people for the day, you're out of luck; The room could really use more lights; No dresser (but large closet); Not enough staff at the pool bar/restaurant so you have to wait a long time to get served.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and even better staff”
Reviews.Author: SharonAJ
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a West Coast trip which ended with 5 nights in San Diego. We wanted a nice hotel in a good location with a pool where we could relax at the end of a busy trip and this ticked all the boxes. The room was amazing, nice decor and very comfy bed and the staff really made it. Great advice, helpful directions and a genuine customer focus yet informal and welcoming. The pool area is very nice and great for a city hotel but the location is perfect - right in downtown and easy walking to the marina area and loads of restaurants. The evening free wine service between 5 and 6 is a nice touch as is the comp coffee and tea in the mornings. I would stay here again and has also made me think that I would try another Kimpton hotel when travelling in the US. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Love staying here!”
Reviews.Author: guccichik
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here a few different times and they are accommodating under any circumstances. Whether you bring your children, your pet, or just yourself the hotel staff would do anything for you. The Kimpton Group is always our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Theresa P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Hotel Solamar several times. Our most recent stay was on our honeymoon. We knew we were going to get married in San Diego and we knew we were going to stay at the Solamar. The rooms are gorgeous, clean and so comfortable. From the moment you pull up into the valet parking all the way to check-in, check-out and all the time in between, the staff is wonderful, courteous, helpful, knowledgeble and friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel if your staying in San Diego. My husband and I are planning to spend our one year anniversary at the Solamar.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: DelfromLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed as a Brit tourist visiting San Diego for the first time. Quite a funky and cool hotel and certainly value for money, even as a room only rate. Just one street from the main action in the happening 5th street of gas lamp area restaurants and bars. Great rooftop bar at the hotel. Quite a poor gym, feels like it's only there to get the extra star. Room was very good, clean and welcoming. Staff were very helpful. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Top-Notch Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MattRiley164
Reviews.Content: Hosted a 100-person meeting here, and the staff was the best I've seen in years. Walked to the baseball stadium for a game, had a great reception on the rooftop pool deck, and took a group of about 20 out each night for cheap dinners in the gaslamp. Highly recommend Solamar for meetings or personal travel.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff was amazing! So was the location”
Reviews.Author: Laura C
Reviews.Content: My husband decided to go to San Diego for a last minute concert and stayed at the Solamar for the fiorst time. Our room was great and the bed sheets fabulous. The pool on the roof was really different with great staff. There is not enough space to mention all th amenities. Great Stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Excellent Room”
Reviews.Author: Charles B
Reviews.Content: My stay at Solamar was great! I got this hotel on Priceline with no real expectations, but was pleasantly surprised. I can honestly say that when I travel to San Diego for work or play I will be staying there again. It was a great room for the price and right in the heart of downtown. The rooms are very tidy and I love the boutique hotel atmosphere. The pool and outside bar area are a great place to hangout with reasonably priced drinks. The staff was truly wonderful and always ready to help or offer advice on where to eat. The only reason I did not give the place full 5’s is that the cost to park, at the hotel is outrageous. Try and find a place a block or two away for less than half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Floatie
Reviews.Content: Great location to everything. Can walk to all the restaurants, bars and a shopping mall in the Gaslamp District. The room was very nicely decorated with a very comfortable bed. The only thing I didn't like was the bathroom sink. It looked very trendy: square, above counter mounted, but so shallow the water went everywhere and trying to shave was very challenging. Free internet if you sign up with Kimpton. The pool area on the 4th floor rooftop was very nice with a great bar area and lots of seating. The hotel had a complementary wine hour in the lobby area which was a very nice touch. My only complaint would be the valet only parking at $36/night. Very expensive. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel great location but avoid rip off mini bar!”
Reviews.Author: SteveM114
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and room in perfect location. Front desk staff polished and smart. Only downside was that Jose in particular really didn't want to do any more than the bare minimum for us when asked to, which was a shame as it tainted our view of the hotel. Kimpton are guilty of shamelessly ripping their customers off with a 12 dollar charge for 2 bottles of water left in our room. Would love to hear them justify that, but that's a minor point and all in all this is a good hotel with a nice pool area too.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy!”
Reviews.Author: Corey13
Reviews.Content: My company booked these rooms - beds were lumpy, noisy and uneven. I'm glad I live within 20 miles and will probably sleep at home tonight. Totally unimpressed from the minute I sat on the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DB629
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. The location is in the Gaslamp District which is all restaurants, shops and pubs/bars and has a great atmosphere. I had rented a car because I thought it would be the best way to get around, but we walked to lunch and dinner every day. The breakfast place across the street is definitely worth going to as well! PetCo Park is only a few blocks away, and even though it was convenient to drive to the zoo and for a day trip to La Jolla, we could definitely have gotten away with walking or cabs. If you do rent a car, there is a lot across the street from the hotel that charges a little less than the hotel parking fees. As for the hotel itself, I loved the design of the rooms and the common areas. Everything is very modern and up to date.The atmosphere is very comfortable and welcoming. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. The complimentary wine hour was something I had never seen before and thought was great. The pool area was very nice as well. I loved this hotel so much that I booked a room for a night out in the city at home (NYC) just for fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: zonemanDanville
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Solamar during a business trip in early September. This is a classy little hotel that lives up to Kimpton standards. They have a free wine tasting every night between 5 and 6 p.m. They also have a terrific restaurant on premesis, and a nice area in the lobby for reading the paper or enjoying your wine. They also have free coffeee each morning. The rooms are nice, and if you join their loyalty club, the wifi is free. The room I stayed in was very clean, had a well stocked refreshment center, and the bed was great. The corner suites are especially nice. They have a nice rooftop bar on the 4th floor, which is a terrific people watching spot. The staff was friendly and courteous, and Angel at the front desk was especially helpful. I would recommend this hotel for either a baseball trip to visit Petco, or simply for business. It is adjacent to the Gaslamp district, and is directly across the street from the Palm restaurant. The hotel is pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “first time visit; I would go again”
Reviews.Author: scottybod
Reviews.Content: right in the center of the Gaslamp district. Friendly, efficient staff; lovely room; VERY comfortable bed; tiny workout area; EXPENSIVE parking, but it was almost as bad in external parking facilities; Pool area gorgeous;

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: counselk5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Solamar as part of a business trip for my husband. The hotel was selected by his professional organization. When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised by several things which we felt were unique to this place. First of all, the hotel is "pet friendly." The names of the visiting pets are posted on a chalkboard at the entrance of the hotel. A charming touch that added to the warmth of this place. Every person working in the hotel from the valet to the manager were pleasant and friendly in a way that seemed geniune. Every evening they hosted a free wine tasting. The pool was like a spa. It was clean and surrounded by comfortable loung chairs and tented areas where you could just sit and read or lie down and rest. The rooms were spacious and nicely appointed. The bed was super comfortable and the windows actually opened. This was really nice as the evenings were cool enough to have fresh air coming in. In addition, the hotel was located in a part of town that allowed easy access to the water, shopping, restaurants and transportation. We will stay here again and will seek other Kimpton properties in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent San Diego Gaslamp Quarter Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Seamo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Solamar for a two-night stay and enjoyed both the Gaslamp Quarter location and the hotel itself. Having handed over car parking duties to the valet (at $36 pn the one irritation with the Solamar, to be honest) check-in went smooothly & professionally and we made our way up to our room on the 9th floor, high up with a view as requested as part of the online booking. We both thought the room was first-rate, with a lovely & comfortable large bed, great decor, good quality furniture & fittings, plus a large, clean, well-finished bathroom. No coffee maker but there was a fridge and the wi-fi internet was quick and easily accessed. We didn't eat in the hotel but we did avail ourselves of the wine reception on the first evening and it was lovely to sit in the beautiful lobby area in comfortable arm-chairs drinking a couple of glasses of very acceptable Californian wine. The hotel location is great for the restaurants on Fifth Avenue a short walk away and we also made the short stroll to admire Petco Park on the final morning. Driving up to Balboa Park was also easy. In summary, we enjoyed our stay at the Solamar - Margot liked the 'ambience' - and should we return to San Diego in the future we would probably stay here again, perhaps even catch a Padres game!

Reviews.Title: “Nice large hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trav34268
Reviews.Content: I'm not usually a fan of large chain hotels-however Solamar did not disappoint. It doesn't have the small touches of a boutique hotel but I couldn't fault it for what it did offer. It's right central in the middle of downtown sunny San Diego. Plenty of restaurants and bars surrounding it. Plenty of shops surround it as well. Most of the tourist stuff is within a very short taxi ride, such as the ZOO and seaworld. The tourist stuff in downtown such as the USS midway ect is only a short walk away. Petco park (MBL) is half a block walk and a great way to spend a relaxing night watching the Padres. The front desk staff were helpful and polite. The room its self was massive. It was clean and spacious. There was wine tasting every night. The only down side to the hotel is the noise from the pool area. I'm not talking about during the day, but the night. On a Friday and Saturday night it can really kick off down there. We were on the 7th floor overlooking the pool and it was very noisy with loud music, people yelling and screaming ect...however we were aware this was going to be an issue after reading all the other posts on trip advisor and accepted it. If you have small kids or hate noise you may want to request a room that doesn't overlook the pool. Overall great hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Gas in the Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: Golfman44
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Solamar in the Gaslamp district in San Diego is an absolute gem. Fairly priced, nicely decorated, and great ambiance. Wine and light fare at 5 O'clock are an outstanding touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous staff - but when San Diego party's it's LOUD!”
Reviews.Author: roberts1892
Reviews.Content: Truly excellent hotel with really helpful staff. Fabulously located for the Gaslamp District and Petco Park. Good sized comfortably furnished rooms and well up to 4* standard. Only one problem and really there is nothing the hotel can do about it, other than move! Now my wife and I are pretty well travelled across the US and have stayed in hotels in many of the major 'tourist' cities (NY, Chicago, LA, SF, Las Vegas etc etc) but never have we heard so much ambient noise in our room as at this hotel. Even with earplugs in (helpfully provided by reception) I was woken at 1am in the morning by dance music blasting from the nearby clubs and bars and was unable to get back to sleep until they shut and the revellers dispersed by about 2.30. So if you are in San Diego for a lively weekend this location is genuinly perfect.... If you're clubbing days are mainly in your past it's not ideal. So would I stay here again Sunday to Thursday? Like a shot. Friday and Saturday after a long flight, probably not!

Reviews.Title: “Offered more than Hotel Del, except the views”
Reviews.Author: beach2mountains
Reviews.Content: Stayed here then transferred to the Del for a few days. The Solamar has hard working employees, good location, great rooms with lots of space, lots of amenities, great bathroom, jacuzzi tub in the room, excellent pool/ bar area on the roof, and an excellent in hotel restaurant. We found the room to be nicer, and offer more than an oceanfront room at the Del, though the view, of course, cannot compare.Every request made was handled perfectly, with the special, sometimes quirky, touch that a Klimpton Hotel usually provides. We had a minor issue with the room temp and asked it to be fixed. When we returned to the room the temp was great, and the maintenance man left a chocolate wrench and a personal note that the problem was fixed. This place provided all of this with a room base rate below 170, a fraction of the Del.

Reviews.Title: “Family and pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: apn2596
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here while in town for a wedding in Aug. The hotel was very nice, clean, centrally located near the Convention Center. The lobby felt luxurious. The staff was friendly and helpful. Best of all was the hotel's pet friendly policy, which allowed us to take our puppy with us. Overall a great hotel. We would come back to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “early Sept visit”
Reviews.Author: MBKNJ
Reviews.Content: Just spent Tues - Fri here with mixed reviews. Generally positive. The power outage occurred Thurs afternoon and the hotel staff did a very good job under the circumstances. On the more mundane front, room wasn't ready at 2:00 pm, pool area had what looked like the previous evening's drinks residue in the late afternoon, no service at the pool whatsoever (called begging for water and or ice/tea and several pitchers were finally brought to the bar, but no other service), no light at all at the desk area and very dim light in the bath, no soap - only large refillable bottles of gel (a purely personal dislike admittedly), used water glasses not removed by housekeeping, greyish thin towels in bath. Bed needs more and better pillows. All minor issues, but all detract from an overall positive experience and could be quickly cured by an attentive management team.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: aszurh
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel the night before leaving for San Diego. It's in a great location and you can literally walk to everything. The staff is super accommodating (thank you Katie & Erika) and had great suggestions for things to do in the city as well as restaurants. The pool was a lot of fun definitely try the skinny pina colada's (deadly). The hotel is walking distance to Petco park so easy to walk over to see a game. I would suggest that they bump up the lobby and lounge area. It's very dark and uninviting. Needs more lighting and brighter furniture possibly open up the space too many walls. The rooms are nice, ample size, great view from 7th floor, they changed out the sheets to hypoallergenic for me, and great modern decor. The hotel is pet friendly at NO COST!!! Great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelwriter1usa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very beautiful and in a good location down town.The problem with the restaurant was the number of working ladies (very attaractive and well dressed), that appeared to drop in looking for customers. We mentioned it to the manager and he ignored us completely which left us with a very negative vibe even though the food, service and beverages were excellent.The pool area in the evening was used almost exclusively for socializing by the young up and coming business professionals of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pjvmorgan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights - the room was great, and the staff were very friendly. It's also right in the heart of downtown - a 2 minute walk and you're in the gaslamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, stayed an extra night..”
Reviews.Author: DrJMacQ
Reviews.Content: Booked at the last minute via a quick search on the internet...turned out to be a really great hotel. Staff were excellent really helpful and genuine, got an upgrade when we checked in and liked the hotel so much we decided to stay an extra night! Didn't have breakfast in the hotel as the location is perfect, a lot of cafes, bars and restaurants on the doorstep. Had room service one night which was disappointing (value and taste not so great) but apart from that it truly was a top hotel! Good mini-bar, super clean, big rooms, comfortable bed, good for business and vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “What an wonderful place; great location and a gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Casualfamilytraveler
Reviews.Content: On a whim, my wife and I decided to get away to San Diego for a couple days. The Solamar was about the same price as everything in the area we wanted to be (near Petco Park). What a pleasant surprise when we arrived and entered the lobby. This place has subtle elegance at every turn. The bed was wonderful, the room was nice. About the only complaint I could must was the extremely high prices for their snack bar items, but that's a stretch of a complaint given that every hotel does this. If you like to walk, one mile or less in most any direction will have you passing by a few good restaurants, a nice park, the waterfront, or pretty much anything you could seek (I guess that would include hundreds of bars for the more decadent lifestyle). Petco Park is amazing even for those of us who aren't the biggest baseball fans. It draws a fun crowd and the adjacent city park is a nice place to spend part of your day. If you are there to hike, we found several great trails within a ten-mile drive (Torrey Pines Reserve was our favorite). The staff was quite pleasant and the feel was very warm. Thanks for a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would go back in heart beat”
Reviews.Author: Harvey_Ellie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good. Great location in the gas lamp quarter which has loads of great bars and great restaurants. The room itself was very clean, large and very modern. If you want great service, great location and a very reasonably priced hotel this is for you. The breakfast at the broken yolk a few doors down the street was amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: PickyglobetrotterUk
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean and stylish. Great location, 10 mins walk to conference centre, 10 mins into main gas lamp area.

Reviews.Title: “Bring some Ambien if you want some sleep”
Reviews.Author: Karen P
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay here for our first trip to San Diego because of the photos on-line (cool decor) & the location. Our reservation was for 5 nights but we checked-out after 3 because we couldn't take the pounding noise of what sounded like raves (on weeknights?) until after 2:00am. One of the parties was at the hotel next door with the Buddha on the roof; not sure if the others were coming from Hotel Solamar poolside lounge or somewhere else but it was close enough to cause our headboard to vibrate. We didn't complain but we thought when we checked-out 2 days early they would ask how our stay was or ask why we were leaving earlier than planned but they didn't ask. With taxes & parking we paid almost $1,000 for 3 nights of this insanity. The decor & location of this hotel did not disappoint but if you choose to stay here bring sleeping pills & ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: onajetplaneDenton
Reviews.Content: As I have come to expect from a Kimpton property my stay was excellent. We were in town the week of my husband’s birthday. Upon entering the room we discovered a nice note and bottle of wine from the staff wishing him a happy birthday. It is these little touches that make Kimpton the best.

Reviews.Title: “Very busy area, buzzy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edsmum984
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a great start here - they had got the reservation wrong so we had to sort this out via the UK before we arrived, and when we arrived one of our rooms wasn't ready for an hour and a half. They did however credit us $50 for this and I appreciated that. The valet guys are fantastic. The reception staff are charming but stretched (this was the weekend tho so that might explain it). Rooms are comfy if not massive, beds are exceptional. The hotel has a hip, buzzy vibe and the Gaslamp quarter is very busy which was a bit of a shock to us - with two kids and after a long drive, Saturday night in the quarter is a bit of a culture shock. But we found a great sports-bar type place attached to Nicky Rotten's (?) which did us a great family meal. If you're into partying (and probably don't have kids although ours seemed to get used to it pretty quickly!) this hotel would be a blast to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER GREAT KIMPTON HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: QUEENIE_ELLE
Reviews.Content: In January 2011 I went on a Friends & Family vacation on Amtrak from San Francisco all the way to Rosamar, Rosarito Beach, Baja. Along the way I stayed at: The Huntley in Santa Monica, my step-daughter's, THE SOLAMAR, friend's in Rosamar, the Marriott Resort at Laguna Hills and The Hollywood Roosevelt. It was a grand adventure! I LOVE TRAVELING BY AMTRAK........ I earned over 2 MILLION MILES with American Airlines, all butt miles as I traveled 3 times a month for over 20 years......... Now, I go to the airport when I want to! Of all the hotel stays, THE SOLOMAR was the best. I think the room was around $125.00 plus tax. The size, decor, amenities and staff were the best. The room was really nicely decorated in a lush, comfortable contemporary fasion. Even the robe was special. It was an animal print....zebra, tiger, a la the San Diego Zoo. Their restaurant was very nice with very delicious breakfast choices. It was large, spacious and airy. Accommodating staff earned multiple stars for attentive, friendly service. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. Easy walking distance to hot spots, great trans to zoo and Globe Theater. Nice cafes fro brekkies, lunch and dinner. Shopping is very good too and close to FedEx for less expensive computer use.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: heiditrekking
Reviews.Content: The manager's reception was very nice! The hotel is located downtown near all the restaurants and bars. Lots of great options! On Friday/Saturday nights, the streets were lined with young people going out on the town. Staff at the hotel were great and the rooms were nice, clean and quiet. Of course you will need a rental car to get to the beaches. I like the Kimpton chain of hotels. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Fidge9
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here and found it to be over-priced. The rooms were large and comfortable, as was the bed. The staff were well-informed and pleasant. Our main issue was that you had to pay for EVERYTHING. Want to use a the business centre? Pay. Forgot some toiletries? Pay (although some were free). Want to get your car from the valet? Tip. Want the bottle of water on the desk in your room? Pay. $6 actually - what a rip off. How simple and welcoming would it be to give to bottles of water to each room?? The laundry was also very expensive as far as I recall. The location of the hotel is very handy. You are in walking distance of many good bars, restaurants, sites and the Padres stadium. Unfortunately the costs just kept racking up and we felt that the hotel did not warrant the price. We would consider other hotels the next time we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “I'd you're really sure you want to stay in the Gaslamp Quarter and willing to sacrifice Sleep for location, go ahead and stay at”
Reviews.Author: ifjewel
Reviews.Content: Bottom line, Hotel Solamar was not a great choice for us. We were in SD to run the AFC half marathon and were unfortunately staying in a room next door to a wedding party. Nothing could be done to quiet the crowd. The hotel did comp us the night, which was nice of them. I chose the hotel because I love their pet policy and their Fire and Sky resort in AZ. Solamar is no Fire and Sky. As a downtown hotel, it lacks the same grounds and amenities. Service was ok. We were stunned to find that the gong rate for parking was $36 per night and were told by one valet that they would be really busy on Sunday, when we were checking out, due to a ballgame. Not sure what he expected us to do about that. Again, it is the location. If you aren't in the Gaslamp to party, I'd recommend another area and another hotel. If you are there to run a race, seriously consider another.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego's Finest”
Reviews.Author: Colin C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Solamar during our week long stay in San Diego. We were made to feel very welcome on our arrival our room was not ready for us so we were directed to the pool area and given vouchers for free drinks whilst we waited for our room. We were initially offered rooms on the 4th floor which is the same level as the pool which also is the bar area The staff were quite forth coming in informing me that it could get a bit noisy in the evenings especially at the weekends, so we opted to change to a room on the 7th floor overlooking the pool/bar area and noise was not a problem at all. The Solamar is set in the historic Gaslamp area of San Diego with plenty of restaurants and bars in the area in addition to the hotels facilities. The prices in the areas vary the Old Spaghetti House offered great value for money on the higher price side Donavans Prime Seafood was expensive but first class dinning for breakfast in addition to the hotel try the Broken Yoke one block down. Rooms at the Solamar were comfortable free coffee was available in the lobby in the mornings with water and juices at other times. Parking is the main draw back in the area there is some public parking in the area as well as some on street however overnight parking was not readily available and where it was this was expensive so the $36 a night valet parking was reasonable value for hotel guests. The valet parking guys were friendly and helpful and always asked if you needed any directions when handing over your vehicle. The hotel offered a small pool area which in addition to sun loungers there was also a few cabanas available. So the big question is would I stay there again yes I would and would I recommend the Solamar to family and friends the answer to that is yes again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Dominic37
Reviews.Content: Just returned and had a great time! The room was big and very comfortable for the 3 of us. The pool was fantastic. Yes, it was busy and full of young 'trendy' people but this did not prevent us from using the pool and poolside bar. Our son had other youngsters to play with and they were warmly welcomed around the pool area. ALL staff at the hotel were very friendly, polite and could not be more helpful! The location of this hotel was perfect................right in the centre of the Gaslamp quarter..................ideal for all attractions. Would very much recommend!! We didn't use the restaurant, spa or fitness centre so cannot comment on these.

Reviews.Title: “Cool property,great location, fair prices incredible staff!”
Reviews.Author: Purpletravelor
Reviews.Content: My house had a leak and I had to be relocated. My Insurance company suggested Hotel Solamar. I said why not. I was a liitle worried it would be too fancy. After dealing with the mess at home I came in late on a friday night. It was busy loud and really intimadating. I instantly was greeted with one of the warmest and friendliest smiles from the front desk manager Kelsey. I informed her I was checked in and she was already aware of my problem. She even gave me and girlfriend a bottle of wine to show that they understood it wasnt easy just getting up and leaving my house for a few days. This kind gesture made all the difference in the world. After the brief but calming interaction I promise my girlfriend we had to write a review based soley on that interaction. We got to our room which was really nice, a little small but suitable. During our stay we enjoyed being able to venture out and eat and have a bevarage or two and not have to worry about driving home since everything was so close. This was a great stay and everyone was very pleasant. Solamar should be proud of their staff and property. I have repeated this story to many of my friends who plan on visiting us. The only problem was how noisey it is on the weekends and the unsavory characters who hang out near by.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Poliwhirl
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at this hotel but came away just satisfied rather than excited or overly pleased. First impressions were not good, the front desk staff couldn't get his pc to work and was more interested in taking a call rather than completing my check-in which i really didn't appreciate after an 11hr flight from the UK and all i wanted was to get to my room. Room was OK, nothing special, i had booked online a virtuoso suite and now realise, having just looked at the hotel website that I was DOWNgraded! I got a deluxe guest room with 2 queen beds for the same price! Valet car parking is expensive but you can park in an open lot reasonably cheaply directly opposite the hotel. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as it was not included in the room rate preferring to find a diner in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KellyN
Reviews.Content: We recently spent on night at the Hotel Solamar and wished we could have spent 7. Where to start? The stylish, hip design made us wish we could re-decorate our house at home. The staff were fantastic (especially the bartender by the pool and the front desk). I challenge anyone to find a better rooftop pool and lounge. So relaxing!!! The location couldn't be better - right in the heart of the gaslamp district. We were a bit concerned about the noise outside of the hotel because of the night life location, but our fears were not realized. We couldn't hear a thing The evening wine reception was a lovely surprise. The parking is very, very expensive - $36.00 per night. I don't know if that is standard for the city, but I expected to pay a lot. We had a great breakfast next door at the San Diego chain The Broken Yolk. Good food - great price. We loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Here For Comic Con”
Reviews.Author: Deargoodbye
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for Comic Con because we saw a great rate on their website. We had a great stay! The room was cozy and nicely decorated. We ended up on the 10th floor and while plenty of parties were going on at the hotel, we didn't hear one sound in our room. We were able to check out the pool a few times and it's a very nice area. The pool was perfect temperature wise and there was plenty of lounge chairs. It was a nice little place to relax. The staff was great as well. Everyone we ran into was nothing but helpful and always very friendly and wearing a smile. We really did feel like royalty when we stayed here! We had free wifi since we joined the loyalty program and it was pretty good. It did seem slow at times but that's expected. We didn't have car which meant not having to shell out for parking. Honestly we didn't even need a car! We could walk to everything, including the convention center. If you're staying here for Comic Con or any other convention center event, skip on the car! You'll save yourself a good bit of money! We ordered room service one night and it was fast and tasty! The mini bar and fridge were well stocked but of course a little pricey. All in all, we'd stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MikeMann444
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel with a great ethos. Inviting and comfortable rooms, excellent location and friendly and helpful staff. Also ate the J6, all local and organic produce and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to love it, almost did”
Reviews.Author: Bigdada64
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights during the last week of July 2011. Some things great, a few things need some work. Pros: Great people working valet, desk etc. Half priced valet parking if driving a hybrid car. Very nice morning and happy hour setup in lobby. Great location to lots of activities, food, drink,nightlife right outside the hotel, small but cozy pool area with heated pool, nice loungechairs, towels etc Cons: rooms are adequate but lacking any drawer space. some of the bathrooms favor style over function, ic ouldn't use the sink without splashing everything on the vanity. Lastly, I joined the Kimpton loyalty program with promises of free wifi. Over my entire stay, could never get it working, including using their free sign on for guests. Not a huge deal, but with their business center outsourced to a private company, you have to pay for any computer time beyond printing boarding passes. That's kind of weak

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: omd114
Reviews.Content: Stayed in San Diego for a long weekend and needed a hotel close to the convention center. Hotel Solamar was it and I couldn't have done better. We had a suite and it was perfect. The hotel is in the gaslamp quarter, so easy access to all the restaurants and a minute walk to the convention center. The pool on the fourth floor is a bit small but who needs a pool when you have the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Solamar in San Diego is a class act!”
Reviews.Author: John_Rhodes_55
Reviews.Content: Hotel Solamar in San Diego is a class act! This place is very classy and comfortable. The rooms and bathrooms are luxurious! Very convenient to food, shopping and nightlife. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All-around excellence”
Reviews.Author: CathyTencza
Reviews.Content: We had a party of six in four rooms for five days for a family vacation, and the staff made us feel as though their sole purpose was to make our stay enjoyable. They helped us with accommodations (one of us was in a wheelchair), with travel arrangements, and with dining recommendations. They called our rooms often to see if we needed anything. Each morning, there was coffee/tea and newspapers in the lobby, and each evening, they served complimentary wine and appetizers. The rooms were modern and so nicely decorated; we even took photos of the bathrooms to show to our decorator, who used the same tiles and lighting in a bathroom of our home. All the necessary stuff--room temperature, quiet, cleanliness, etc.--was spot on. We would definitely stay at another Kimpton property on the strength of this visit.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth the Money!”
Reviews.Author: welzeinz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of the Gaslamp District and is easy walking distance to tons of restaurants, shopping, Petco Park, the Convention Center, and many other attractions. The room was clean and beautifully decorated and we had a great view of the downtown area. Breakfast in the restaurant was great. Make sure you hang around (about 5:00 PM, I think) for the complimentary wine hour.

Reviews.Title: “American hotel with an Asian Touch”
Reviews.Author: PoipuKapele
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Solamar in May during a business trip. The decorum was unique and very striking - beautiful Asian accents and modern angles yet very comfortable and inviting. The location was excellent - easy access to many diverse restaurants. LOUNGEsix on the fourth floor was great during the day by the pool and a fun venue for entertaining clients into the evening especially since fireworks were provided by Petco Park after the baseball game.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: GetAwayWhenICan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband, mom and 1 1/2 year old daughter. We were going to Sea World during the day and we wanted to make a weekend out of it. We checked in about 7pm and the valet was very helpful. Hotel is well kept and the staff was friendly. I booked a suite because we were going to need a portable crib and my Mom was staying with us. The room was awfully tiny for a "suite". It did have sliding doors that separating the "living area" with a pull out couch from the bedroom area. It worked out fine in the end, it was just tiny. We went straight downstairs because my daughter was starving. We walked into JSix without a reservation. There were plenty of tables available and seemed like a really slow evening. They were horrible to us ... I had to ask 4 times before we were finally sat. I had to ask random people walking by for water and bread at least. They finally sent over the hostess with a pitcher of water of which she spilled all over the table (no big deal but she obviously was just the hostess ... poor thing). After not being waited on by an actual waiter we ended up leaving. There are plenty other restaurants to go to in the are ... so just make sure you skip this one. My mom went upstairs with my daughter and ordered them room service which she said was perfect and came quickly. :-) When we went to sleep I could hear club music until the early morning and we were on quite a high floor. Nothing they could do ... that is the part of San Diego I chose to stay in but this is just a heads up. My husband and I woke up early and went downstairs for the free coffee in the lobby and a quick smoke. The valet guy ran around looking for a lighter for us. Very nice ... We went for a swim about 10 am and the pool area was nice but was still a mess from the evening bar/club by the pool thing the night before. Only one staff member was casually putting pillow covers back on. Maybe I shouldn't judge as it was only 10 am. Overall it was a nice stay with nice staff but has really small rooms and a horrible somewhat "attached" restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in the gaslight district”
Reviews.Author: StPaulMN
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one week in July 2011, attending a business conference. Hotel staff members were universally friendly and helpful, property was beautifully kept and appointed, and there were many unusual touches. Newspapers, tea, and coffee available each morning in the lobby (followed by iced water in the afternoon and then a one-hour reception with wine and sangria). Many in our group asked for dining suggestions within walking distance and always got clear directions and helpful advice tailored to their needs. Gorgeous bathroom (but note that the designer sinks are a little high, if you're petite, and they've too shallow for "soaking" anything), complimentary robes, and ice readily available. Rooms have hair dryers, irons, and combination safes, with plenty of towels and pillows. Beautiful pool area, too. Convenient to many restaurants and shops, and just two block to the outdoor ballpark. Valet parking is expensive but very convenient and the service was very speedy. Hotel is especially welcoming to doggie visitors, whose names are written on a board at the front entrance, and who also get snacks and special attention. My husband joined me for part of the trip and was equally happy with the hotel. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, rooms and pool in the heart of the Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: AndrewHR
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights for a conference and loved it. Location is right in the middle of the action in the Gaslamp District, the rooms are great and the service excellent. I've never received such a warm welcome and send off from a hotel (thank you Erika!) Even better, the pool and surrounding lounge area is incredible. My only suggestion for improvement would be to add coffee machines and iPod base stations to the rooms (although free coffee, plus a nice selection of free newspapers, are in the lobby every morning). I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Funky rooms and fabulous roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: SBear62
Reviews.Content: The Solamar is a very trendy and funky hotel which I would highly recommend when staying in San Diego. Conveniently located in the gas lamp district, so very close to everything. The rooms are amazingly large and quirky. Great jacuzzi big enough for two and a large walk in shower . We loved our room and the leopard dressing gowns! The terrace and pool are really nice and very happening which you can tell from the clientele. The only downside to this hotel is the somewhat cool service from the bar and restaurant staff. The staff in the entire hotel are very young and it seems there is no manager to run the whole thing which is a real shame as it is a lovely hotel. I have seen these comments before and I just wonder when the management who are never seen are going to act on these comments and employ management staff supervising the reception area, the bar, restaurant and pool areas.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, in a great location, friendly.”
Reviews.Author: tesseract68
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip (at the convention center), and it was my first time staying in a Kimpton Hotel. Overall I was very pleased--the room decor was very stylish, and the bed very comfortable. Even the bathrobes in the room are stylish (leopard print!). The hotel is centrally located with respect to the Gaslamp, restaurants, shopping, and the convention center, so for this trip it was ideal. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the free coffee in the lobby was a nice touch. It was also great to have free wireless (if you sign up to be a Kimpton member, which is no cost). I can see how this place would be fun for a leisure trip, but even for a business trip it was great. It was also more reasonably priced than the other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Babsan01
Reviews.Content: Located in the Gaslamp district and close to Convention Center and base ball stadium.Great restaurant and bar and on 4th floor a bar,pool and cabana seating under the open sky.Just a swinging place at night.Very clean rooms and comfy and super friendly employees.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mgaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Solamar for four nights in June, 2011. We had requested a quiet room on a pet-free floor and that is just what we got. Our room faced away from the pool and we heard no noise at all. The room itself was large, very nicely furnished with a comfy bed and we were very happy with it. The hotel staff were friendly and the free drinks in the lobby in the afternoon were an added bonus. There was also free coffee in the morning and wine in the evening but we did not have either. We joined Kimpton Hotels and that enabled us to have free internet in the room. The hotel was in a good position for walking to restaurants and I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “The Best and Most Chic Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: surplusmarketing
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kimpton Solamar in San Diego for the 2nd time and it just keep getting better here. I was met with kind, courteous, and attentive valet staff. Check-in at the counter was very helpful, professional, and organized. Though i had to wait for my room, when i received my room at 3pm it was spotless and tidy as usual. This is what one should expect from a 4.5-5 star hotel. The lobby of this hotel is amazing. Rich woods, comfortable chairs and sofas, it felt like home or better. There was free water and spritzers in the lobby, which was refreshing in the San Diego summer heat. However, the hotel lobby and rooms are well air-conditioned, making the Solamar a welcoming oasis from normal life. Katie or Kelsie (i think that was her name) was the nicest hotel clerk i've ever met. These people here will do whatever it takes to make your stay top-notch, leaving nothing to chance. I got to stay in the Master Suite this time, and it was worth every penny. Spa tub next to a window, just when does a hotel have that? The Suites could be larger but the price is already at a value. Affordable, not inexpensive but not expensive at all, considering the total package received. I'm a Kimpton In-Touch member and they give you $10 in room service snacks (it's called the "Honor Bar") so i always deduct $10 from the room price. These gestures by the hotel are nice, and nice needs to always be recognized. I totally recommend this Kimpton above all other Kimptons (although i recommend those too that i've stayed at), and definitely over 99% of all other hotels i've stayed at. The beds are super comfy, everything spotless and chic in the hotel, and there is not a single thing i can find wrong with anything the entire time during both my stays. The Solamar deserves a solid 5-star rating, even though it's considered a 4.5 star hotel. Thank you to all the wonderful staff at the Kimpton Solamar. Best Regards, Don

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not kid friendly like they advertise.”
Reviews.Author: aliandluke
Reviews.Content: Staff - friendly and helpful, Jose especially helpful on our check in, when he proceeded to explain the room that I had booked was nothing like what I had been told on the phone! He organsied a room change and I was given credit for the difference. Wendy organised transport to Legoland for us, although I would not recommend the "limousine" company that was used. Beverley's Limousines, the car was in poor condition, seat belts did not work and we had 4 kids with us, he drove with hands off the steering wheel mostly, he stopped for coffee and gas on the way, and talked on his cell a lot of the time, whilst counting money!!! Rooms - do not book the choreographer suite if you have children and want a separate sleeping area or want a quiet holiday away, it is noisy, has no bath and is very close to the night club/pool area! It's not really a nightclub but may as well be. The room itself was really nice if you were a young couple away wanting to Party and entertain in your room. We were moved to a Master suite on the 9th level, which is pet free, and it was great. Clean, big even with the sofa bed, massive tub and separate shower. It was still noisy but not as bad, and very tolerable. Pool - too small, and had more of a nightclub atmosphere. Lots of young people wearing next to nothing, drinking and being loud, not suitable for small children. My kids didn't seem to mind, and the guests in the pool didn't seem to mind having my kids splash around them, but it really isn't kid friendly as they suggest. The pool is too small. The staff around the pool were selective in who they seemed to serve, I never once got asked to order a drink or food, even after one day sitting with a menu for over an hour! I was at the pool every day!! This hotel is advertised as completely non smoking, however, one of the rooms that has the terrace overlooking the pool had guests sitting on the terrace smoking! This ruined my time at the pool. Not sure why there was one set of rules for some people and not others. Location - excellent, even with my two young children. On the whole the hotel is great if you want to party, sit by a pool and drink and have late nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great restaurant, great bar”
Reviews.Author: Geiszlah
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit biased since I had my wedding here in November 2010, but I love me some Kimpton hotels. If you've never stayed at one they all have their own cool, unique design, they are all LEED certified green hotels and they offer a free wine happy hour for guests. Hotel Solmar fits the mold perfectly, with the added benefit of a great location in the heart of San Diego's gaslamp district. You can see Petco Park from the balcony of LoungeSIX - a great place to enjoy a cocktail and watch the sunset over downtown. The J-Six restaurant serves fantastic food - all organically grown and locally sourced. The menu changes by season and their chef makes all of the bread, pastries, pastas, cheeses and sausages himself Some of the best, freshest food you will eat in town. As a boutique hotel this place can be pricey, but not much (if any) more than the Hilton's and Hyatt's in the area. And you get way more for your money here. The rooms are uniquely decorated, with comfortable beds and a big screen TV. Plus the free wine happy hour for guests every day at five probably saves you $20-30 per person per day in drinking costs alone! We're Kimpton converts thanks to this place - whenever we travel we always look to stay at one of their hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: artslover
Reviews.Content: I stayed for six nights. I found the king room which overlooked the pool to be very comfortable. A few details I would note: there is no coffee maker in the room, but there is free coffee in the lobby in the morning. There is a refrigerator mini bar as well as other non-refridgerated treats. There were no drawers in the room but there was a shelf in the closet along with a mini safe. If I had to share, perhaps the shelves for my clothing might have been a bit tight. As a Kimpton In Touch member, I had free wifi in the room. There was a work desk and chair and a large chair for lounging. Bathroom was well appointed with Gilchrist & Soames shampoo, conditioner and shower get. There was a magnified makeup mirror and hair dryer. It was kept spotlessly clean during my stay. The room temperature was easy to control. If it got humid and warm while I was out during the day, turning on the fan quickly had it at a very comfortable temperature. The hotel is good with extras like foam pillows because I'm allergic to feathers. Upon request, I was able to have use of a yoga mat and used the yoga videos provided in addition to the pay movies, etc. on the flat screen tv. Free wine is offered in the afternoon along with a non-alcholic beverage (which I didn't sample). The pool area was rather noisy on Friday and Saturday night, and could be heard in the room with the window closed, but not so noisy I didn't fall asleep. The restaurant does not have a huge menu but I found the food reasonably good and service excellent. I did not try the room service dining. The fitness center next to the pool area is very tiny with free weights and a few machines. The business center charges for internet use but printing boarding passes is free. Not being there for pleasure, I was not concerned about the location but it is close to many restaurants, I could walk (40 minutes) to Balboa Park and it is two blocks to the San Diego Padres' ball park.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wzly76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week while attending a conference based at the hotel. The location in the Gaslamp is wonderful--within walking distance of Petco Park, many greatl restaurants, etc. My room was very quiet, and the bed was wonderfully comfortable. My only complaints about the room are that (1) there are no drawers to unpack into (who wants to live out of a suitcase for a week? I ended up stacking clothes on a shelf in the closet), and (2) the lighting is abysmal. The bathrooms are inexcusably dark, and the lighting in the rooms themselves needs improvement. Lighting also was an issue in the lobby area (really dark, not what you expect in SoCal), and the rooms where we had our lectures had inadequate lighting. Kind of depressing, actually. All in all, a pleasant, if not ideal stay. I did enjoy the pool, although on Saturdays and Sundays the clientele and vibe at the pool change completely...it becomes something of a loud meat market, with lots of surgical enhancements parading around in skimpy suits . . . parents were getting their children out of there in a hurry!

Reviews.Title: “The Solamar was a wonderfully charming hotel with the best staff possible.”
Reviews.Author: LedbetterLodge
Reviews.Content: Jose, Ashley & Angel at the front desk were very nice and extremely helpful during our stay. Actually, the entire staff of the Solamar was the best I've ever encountered, The rooms overlooking the pool were beautiful and very clean. I will definitely stay at the Solamar for my next stay in San Diego and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Confused and Conflicted”
Reviews.Author: FREDLOW1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and kids (a 4 and 6 year old) over the 4th of July and I am just not sure who this property is trying to cater to. They say they are kid and pet friendly but I really did not feel comfortable there with my family with the "Hard Rock Hotel" crowd that was all over place. When I was checking in, my wife took my daughter to the lobby bathroom and there were 2 young women cleaning up and getting dressed for the day. Really? Either they walked in off the street or they got kicked out of their room and had no where else to get ready. And when I checked in I was told that because of the holiday the pool was for guests only. Again, really? Does that mean the pool is open to the public the rest of the time? Based on other reviews I was expecting the greatest customer service but in reality it was on par for any good hotel. And a cheap dollar store toy does not make it kid friendly. When I got there the bell/valet crew where helpful maybe a little over eager but nice. Check in was easy but room was not ready at 1:45 so they took my number and said they would call me. No call as of 3:00 so we walked back and as I standing in line I got the phone call (appx 3:15). I was told they were sold out so I could not get a room with 2 beds like I needed. I asked for a roll away and top floor which they gave me. Valet parking $36 a night. Directly across the street $25 for overnight parking. Room was clean but not very big and not very practicable and the roll away was waiting in the room for me. Honor bar not a smart idea with younger children who will be tempted. Bathroom small and also not practicable with a raised sink which makes it impossible to wash your face without having water go everywhere and again not kid friendly. My biggest problem was with the pool area. The area is so tiny pool super small no chairs pool super heated. I felt like I was at the Hard Rock or a frat party with all the 20 something drunk barely clothed people there having conversations how they had sex they night before. Kid friendly? Not so much. And while the guests did not seem to mind my kids there it is not a proper environment for ANY kid no matter age. Staff (security) seemed to be there to hook up with the guests. To be fair there is some good news. The hotel offers hot and cold coffees and teas in the AM as well as iced tea in the afternoon and hosted wine and sangria (best ever) from 5-6. I did see a few dogs around and the staff is friendly. The hotel is clean and GREAT location. The reality is I am 39 not 25 and and I might have enjoyed this property more at 25 than I did at 39. I will give them the benefit of the doubt and hope I just caught them at a bad time.

Reviews.Title: “10! and i don't give them easily”
Reviews.Author: thil83
Reviews.Content: From the valet to the front desk and all service in-between, the staff was outstanding. I was so impressed with this place. All the front desk staff were incredible, with a shout out to Jose... if you don't stay here, you're missing out! Thank you guys for everything!

Reviews.Title: “style over substance”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights on a business trip and had a very mixed experience. Staff was mostly helpful, with one major exception that really hurt our feelings about the place. Room design is not functional. There are two tiny dresser drawers, one of which is stuffed with minibar items. Perhaps the hip young crowd who stays here doesn't wear much in the way of undergarments, since there is no space for them in the furnishings. Closet is configured like a tunnel with the door at one end, leaving a long corridor of clothes between you and the iron and ironing board at the other end.
