Bathroom lacks towel racks, only one hook by the shower. Hip design should not come at the expense of functionality. Over four nights, we were only able to get the room temperature to stay comfortable once. The other three nights the thermostat reset in the middle of the night and the temperature in our room went up by 8 - 10 degrees leading to overheating under the very thick duvet. These design flaws were annoying, but the attitude of the staff at the pool/bar area was unacceptable. My wife went down to read and relax on the pool deck one morning. After settling into a cozy spot for a while, one of the bar servers came over and asked her to move elsewhere because her chair had been 'reserved.' The pool deck was more than half empty, and the beautiful people showing off their cosmetic enhancements were not asked to relocate. Can't help but conclude that staff discriminates on looks, which requires a plastic surgeon to pass muster in this part of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: natalie4654
Reviews.Content: The free wine hour was great...and you're literally one block from Petco Park. Great location for nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel close to almost everything!”
Reviews.Author: travelingslp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Solamar for 4 nights. We were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a corner suite overlooking Petco Park. Our suite had a wonderful spa bathroom with jacuzzi tub, separate living area with TV, workstation, pull-out couch and mini bar. There is a separate room with the King size bed, closet and flat screen TV. Everything we could have needed was supplied. The mini bar prices were high, which was to be expected, but there is a CVS Pharmacy a couple of blocks away where we purchased snacks and bottled water. There is a fee for the wi-fi access unless you sign up for their Kimpton rewards program for free, so I would highly recommend you do that. We didn't eat any meals at the restaurant located on the property, but there is an excellent restaurant 1/2 block away called the Broken Yolk Cafe that serves breakfast, lunch or dinner all day. Just a few complaints about the hotel. The cable TV didn't work very well. The signal kept getting "lost" and would often go in and out while watching TV - very annoying. Also, I had requested extra pillows in the room and a newspaper delivered every morning which didn't happen. The pillows are WAY too soft, but maybe they have other pillows available. All in all a very good stay and we would definitely return to the Hotel Solamar!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: frankieandsandy
Reviews.Content: We arrived a few hours early from a 13 hour flight + 2 hour drive to Hotel Solamar and the staff were brilliant, sending us straight up to our room, rather than have us wait. Much appreciated with 3 kids in tow! Our room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The location was excellent, very close to the stadium and in the Gaslamp District within walking distance to a great selection of restaurants and shops. The hotel pool is very cool, with cabanas and a bar, and great city outlook. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel, we travel often and have high expectations. We'll b back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melleah
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with the Hotel Solomar-- I stayed here for a conference (that was also located at the hotel). The beds are really comfortable, and the room was spacious. I thought it was great that they have a recycle bin in each room. All of the employees were very friendly and the front desk staff had great recommendations for restaurants. The neighborhood is great with lots of things to do within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “We love Kimpton hotels!”
Reviews.Author: woodchucker
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed at the Hotel Solamar for three nights in early June and loved it! This is the third Kimpton hotel we have stayed in and frankly, if we have a choice we will always stay in Kimpton hotels wherever we go. The staff was friendly and welcoming, they couldn't do enough for us. The hotel was stylish, loved the decor in the lobby and our room was very nice, had a good view of Petco Park and we could see a giant TV screen at the park which enabled us to watch the game! We had asked for a pet-free room, so we were on the 8th floor (8th and 9th floors reserved for the pet-free rooms). The location couldn't have been better for us to wander around the city on our first visit to San Diego. Lots of restaurants right near there. We almost booked a room in the Hard Rock Hotel instead but I'm glad we didn't as it seemed super noisy and the neighborhood was teeming with people. The Solamar is only a couple of blocks from there but it is quieter and suited us better. We belong to the Kimpton club (or whatever it is called) and got a voucher for $10 for the very nice room minibar. Free iced or hot decaf or regular coffee in the lobby in the morning (good coffee, too!) and a free wine reception every evening, which I also enjoyed.Super comfortable beds, by the way! We loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Style with a hint of fun”
Reviews.Author: Dribbs
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to San Diego and as we're huge fans of Kimpton hotels it was simple to pick this hotel. The great service and wondeful staff you would expect from Kimpton, helpful, friendly and with a great knowledge of the city. Room was wonderful with a view of the pool. The hotel is very stylish and although it was very busy it never felt anything but relaxing. Wine hour was great too (just like the other Kimpton's we've stayed in). Great treats in this hotel, free cocktails or breakfast, plus some vouchers to use for things from our mini bar (hint, hint to the other Kimpton hotels), this may have been as we hold a Kimpton card. A wide cross section of ages staying here and I'd recomend it to anyone, the area is great too. If we ever get to come back to San Diego we'd not even consider staying at any other hotel. We met up with friends and family who live in the area who popped in to see us, they loved the hotel too (so it must be good if the locals like it).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience in the heart if downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Kklein63
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous stay at Hotel Solamar! From the moment we arrived we felt valued as guests and very well taken care of. After reading some of the views I made sure to call and request a quiet room since my husband and I were going to celebrate our anniversary. They put us on the top floor (no pets) and in a corner room with windows all around! It was absolutely beautiful! They even left a bottle of wine, a box of chocolates, and a hand written note congratulating us on our anniversary, such a nice touch! The only negative thing I have to say is that the tv was not working well while we were there. The shows would constantly cut in and out, but not a big deal to us since we aren't big tv people. Overall we had such a great time and experience! We can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best staff ini town!”
Reviews.Author: dwroesekejr
Reviews.Content: I couldn't imagine a friendlier, more accommodating and all around handsome staff. The hotel is gorgeous, comfortable, and in a prime location but it's the bend-over-backwards staff that truly make the difference!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly enjoyed my first stay at a Kimpton property”
Reviews.Author: Pony_Up
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Masters Suite, which was perfect for a family traveling with two small children. The layout, decor and amenities were very good. The kids LOVED the heated swimming pool, which was perfect because San Diego can be overcast and cool even in June. The staff were very friendly and completely accommodating. We truly enjoyed our stay. The only downside is that Solamar is pricier than what I am used to. An example is $36 USD per day for parking. It is valet and the price does seem to be on par with other properties in San Diego's gaslamp area. If you can get a good deal (off their website or otherwise) or if cost isn't a major concern, then you should be very happy with Solamar.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: empax
Reviews.Content: Great location, right by the restaurants and bars in the Gas Lamp district! Also, a really close location for jogging by the water front, which is just gorgeous. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is so kind!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: MSBENNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Solmar for 6 nights, starting on June 2 thru June 8. We had a King Suite for the first 4 nights and loved it. Room 1017. The room was nice and large and super quiet. We never heard anything, except for someone getting ice one night across the hallway. Bed slept wonderful and everything was super clean. Outside our window we could see Petco Park to the right. The one problem we had with this room was the TV signal kept going out. We called the front desk and they sent someone up right then to check on it and said it couldn't be fixed, it was just a bad reception in that room. So after four days of the TV going off in the middle of a program, I asked the front desk to move us. Which they did, but to another King Room, (1027) not a suite. They didn't have another King Pet Free Suite availiable for us. We asked for a Pet Free room when we made reservations at the Solamar and found out that the top two floors at this hotel are Pet Free. And there is only one King Suites on each of these two floors. Anyway, the King Room that they moved us too was just as nice and have a view of the pool area. And yes, the TV worked great. They also discounted our last two night there because of the TV problem. We are really picky about where we stay and we felt the Hotel Solamar meet all our needs. Solamar is on 6th Street and if you walk one street over onto 5th Street you can find every kind of place you could think of too eat, just wonderful. The Broken Yoke is a short walk down 6th Street, wonderful for breakfast and lunch. Get there before 8 am and beat the morning breakfast rush. You can easily walk to Petco Park and the Trolley and buses are always available to you too. Great hotel, great location, and great staff...especailly a Ms. Kelsey at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and service excellent”
Reviews.Author: ToYourHealth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for several days in April. Excellent location close to the convention center and gaslamp quarter. Staff outstanding in every way. Front desk gave us ideas for day trips and arranged an auto rental. Evening wine was a nice perk and staff serving was engaging and pleasant. Good value for the dollar. Hotel restaurant is excellent. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay. Not awesome.”
Reviews.Author: taraloftis
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days in late May for a work trip. I was excited about the hotel based on Kimpton's reputation, the hotel promotional images, and word of mouth from my sister and her boyfriend . It was a nice hotel, but maybe my expectations were a bit too high. I feel bad writing all these negatives, but think that people with high expectations should know! Pluses: -Valet team is awesome, friendly and exceptionally helpful -The rooftop pool area is stunning, and if I had time to enjoy it, might have made up for some of the Deltas -Lobby is pretty stylish -The front desk team was quite helpful. I left my Blackberry charger behind, and they allowed me to borrow one they had at the desk through the end of my stay. Deltas: -Parking is $36 a night (ouch) -There are typos EVERYWHERE. I am a marketing person, so I interpret that typos equal lack of attention to detail. The room service menu is full of them. I cannot recall where else I saw them, but I recall that it seemed to be a weak point. -There are not ipod docks in the rooms (which I'm finding is pretty standard these days) -Room cleanliness wasn't A+. There was dirt and dried blood on the wall in my bathroom (gross.) -Rooms are semi-stylish (Versus entirely luxurious and stylish. It's more of a half-effort. Think of an upgraded Holiday Inn Express with a large ornate mirror.) -Room service was just okay. I ordered a diet coke, and it came flat, in a glass with plastic wrap over it. Maybe I'm used to hotels bringing the small bottles with ice in a glass? They should consider this. -My TV's connection was unstable and the screen kept freezing, so I just turned it off. It wasn't worth the hassle of them fixing it. -Super noisy. I was here at the start of Memorial Day Weekend, but I'm guessing that with the busy Gaslamp Quarter, it's like this every weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: atlanta14
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its convenient location to the Gaslamp quarter, but then we didn't even end up spending most of our time in that area. Oh well. The hotel itself was nice and cute - like most Kimpton hotels. We had a comfortable stay, and the staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms, but extortionate parking charges and slow service”
Reviews.Author: UKScientist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in June 2011. On arrival, we were shocked by the price the hotel was charging for parking ($36 per night), although we found parking garages a few blocks away which charge $10 per night (or $15 per night at weekends). Our room was good and was functional, although it was lacking tea/ coffee making facilities. The bathroom was a triumph of style over function, with the raised sink being inconvenient and the sliding door not giving much privacy. We tried to get a drink in the pool-side bar, but we had to wait so long for service that we gave up. We also had to wait an age in the downstairs bar and to check out. I am not convinced there were enough staff on duty for a hotel of its size. The rooms and facilities are generally good, but the services and extra charges are not.

Reviews.Title: “Great room-nice staff-odd mix of other guests--”
Reviews.Author: WhyteWind
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our anniversary and had the Masters suite which was great! Our patio was next to the rooftop bar but we were never bothered by noise and it was a great place to sit at late at night and also with morning coffee. Our room was very comfortable and a very nice upscale property. We think the hotel wants to be a trendy cool place, but the guest mix ran the gamut from inappropriately dressed 20 somethings (read: sloppy & bathing suits in lobby) to bemused looking heartlanders to retirees. Not that hip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 52BoiseTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as an alternative to the conference hotel in the Gaslamp Quarter. It is unique, customer service great, nice bar and pool area. We will stay here again when in San Diego. Loved it. One minor problem with housekeeping (don't forget to tip) but desk help and other days were great. Parking is high priced so avoid a car if you are just going to be at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Marchello_diVaio1983
Reviews.Content: Last year we did an all american roadtrip from LA to Miami. During this trip we also stayed a few days in the Solomar Hotel in San Diego. We've seen and been to quite a number of hotels, but this one just ticked the boxes. First of all, the location of this hotel couldn't be better. It's located next to the Baseball Stadium and all the bars and clubs. Secondly, the staff is nice...always willing to help you out. The hotelrooms are really nice, big nice and new bathrooms, large beds (huge flatscreen) and we had a terrace of our own....which is quite a relief compared to be being stuck in your room. Breakfast downstairs was ok. We got the croissants, orange juice etc. Good way to start the day. If you wanna go there, book early!! We stayed there for about $30 a night, which is really cheap. Overnight rates however can be 10 times as high though!! Go there!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and perks”
Reviews.Author: nuggets00
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Salomar and I loved it. They have a great pool deck and bar and the design of the hotel is great. Kimpton has some great perks such as a $10 mini bar credit, free coffee in the morning, a free wine hour in the evening, and free wireless for members. If you are traveling with a pet it seems that they do quite a bit to cater to them. Located in the Gaslamp district. The good: hotel looks fairly new and is in good shape, pool deck area is very nice and includes a bar that also serves food, bathroom was nicely designed, bed was comfortable, and the perks that I noted above. Best of all is the staff - extremely friendly, helpful, and nice. The OK: I had a deluxe room and I thought that it was pretty small compared to other hotels, took a long time for housekeeping to service my room (by 4PM I contacted the front desk to get housekeeping to clean the room). The bad: nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ndfan01
Reviews.Content: My brother treated his wife and I to a weekend getaway at the Hotel Solamar for our birthdays. Although he'd hoped to secure premium rooms, the hotel was at capacity and we received two standard rooms across the hall from each other on the top floor. The property: This is a new looking and feeling hotel, in a great location for access to Petco Stadium and the good restaurants in the Gaslamp Quarter. The lobby is very nice with fireplaces, comfortable seating and a quiet relaxing vibe. The best feature is the pool deck with its cabanas, bar and seating area. Although the pool is not large and there aren't as many loungers as might be needed for a lot of guests to sun and swim, it is lovely place to spend the day, with a nice selection of food and drinks available and pretty good service most of the time. The standard room: I had a king room facing the pool deck on the top floor. It was a nice enough view of the pool and Petco, as well as the streets of the Gaslamp district. Being able to open the window for some fresh air was a nice little feature, although on Saturday evening, the bar was lively enough that I had to shut the window for some shuteye. With the window closed though, I wasn't bothered by any noise. The bathroom is small with combo tub/show, but pretty and with the necessary conveniences along with nice towels, good shampoos and bath gel and the (best blow dryer ever...) The lighting could be a little better for ladies putting on makeup but other than that, it was fine. The bed was fantastic--The mattress must have been new, but the linens were also perfect. Nice big flat screen TV with many channel choices, but some reception problems from time to time. Closet not huge, but good enough for a few people staying a few nights, and there was also a safe placed in some open shelves in the closet area. Very nice easy chair, and small but serviceable desk with plenty of easy access plugs. Free wireless for joining the Kimpton club (also free.) A cute animal print robe rounds out the room amenities. Look around too for coupons and deals on the bulletin board in the room. We got a discount on breakfast at the hotel restaurant, and my brother had a coupon for a mini bar discount. Everything was clean, good condition and new looking. Housekeeping was terrific. Service was quite pleasant across the board. Everyone was friendly from valet, to front desk, housing and maintenance, hotel bar personnel and cafe staff. I enjoyed the free coffee and newspapers in the AM although we missed the wine social in the afternoon both days. This is a great hotel for business travelers, those who just want some quiet leisure time or someone who wants to explore the city and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEPTIONAL: from sassy bulldogs to chamomile apple juice iced tea”
Reviews.Author: blissfork
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Plain and simple. My boyfriend and I are beach people, but as a cost-saving measure we decided to book the first night of our three night stay in San Diego at a downtown hotel (Solamar). It was love at first sight, and that was just the beginning. The staff are exceptional - friendly, welcoming, and accommodating. I was greeted with a smile whenever and wherever I ran across an employee. The little extras? 1. Unlimited ice cold chamomile apple juice iced tea at check-in. AMAZING. Having a little sip of magnificence after a rough flight was just what I needed. 2. A hosted happy hour with a red wine, white wine, AND sangria. My group of three all selected the Voigner before seeing the sangria option. We were totally bummed, assuming we had missed our one shot at a beverage that looked earth-shatteringly incredible. NOPE! Before we finished plotting a way to beg the "bartender" for a small sip of the sangria, he offered to top us all off. And by top us all off, I mean completely refill our empty glasses. We told him we would love to try the sangria instead, and he poured us three heaping glasses of the magical elixir. It was a pink sangria made with watermelon and strawberry puree, Grand Marnier, Triple Sec, and a few other odds and ends. I have never tasted anything that good in my life. 3. A pool and lounge area that is lively during the afternoon and evening, but dead quiet in the early morning as the sun begins to shine down upon it. It's a perfect place for a morning tea and a book read. 4. A leopard robe in the room (wish there had been two of them though...) The rooms are hip, modern, spacious, and fun to spend time in. They do not smell like hotel (you know what I mean), and they actually made me forget about the beach for a while, which is a near impossible feat. My one complaint (and it's a tiny one) is that the walls are a bit thin. I could hear the people next door singing Marine songs to their kid (a new recruit?) until the wee hours. The windows are solid though -- When shut you can't hear any of the pool noise below (at least not from the 9th floor). All in all, a solid 5 stars, a GREAT deal for the money, and you can't beat the downtown location -- just steps from the Padres field and The Mission (one of the best breakfasts in town). I just wish I knew where they sourced the mirrors in their rooms from. They're to die for!

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbmWyoming
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Hotel Solamar and it was even better than my first a year earlier. I was treating myself to four days in downtown San Diego after a week visiting friends in the area. I was away from home and kids and this felt like a sanctuary. I booked the same room-type as before - corner spa room. This is such a nice, large yet cozy room with a comfortable bed and amazing bathroom. I really love this bathroom and we travel a lot. Some of the Kimpton bathrooms are small, but this is large with a huge jacuzzi tub, glass enclosed stall shower and lots of vanity room. I just find this room so relaxing, comfortable and especially quiet. Join Kimpton's In-Touch program before you book and you can "raid" the mini-bar for $10 of goodies. Relaxed by the pool one day and it's small but nice with food and drink service available. It was restaurant week so I tried lots of Gaslamp restaurants. I really did like JSix and found the staff much more friendly this visit. I had room service a couple times and it was excellent. Overall, I found the staff much more friendly this visit, not that they were rude before, but they went out of their way to make sure I had what I needed and always welcomed me back with a smile. I had purchased a gift for a friend that I needed to drop it in the mail and ran out of time. I left it (postage paid) at check--out with the front desk and asked if they could give it to mail carrier. I got a call when I had boarded the plane from Scott and the front desk saying the mail carrier couldn't take it but he would personally drop it off at the post office on his way home. I couldn't believe he would do that and go above and beyond. My friend received her perfume two days later! Negatives would be the small fitness center, but I never had trouble getting on a treadmill and sheets not as soft as I prefer, but for the price I paid for the room I can't complain. Overall, amazing service, location, rooms and food. Perfect stay and I don't say that often!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: SpeedwayCJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Solamar for a quick overnight in San Diego while attending an event. Had stayed with Kimpton Hotels once prior (Boston) and loved it, so I trusted the brand and that helped make my final hotel decision this time. Got a killer AAA rate on a corner spa room, which was huge and luxurious. My room looked out (through 4 windows!) at Petco Park. Would be an amazing place for baseball fans. Minibar credit for Kimpton In Touch members was a nice touch (first time I've ever had something from a minibar!). Bathroom had a spacious shower with liquid soap, shampoo, conditioner dispensers. Also had a huge, deep spa tub (didn't try this out). Really, just an amazing amount of space in the bedroom/bathroom. Checkin staff was very friendly and helpful. Parking staff were absolutely amazing. Room service staff was terrific and food was delicious! Only drawback, the street in front of the hotel can become extremely busy if there's a game at Petco Park, but the parking staff made it quite easy to handle the crowd and got me in and out of the hotel easily. Overall, an amazing stay. Can't wait to come up with an excuse to spend a couple nights in San Diego, so I can stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: bom2535
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Kimpton Hotels before and this one sure no slightest disappointment. Great location, super staff making our big group check-in in a swift. Friendly front desk staff were really helpful in many occasions. Wine tasting at around 5 pm made our daily warm up great. Tried the roof top bar twice and not disappointed, great atmosphere and even more of great staff who worked more to serve us best. Rooms were great, ample space. I had slight problem with the clogged wash basin but that was very minor. Stayed on the 6th floor which was very close to the noise of the roof top bar but that was not a problem. I did not get any problem in this place and our days here passed quickly. Will no doubt consider this place first for the next SD visit. they are also dogs friendly, by the way....

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Holiday in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLady46
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful week in San Diego. We stayed at the Solamar Hotel on 6th Avenue......what a fabulous hotel!! The hotel was extremely well located.....it was contemporary in feeling with well equiped and well sized rooms. But even more than that, was the staff. They were very welcoming, friendly and could not do enough for you. The rooms were spotless and very comfortable. A little extra (which did not seem little to us) was the wine served in the lobby every night from 5pm - 6pm. It was nice to see people mingling together over a glass of wine and a few 'nibblies'. The staff was extremely helpful when we wanted to rent a car for a day. They made all of the arrangements and the car was delivered to and picked up at the hotel at precisely the time that we requested. We certainly loved our stay at the Hotel Solamar and our time in San Diego and we would certainly stay there again. Thanks to all of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: DCroadie
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel. great staff, friendly. Location outstanding. Could walk to everything. Only bummer, the charge for the Business center.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fabulous staff!”
Reviews.Author: Nanaluvsnyc
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent six nights at Hotel Solamar the first week in May. From the time we arrived we were greeted by friendly staff. I don't have all of the names but two of the best were Patrick and Abraham. Every staff member I encountered during our stay was courteous and professional especially the staff who greeted us outside the front doors. The rooms were clean and roomy. The beds were very comfortable. We were on the 8th floor and it was quiet. The hallway was always a little cool because of the fans. The location in the Gaslamp Quarter was excellent. We walked to Petco Park for the game and to the Convention Center. The two negatives are: (1) $35 overnight parking and (2) I did not like the sink in the bathroom. It looks nice but it is impossible not to splash water onto whatever is sitting on the countertop.

Reviews.Title: “Oops! I Forgot Some Wonderful People!”
Reviews.Author: TerrierWhoTravels
Reviews.Content: I forgot to mention some azing staff at Solamar when I wrote my review last night. James brought our luggage up to our room when we arrived Monday, May 09. He spent time with us giving us suggestions as to what we should while in San Diego and where to head to if we rented a car! In JSix we have had outstanding Waitstaff. Thanks to Kristen, Josie and Jamie who ensured that our meals and service were memorable! We should mention that JSix has 1/2 price wine on Wednesday nights. What a deal! We had a bottle of Deutz Blanc de Blanc champagne!! What a bargain plus we rec'd 20% off our bill because we had had breakfast in the restaurant that morning! All in all - amazing food, delicious wine and outstanding service. We have no hesitation in recommending JSix as a dining venue for a romantic dinner (plus breakfasts are delicious!) The only thing we would mention is that it is a touch noisy, so ask for a 2 semi-circle booth or a 4 person booth. Enjoy and thanks Hotel Solamar!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay in San Diego at the Solamar!!”
Reviews.Author: TerrierWhoTravels
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Diego on May 09 and looked forward to a wonderful stay at the Hotel Solamar, a Kimpton Hotel. We are still here, with another 4 nights in which to enjoy this amazing hotel in this amazing city! We have stayed at a number of Kimpton hotels in the past and have never been disappointed! We read Trip Advisor reviews before choosing this hotel and were very excited about our visit From the moment we arrived, having the door opened for us upon our arrival and a very warm welcome at check-in, to the present, we have been SO impressed with the level of service from all employees at this hotel! We actually think this is the BEST service and value for our money we have ever received. (We have travelled all over the world from Alaska to Russia, and Europe to the States. ) We chose a Virtuoso King Corner room for our accommodation here. The room is wonderful and quiet. The staff were able to accommodate our many requests re room specifications here. Every time we leave and return we are greeted warmly with a huge smile from the staff. No request is too much trouble. They have gone above and beyond the normal level of service offered in a hotel. When we asked about shipping some items home to Canada the wonderful young lady at reception personally asked the gentlemen at the doors what we needed to do and returned with forms for us to complete and return to them. They would do the rest! Not to worry! My husband got ill (nothing serious, but he did require medication) and we asked where we could go for medical help, not only did we get directions to Urgent Care printed out for us, but our wonderful Erica called the office for us to let them know we were on our wY, making sure they would still be open for us! Upon our arrival at this hotel, we were very warmly welcomed by Kyle who answered all of our questions, making sure that our room requests were met! When our luggage was delivered to our room, James took the time to explain for us the wonderful places we should visit should we rent a car! Dining at JSix was also a wonderful experience! Our servers have been excellent with consistent service each time we have had breakfast or dinner. Our servers have been:Kristen, Jamie and Josie. The Maitre'd is amazing, recognizing and welcoming us each time we arrived. The nightly wine tasting is also a really nice touch. We've enjoyed sitting around relaxing as well as bringing up our wine to enjoy in our room We cannot say enough wonderful things about the staff and the hotel property itself. The location is excellent with us being close to major attractions and amazing dining options We have absolutely nothing negative to say about the outstanding service we have received during our stay here. What is especially nice is that we get to enjoy another 4 nights here to be well taken care of and pampered! We HIGHLY recommend this hotel as being an excellent choice for accommodations in San Diego! We would come back here in an instant. The level of service that we have experienced from housekeeping, to the Front Desk, to dining in JSixakes it extremely easy to recommend that any guests who choose to stay at the Hotel Solamar will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “splendid Solamar”
Reviews.Author: kate055
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here over Easter we have stayed in Kimptons before but this is the best so far many thanks to the wonderful Wendy and ever helpful Patrick on reception they were so nice. The staff in general are amazing, we askd for a non pet floor and we got top of the house floor 10 over looking the pool, the beds are brilliant they were in the process of replacing the matresses while we were there.The wine reception was a brilliant way of meeting some wonderful people, the only complaint we had was that the fitness gym would need upgraded as there was always a wait , there is a brilliant corner store -deli on 4th avenue and 4st does great breakfast bagels and lunch for a fraction of the [rice called Cine cafe. I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip tp beautiful san diego

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service issue resolved”
Reviews.Author: cello626
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for 1 night at the end of my anniversary celebration. Upon arrival the essentially manditory valet service for our vehicle, at $34 per night was a suprise, (although there is an AAA discount on this). The room and amenities lived up to those promised on the Kimpton website and the rooftop pool/fire pit area was lovely. Our real challenge was in the morning, when the room service we ordered the night before did not come. As we had a 7:45am business meeting, we ended up checking-out without food, and expressed our unhappiness with this at the front desk. Although the initial response of the desk staff was minimal, I received a phone call the following day, in which it was explained that the situation had been researched, staff miscommunication had been idenified, and as recompense, a portion of the charges from our dinner bill during our stay was being cancelled.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: holyjes
Reviews.Content: The rooms are gorgeous, as is the Lobby, the pool deck is stylish and chic. I never wanted to leave!!! Only complaint is no tub in the bathroom but that's the new trend, I guess. I love Kimpton!!!

Reviews.Title: “Darling boutique hotel with exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: Chrystianne
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel in Gaslamp district within walking distance of many sites and restaurants. Staff is quite exceptional in all areas from valet to room service. Free wine and munchies in the evening and coffee in the morning served in the lobby. The beds and pillows were sooo comfy! Onsite parking available for $35/night.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: timoswatch
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Kimpton, nothing but positive feedback. We have been travelling around and were pleased to finally rest here. The swimming pool on the deck was fantastic, the food was great.

Reviews.Title: “You won't regret it”
Reviews.Author: NCM1982
Reviews.Content: It's in a great location - a few steps from the Gaslamp Quarter (nightlife and restaurants) and a short walk to the baseball park, or the Coronado ferry. Our room overlooked the rooftop bar/pool area - it was a great place to relax after a day of travel. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. Service was excellent. I'd return in a heartbeat. A few fun facts: -the room came with an animal print robe, just for fun! -there is a daily 'free wine' hour in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: mrsscoopy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a quick overnight with my husband on April 22nd. Pros-Upon entering we were warmly greeted by the valet which was great and they really knocked themselves out to help. Room was nice but fairly small, not inspiring lay out. Great shower! Sounds silly but the water pressure was amazing and I could have stayed in all day : ) Cons- the front desk service was pretty cold and we ended up in a room with a pretty unappetizing view (the dirty rooftop and air conditioning). Walls are VERY thin!! About 1am we could hear our neighbors (and their barking dog) in the room next door. I love my dog and all, but I take issue with nice hotels allowing dogs. I could see holiday inn or travel motels but when you go somewhere for a relaxing weekend, I don't want to see or hear dogs everywhere. Restaurant-service great and food plated well but blah. It all lacked flavor. Just a little thing. Thei bathroom in the lobby's soap dispensers were missing their spouts. So soap was dripping all over the granite. Just touches that I think hotels should be on top of. For both of them to be broken off??? Come on. Over all, hotel is just ok. A little dark and not very inviting or warm. Will try somewhere else, next time.

Reviews.Title: “I want to live in a Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mapia6
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding reception in a Kimpton Hotel in Cambridge Ma, and wanted to stay in one when traveling to San Diego. I love that the hotels are boutique in decor and warm, not cold like so many. Also, they are dog friendly--big plus! The hotel was in a great location, very clean, and the food at the restaurant for breakfast was great. Our room was spacious and cleaned and Do Not Disturb signs were respected. We didn't want our room cleaned so early in the morning. The front desk was helpful as well. Two things: The coffee in the morning stops being served 15-20 mins before the end time, and they have one woman working this station, which they probably need 2. Also, the hotel room's windows really really needed washing! Other than that, it was an amazing trip and time. The front desk was helpful, it can get hectic if there are lots of guests waiting, but everyone was kind and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Elite Kimpton, Super Clean, Chic, Hip, Classy, and Well-Run Staff.”
Reviews.Author: surplusmarketing
Reviews.Content: This was the first time at Kimpton's Solamar Hotel. I booked online under the Sun and Sea internet special which gave me $30 to spend anywhere in the Hotel ranging from in-suite dining/room service to valet parking. As a Kimpton In-Touch member (sign up is Free), i also received a $10 credit to the "Honor Bar" which is the snack and mini-fridge menu. Coming from San Francisco, it was a long drive. I was met by very courteous and attentive valet parking staff. After tipping the valet to take care of my car $5, i was assisted by the bell hop Garrett, who was very friendly and polite. A nice gal name Katie, who had greeted me and checked me in at the Front Desk, had fulfilled by request for a Corner Spa Suite, which when Garrett and i had unloaded my things at the room, was an excellent Corner Unit to say the least. After tipping Garrett $5 for his kind and professional help, I took a tour of the unit. The views were 180 degrees, 9 floors up (10 floors total in this Kimpton) and excellent looking into Petco Park, where the San Diego Padres play home games. There was a roar from the crowds as i was unpacking, as someone from the Padres had just hit a homerun after the 7th inning stretch. Of course, if you could imagine, there were bars around the park next to the Kimpton. There was the Fleetwood and the Bub, right outside the corner suite where you could look down and see the patrons. So if you want a quiet room, either close the windows (you couldn't hear any noise if you shut the windows of this unit and used the A/C) or request a Corner Suite on the other side of the hall. The Corner Suite was spacious and richly appointed. There was a nice, big soaking tub, which was jetted as well. I actually used this Spa jet tub at the end of the night and it just put me to sleep right after. One of the best sleeps i'd enjoyed in a long time. The reason: the beds. These beds like most Kimptons are the most enjoyable beds to sleep on. They are just the right amount of firmness and super clean and fresh smelling. There was a HDTV LCD for viewing enjoyment, a DVD player, liquers available, wine, champagne, Organic cookies, nuts, etc. These Kimptons are inviting and well-thought out. Efficient. Value. Superb service and hospitality at the right value-oriented price point. At least that is the impression i get every time i book and leave a Kimpton. I leave feeling i got a good deal, a wonderful experience, and wanting to book again anytime i'm in a City that has a Kimpton. In fact, that's what i do these days. The Hotel Solamar is one of the most luxurious Kimptons i've booked. The lobby is just spectacular. As with every Kimpton i've stayed at, there was a wine reception hour from 5-6pm. This reception at the Solamar was superb as usual. My female counterpart was extremely delighted. I wholeheartedly recommend yet another Kimpton. The Kimpton Solamar's staff will impress, and once you see the interior decor and stay in the comfortable rooms you will wonder why you only had to pay so little for all of it. By far, of any other hotel chain i've stayed at, the best pound-for-pound all-around deal for its price. These Kimptons are going to devour other hotel chains in this Recession. They will come out of this Recession as a top hotel chain, and to be perfect honest, i think they deserve to me. This benchmark of excellence should apply to all hotels. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't as good as other Kimptons.”
Reviews.Author: claireyaries
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in other Kimpton hotels and although this one was good, it wasn't as good. Location is perfect - right in the heart of the Gaslamp, and the rooms and facilities were ok. But staff weren't as friendly in other Kimptons we've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “a shinning pearl at the gaslamp quarter”
Reviews.Author: sliderTelaviv
Reviews.Content: i have to confence i was in this hotel on nov 2009 , but i recently joined tripadvisor. i went to the hotel with my father, and as much time i had in the hotle ile say that it's beautifull, has a very chick mood. the rooms are very well decorated and very modern. the servise of the hotel was very very good and helpfull, for example i went early in the morning to the pool and without a second past i got a towel and i got a bottle of water. the pool lounge is very good and very fun. i wish i had more time to enjoy the hotel , but i can say it's one of the best iv'e been too. p.s it's close to everyware and it above a few great nught spots.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler54531
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for a week at the Hotel Solamar. We were very impressed with the hotel and especially the employees. The desk staff and valets went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed ourselves and answered all questions we had. They also helped set us up with a rental Jeep as well as gave us their personal #'s in case we got lost. The rooms and hotel was very clean, nicely decorated and very comfortable. The outdoor bar/lounge was relaxing and fun. The staff definitely helped make the hotel stand out. I highly recommend the Hotel Solamar.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Marvin84
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Hotel Solamar. Our room was ready even though we arrived early and the staff throughout our visit was friendly and very helpful.Great location in the Gaslamp District . Free wine tasting in the evening and free coffee and newspaper in the lobby in the morning were a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Zanika2005
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Solamar is a great hotel with excellent service. I stayed at Solamar for 2 nights for a business trip. I had a conference at the Convention Center, which is less than a 2 minute walking distance away from the hotel. (Convention Center parking is $10, not worth it when you can walk). The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was lovely with modern furniture. I stayed on the 7th floor and was able to look out to their fabulous pool and bar on their roof. I liked that it was also very easy to walk around the Gaslamp area. Once I parked my car at the hotel I never used it again! Next time I go back to San Diego I will most definitely be staying at the Hotel Solamar!

Reviews.Title: “In need of attention”
Reviews.Author: dec140
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in beautiful San Diego, shame the Solomar was no treat, in the first few minutes of arriving i could tell the desk team were not organized. Sure enough i was checked into a room that was not ready and the maid was not happy that i was there, that made of us, Awkward! Also the bed was well past its best, i felt springs pushing into my back. Time to invest in new beds. overall a great Kimpton hotel trying to get out but not happening at the moment. Oh i forgot to mention the whole room is for sale, water, food out in the open -very in your face - was worried the bath amenities would be extra! be Wrae

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Non Fussy. Good Hotel Period”
Reviews.Author: AndrewPV
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference at the convention center. I do not have extensive needs. The rooms are comforatble. Bedding/Pillows were very nice. The wired internet is very good, the wireless is okay. It's within walking distance of the COnvention center. The Gaslamp Quarter has a lot of decent places to eat and drink. I cannot remember the last time that EVERY SINGLE staff person that I have encountered in this hotel has been kind and polite. That is some kind of training. From housekeeping to the guest services person on the phone, to the random room service people in the elevator to the front desk. everyone has been extremely friendly. If there would have been a Sheraton Four POints or a Hilton Garden inn, it would have gotten my consideration because I like to do laundry and travel with fewer clothes. But the lobby has plenty of places to sit and have a drink or read. The WIne Hour is a nice perk as is the coffee in the AM. If there were a grocery store nearby where I could get a stash of fresh fruit, this would have been a perfect location. I would stay here again but it does not have the following of my personal "must haves" - self-serve laundry - inroom microwave or coffee (coffee is free downstairs in the AM) There is a small fridge but it's packed with expensive soda and juice.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jenlam18
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, super cute decor, good food. This is more than just a nice hotel, the staff actually wants to make sure you enjoy your stay. Pet friendly, which I love, even though I haven't yet traveled with my pets. The bartenders in the JSix bar are awesome, especially Josh. I'll be traveling for work a lot more so this will be my hotel of choice from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and ambiance”
Reviews.Author: msbout
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. I am a big fan of the Kimpton hotel chain and this location is one of my favorites. Centrally located in the Gaslamp district, it is walking distance to everywhere you will want to go ( Shops, restaurants, freeway to Coronado and the convention center). The staff was really top notch with the valet guys really standing out. They brought our car around about 6-7 times over the 3 day period, always opened the door for us and were generally happy to help. Check-in was a breeze with a $10 mini bar voucher :) The room itself was a great size, had a comfortable bed, and a really nice view of the pool. Our only two complaints were that there wasn't any drawer space for clothes, just a closet. The useless piece of furniture in front of the mirror could have been replaced by one. The second was the non-functional pretty bathroom. The sink was sooo annoying. Every time you tried to wash your face the entire sink area would be wet. The shower was also an accident waiting to happen. A large tub but no handles for getting in and out of the shower. If you saw how large this tub was you would understand. Room Service- Turkey burger and fries were okay. The second time we called the estimated time was over an hour and a half. Uh no. The hot chocolate/tea/coffee service in the morning is great along with the wine hour everyday at 5pm. I would highly recommend this hotel and cant wait to come in the summer so I can take advantage of the great pool area/bar.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: drfaust206
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights -- just about everything about this hotel was perfect. The rooms were great, the bathroom is amazing, everything was spotlessly clean, and the staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. They recommended the best taco trucks to get awesome street food from, and were always ready with a smile and small talk. Great location in the Gaslamp Quarter as well -- one block off the main drag, so if you want to be rowdy it's in easy access, but we found the hotel to be perfectly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Does not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: pmama
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before our cruise. Got the reservation through hot-wire and saved $60. We did feel a little like outcasts when we called ahead asking about rooms. We were clearly told we are a third party guest and requests cannot be accommodated. We did not feel as welcome but it was worth the saved money. Once we arrived our request for a pet free room was met and we were treated with care and dignity. We had a great room on the 10th floor that even had a peek-a-boo view of the marina. We went down to the roof top pool after dark in our suits and were embarrassed to find no hot tub and a party crowd at the bar fully clothed. No one was in the pool and we would have felt out of place so we returned to our room. We ate lunch at Mary Jane's in the Hard rock hotel in walking distance. Fabulous food! Best cheeseburger ever. I am not a foodie but could not stop talking about it. My husband had a breakfast meal that he quite enjoyed. We went to Broken Yolk right next to the hotel for breakfast the following morning. We had heard they got rewarded as a best breakfast place in San Diego. We were very disappointed. The waffle was nothing more than an ego waffle, the egg looked microwaved, and we received very poor service. I'd definitely walk down to Mary Janes for a much better breakfast. Enjoyed walking in Gaslamp Quarter. We had dinner at the Spaghetti Factory. Seaport Village is also in walking distance and quite lively during the day. I even walked Down Seaport to get a glimpse of our cruise ship In the morning. There were a lot of exersizers out. I enjoyed the morning walk along the marina. We took the ferry to Coronado. If you do this be sure to read the times it picks up before buying the tickets. We had to wait an hour. We had a great time in Coronado then we returned at the time our ferry driver had told us a ferry would be there. We ended up on a ferry going downtown to the other location. The driver was very mean to us when we asked if the ferry would continue on to where we got on. We had to get off and walk. It took us an hour to walk to where we had got on. However, we actually enjoyed walking along Seaport Village. In the future I'd probably get a taxi or rental car. Anyway, point being the opportunities surrounding Solamar are limitless. Love the bathrooms and decor of the hotel. My husband raved about the comfortable bed. We are not dog fans but had no issue with the couple tiny dogs we spotted. Hope to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel -- An Extra Note About Value For Conferences”
Reviews.Author: cvg_day_cmh_triad
Reviews.Content: The other reviews do well to describe the great quality of the hotel. I wanted to add that I was staying at the Solamar for a conference at the convention center. The hotel is about a 4 block walk to the convention center -- very close. Plus the room rates were about 30% below the so-called conference hotels. So if you are considering staying at the Hotel Solamar for a conference at the convention center, I highly recommend that you do so. Oh, and Lounge6 is a pretty sweet rooftop lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: imken504
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in January for a business trip. It was truly a wonderful hotel as many reviewers described. The location was great, close to downtown business district; and restaurants in the Gaslamp District. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Friendly staff and great service. I will definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, warm and friendly place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: petie614
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable, elegant yet unstuffy hotel. Friendly, helpful staff, beautiful, comfortable rooms, excellent on-site dining and close to so much. Loved every moment of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE, LOVE Kimpton Hotels”
Reviews.Author: HayOhio
Reviews.Content: After a LOUSY night in a B&B, we moved to our old faithful boutique chain, Kimpton. The Solamar did not disappoint. Our room overlooked the city and the rooftop pool & bar area. Love the decor, cleanliness, all the niceties we've come to expect from Kimpton. The staff generally are very knowledgeable and helpful. I did come across one confused desk clerk when we first tried to check in. We came at checkout time without a reservation. We asked to see a few rooms, not to decide if we wanted to stay there, but to decide WHICH room we preferred. She told me to go over to the reservation phone and make a reservation. WTH?? Anyway, we went to lunch and came back after the checkout crowd was gone, as well as the confused desk clerk. After that, everything was fabulous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel..great at the right price”
Reviews.Author: orangeeater
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to San Diego..I wanted to stay in the gaslamp district and was drawn to hotel solamar's positive reviews.I stayed 4 nights in a standard room with my girlfriend.. it seemed big enough and she brought a lot of stuff. The bed is very comfy . Shower is awesome.great pressure and hot... liked the shampoo and liquid soap dispensers in the shower. My cons are minor. The gym has 2 treadmills and is tiny. Not a huge deal because one can usually run outside there anyhow. The walls are somewhat thin. Parking is 35 dollars a day..but I knew that going in A big tip is to often recheck the rates.. initially I was locked in at 159 on the hotel website... eventually found it for 126 on Orbitz. Also.. one can often get h.s on hotwire.. I got it for 102 a nite..look for 4 star in gaslamp 95 percent positive reviews with a pool. I would probably give solamar 4,5/5 stars.. can't do 5 stars because for me to give 5 I have to be blown away. But for value..hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, great location, pricy”
Reviews.Author: trippychick2008
Reviews.Content: My honey planned my birthday holiday at the Solamar's Master Suite with "Kuji Soak Tub". The great location is a walking distance to Petco Park, the Convention Center, the Red Car, and Gaslamp District. Our suite had awesome views of the city, Point Loma, and the Coronado Bay Bridge. Complemtary wine and snacks is served in the lobby at 6 p.m. but get there early if you want a seat. There is a nice roof top lounge, but due to bad weather (rain and COLD), there were no takers that weekend. The staff was excellent and helpful and they cater to VIPs (Very Important Pets). They also prove thick leopard pattern robes. The highlight of my trip was soaking in the tub with candles and champagne while watching the rain and enjoying the skylight of San Diego. This is our first stay in a "trendy" hotel and while it's not our thing (we perfer historic/old skool hotels) it was a very nice treat. The downside: You'll have to either order room service for coffee ($5 for a cup) or get your own in the lobby as there is NO in-room coffee pot -a shame for paying $300 a night. The couch was uncomfortable, and there is a $35 per night validated car park. Although the bathroom was outstanding and had the best view of the city, the mirror had streaks on it and the shower is in need of a good scrubdown as it was very slippery. The sink was not practical as water splashed all over yourself, the counter and the mirror. Sadly, our trendy sink had a large crack on the rim and I figure it was caused by a guest that did not have morning Cup of Joe :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for convention”
Reviews.Author: divenski
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in february for a large conference at the convention center. The hotel has clean, very well appointed rooms. The hotel is very convenient to both the convention center and the the Gaslamp district. I also appreciated the free wi-fi. I did not get a chance to go to the free wine tasting, but find this to be a great feature of Kimpton hotels. I would definitely stay here again if I need accommodations in downtown san diego.

Reviews.Title: “Loud Guests.”
Reviews.Author: JaquesN
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel for a "party." I arrived on a Friday evening for business and it was pretty nice. But, on Saturday the weekenders from L.A. move in and it's loud. Not to mention the drilling that was shrill and annoying between 2-6PM. The front desk informed me it was due to construction "down the street," Hard to believe when it sounds like the room next door. And on a Saturday? No rest for the east-coast-weary. Overall, nice hotel. Lots of expected amenities for the price. But, bring ear plugs if you want to get a good night's rest on the weekend. Hotel restaurant serves nice organic food from local farms. But, here too, the ambiance is more like a bachelorette party. I sat across from a party of 10 in dinning room. It was like watching a train wreck; aka reality T.V. delivered live. Entertaining, but not my first choice. Overall, average rating. With the caveat that I have nothing to compare it to because this is my first trip to San Diego - take my review with salt and a shot of tequila....then crash the party...it's a Kimpton!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: beck1159
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference in San Diego and we opted to stay at the Solamar rather than the hotel that the conference was at. Good call! The hotel is in a great location in the heart of the Gaslamp District. It is an easy walk to Petco or any great restaurant. The staff was super. We arrived at 11am, and even though we were very early for our check in time, they had our room ready! I requested a room far away from the elevator, and we had an end room! From the JSix Restaurant staff to the staff at the pool bar,and the front desk staff,everyone was very friendly, and called us by name. Our room was very nice. It offered a great view of the city, flat screen TV's, and a very large bathroom with a nice deep jacuzzi tub. The beds were comfy too with lots of pillows. The pool is located on the 4th floor, and although it was cool when we were there, the outdoor bar was open. They had lots of propane heaters to keep you warm. It seemed as though it would be a great place to hang out when it was a bit warmer......lots of cabanas and spots to relax around the pool. We ordered food at the restauran on several occasions, and each time it was very good. Free internet is also a plus when you are a Kimpton In Touch member. Overall, a great place to stay with a super friendly, attentive staff who went out of their way to make sure you lacked for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quick romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: leeshbc
Reviews.Content: I actually live in downtown San Diego but wanted to get away for an evening over V-day weekend. I've stayed or seen many of boutique hotels in the area and this one is one of my new favorites. We booked the Vday package for a pretty decent rate and were happy to find that upon arrival our room was upgraded to one of the jacuzzi rooms at no charge. I liked their jacuzzi tubs as they werent just standard tiny tubs with jets, but the tub was actually pretty spacious and deep. The room decor was beautiful and modern. Service and staff were efficient and pleasant to deal with. Overall, a nice quick romantic getaway in the city (even though i live in the city). Definitely an excellent value for the price we paid. We didn't want to leave. If I had to complain about anything, my bf said he wasnt fond of the burger we had from room service. However, I loved my short ribs :)

Reviews.Title: “nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: number1hedge
Reviews.Content: we had a great stay at hotel solamar! very friendly people, nice rooms, good location, and nice happy hour! the only thing i would complain about, is the high price for drinks out at the pool. all in all, i would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: KimmyD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a long weekend, we had a wonderful time. The staff is ver attentive and friendly. The room was just right, on the ninth floor and very quiet. The Pool bar was the perfect hang out for us, although we were never there late night, we enjoyed the whole scene. I also accidently threw something away, that was very important and Wendy went out of her way to find it and is now mailing it to me. That is grear customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: SueG66
Reviews.Content: I was there on a business trip. Not only was the hotel room beautiful, so were the staff members. I had a small problem when by boss left the hotel one day early and forgot his passport in his room. I called the front desk from my room and Carly managed to get the passport for me and send it to my room within 10 minutes of my call. I got the passport to the airport 1 minute before boarding. I was so appreciative and so was my boss who absolutely needed to get on that flight. I also want to thank Jose for making me smile every time I walked into the lobby. Actually, the entire staff, starting from the doormen to the maintenance people, were absolutely a joy to say hello to. The service is excellent. This is what Kimpton is all about. Other highlights was that the Conference Center is literally a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “They do the basics, miss the details”
Reviews.Author: BLFootInMouth
Reviews.Content: Had to switch rooms during my stay because there was no king room first night so they put me in a suite just for that night. The suite was awful btw - the "window" was actually a sliding glass door that opened up to the pool and bar (also means it was noisy later than I wanted to be awake. There was almost no light in the suite, and the furnishings were hideous. Transferring rooms mid-stay doesn't work if you had planned to store anything in the safe while out on business... The room where I was transferred was nicer than the suite. Reasonably comfortable. However, no in-room tea or coffee facilities in a hotel advertising that all its rooms have the amenities of home...? Apparently guests are expected to intake caffeine only in the morning, and certainly not in their rooms. That's just wrong. Also I did not understand why a room in San Diego California would be furnished with a duvet on the bed. Duvets work wonderfully in Germany in the winter. But not in SD. You are left with the choice of being very warm or very cold when you sleep. Someone who was obviously not a guest in the hotel - and much larger than me - tried to con me out some cash in the hotel elevator after everyone else had exited. My inner city upbringing saved me there, not Solarmar's security.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: lurkcatty
Reviews.Content: Everything at the Solamar Hotel is top notch. The pool area is great to relax even if you don't fancy a swim. There is a charming lounge area where we enjoyed complimentary wine in the early evening before heading out to sample the local restaurants- abundant and close by. Even the iron is free of the usual polyblend smears left by previous users. Love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - will most definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Stocktones
Reviews.Content: I used a 3rd party site for the initial reservation & didn't know what hotel was selected until after my bid was approved. Upon being ok'd & finding out that we were staying at the Hotel Solamar (had never heard of it before), I was elated to do some research and find that it had been very highly reviewed on TripAdvisor. This was for a 3-day getaway to celebrate our 19th wedding anniversary. Per recommendations on this site, we signed up for the Kimpton InTouch loyalty program...which proved to be a great move. We were given a $10 credit to the mini-bar and free wi-fi. How cool is that? The hotel itself is really wonderful, pristine, great decor (classy but not stuffy). We were a bit apprehensive about the fact that they allow pets (we had a truly miserable experience at another hotel years ago...dog in adjacent room barked...and barked...and barked some more), but it turns out that the top two floors are "reserved for 2-legged guests only". Hotel staff had set aside a quiet room on the top floor for us, and included complimentary wine & chocolates for my wife & I. Very classy touch. The only drag was parking. It's valet only, and costs $35/day. Many downtown hotels charge for parking these days (kinda the hotel industry version of baggage fees, I suppose), but it really is a bummer - particularly when they don't even offer self parking. I suggested to them that part of the Kimpton loyalty program perks could be a discount on the parking rate...I think that would go a long way toward generating loyalty! But otherwise, we had an incredible time at the Hotel Solamar. Very romantic getaway, and will enthusiastically return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DCWK
Reviews.Content: Great service. Quiet. Friendly. Very clean. Nice swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality (though not the best Kimpton)”
Reviews.Author: adelly
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Solamar for Christmas weekend with my hubby and 2 dogs. Pros: - good location in gaslamp; only a short walk to the major restaurants and bars in the district. - very reasonably priced (I think we only paid $135/night via a special offer) - as with all Kimptons, very dog-friendly (and this is important to us, as this trip was specially for the dogs) Cons: -no other options for parking other than valet (at $35) - front desk failed to advise us during check-in that we had a $10 credit for the mini-bar. Only learned about it as we were being checked out and by then it was too late :( Overall, a good value hotel, very pet-friendly and centrally-located.

Reviews.Title: “Only one short block to the heart of Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: Pearljammer
Reviews.Content: The best feature of this hotel is the LOCATION at 6th and J Street. One very short block to 5th street where all the restaurants, shops, clubs are located but far away enough where there is no excessive noise at night. Last minute reservaation--rates from www.getaroom.com were $124/night for Thu and Fri. Valet parking expensive $35/night. You can literally park your car across the street at 5 Star Parking for $15/night but no In/Out priviledges. Very clean. Beds very comfortable. Staff helpful. Free wi-fi but you have to get the code from the front desk. 24h access to the gym. Complimentary happy hour 5-6pm with wine and bruschetta by the fireplace. Also complimentary coffee (good organic coffee) bar in the morning. Never heard of this "Kimpton" brand of hotel before but apparrently they are VERY pet friendly--saw LOTS of dogs in the hotel. The only "odd" thing I found was the decor--"A shiek attempting to be chic". Sort of 1970's but trying hard to be updated. There is a huge gold wall piece behind the front desk and the entire hotel is dimly lit...as if Saturday Night Live John Travola music should be playing the the background. For the price, location and cleanliness the decor can be overlooked. Would stay here again if I could get the same rate. 4 star hotel. The attached restaurant J Sixx is supposed to be headed by a very good executive chef but we only had dessert there (good) not a whole meal. No complmentary breakfast but "The Broken Yolk" is only half a block away and it was voted "best breakfast place in San Diego"--decent price and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Gilfraser
Reviews.Content: Great experience. Comfortable bed. Wine tasting. Caviar! Attentive and responsive staff. Best hotel for a great price. No hesitation to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The only place we stay in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Pinchion
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love this hotel. The staff is always welcoming, the happy hour relaxing, and the location awesome. The area surrounding the hotel is safe and vibrant. There are many great restaurants, including Solamar's JSix within easy walking distance. We have stayed at Solamar many times and two years ago housed all our wedding guests there during our daughter's wedding. Everyone loved it and all were made to feel as if this was their home away from home. The pool and outdoor bar can't be beat and the large gathering area off the lobby is always stocked with newspapers, cold drinks and a fireplace. The rooms are comfortable and bright. As return guests we are made to feel special by the Kimpton Chain as well as the Solamar staff. Because the hotel is located in the heart of activity it can get a little noisy late at night when the bars let out. However, just ask for a room on the quiet side of the hotel. The Kimpton philosophy and the Solamar staff are what makes this a special place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ngah
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights in a room with a king bed on the 8th floor facing the pool. The hotel is cozy, unlike the chain hotels, which made my stay more memorable. They made a very good first impression by allowing me to check in very early. I signed up to be a Kimpton member and was able to receive free Internet, free daily newspaper, and $10 minibar items. There was also free morning coffee/tea and evening wine/sparkling cider. My room was clean, modern-looking, and the bed was comfortable. Check in and check out was fast and friendly. It was only 3 blocks away from the convention center (walking distance) and close to all the restaurants and shopping. The pool can be loud in the evening, especially when there is a large group of people present. They play the music loud as well. I didn't mind so much because after a while, it became background noise to me but my colleague thought it was annoying. A weird thing about this place is that there is not much drawer place for clothes but I did not mind so much. I highly recommend this place and would stay here again. I wish all my hotel stays are like this. Bravo to the hotel managers and staff; they definitely know how hotels should be run.

Reviews.Title: “Solemar went above and beyond,”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravel2011
Reviews.Content: I came in Saturday night to attend a conference. XXXXX Airline lost my bag Saturday night, but I had to present in front of several hundred people Sunday morning at 10:30 a.m. At 8 a.m. Sunday, still no bag from the airline. I asked Carly at the front desk if they could help me find a dress jacket. They called around, and confirmed that there were no stores open at this time on a Sunday morning. Then Carly asked what size jacket I was, and told me I could go to breakfast. 30 minutes later she called me back and told me that she had found a jacket for me. The jacket fit perfectly, and I was able to give a great talk, looking professional -- I also got several compliments on the jacket. Carly had called various staff members, to find one my size, and had been able to borrow a jacket from the Valet Manager for me. This sort of service is just extraordinary. The rest of the visit to the hotel had this same really lovely commitment to personal service.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, contemporary, but NOISY”
Reviews.Author: dhinfo
Reviews.Content: The Solamar is a contemporary hotel in a great location in the Gaslight district with lots going for it. Very attentive staff, free wine from 5-6, nicely furnished. Unfortunately the pool is in a central courtyard on the 4th floor, and the lounge is alongside the pool and stays open with loud music and louder customers until 1am every night. The noise thus confronts all of the rooms facing the courtyard and is quite intrusive. The hotel does provide free ear plugs as a result, but this is not what should be required in a nice facility just to sleep! I can't comment on the noise from the streets in the rooms that don't face the courtyard. You can do better for the price in a number of other hotels near by.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelers2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Solamar in January, 2011. We heartily wish it could have been one week or more! The hotel is in the historic Gaslamp District of San Diego. It is beautifully appointed with large and lovely rooms. The lobby is gorgeous and the location is excellent. San Diego boasts numerous great hotels, but this is at the top of our list. We will stay there again when we return to California.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Solamar was an experience in comfort and luxury”
Reviews.Author: animalover4
Reviews.Content: My 19 year old daughter and I vacationed for 4 days and nights at the Hotel Solamar in the Gaslamp Quarter, San Diego. The room was large, quiet and the beds were wonderfully comfortable. The location of the hotel was in the Gaslamp Quarter, adjacent to beautiful art shops, restaurants and clothing boutiques. All of the hotel staff were friendly and helpful, from the concierge to the bell boys. Every time we entered or left the hotel, the door was opened for us. I recommend this hotel who anyone who wants a vacation in a beautiful city and wants to feel pampered.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place I'll stay at in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Razzbelly
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel and I can't imagine staying anywhere else while in San Diego. The staff is amazing and very friendly. They pay attention to your preferences and conversations and remember them throughout your stay. The rooms are modern without being stuffy and the lounge and restaurants are top-notch. Centrally located to many attractions and business needs, this is the perfect place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Area”
Reviews.Author: kitschymoo
Reviews.Content: What can I say? Good, professional service and trendy, comfortable furnishings at an affordable price. My wife and I traveled to San Diego for the Labor Day long weekend. Having had a good experience with the Kimpton property in Portland, Oregon a few years ago, we decided to try the Hotel Solamar. First off, this hotel is located in a great location, in the buzzing Gaslamp district, close to Petco Park. Since we were there for only three days, we didn't even bother getting a car - we were within a short walk to a light-rail stop, and were able to see what we wanted to see using our feet and public transportation. We got the the hotel late Thursday night, so checking in was a breeze. However, once we went up to our room, we noticed that our window was facing the hotel's fourth floor lounge. Being light sleepers, I called down to the front desk and asked to be switched to another room. Bam, done. Five minutes later, someone came upstairs with our new room key and escorted us there. All the rooms have free internet, which is a plus (well, free if you sign up for Kimpton's loyalty program). Would I stay here again? Definitely, and would definitely consider other Kimpton properties in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotel Experiences Ever”
Reviews.Author: Rockinrodd
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing experience at this hotel. We drove to San diego on a whim, got in late had no idea where we were going to stay. We were tired from a long drive in from a long weekend in Vegas and just wanted a nice place to stay. After checking out a few other hotels, we pulled into Hotel Solamar. The valet was prompt and courteous, the front desk staff were so helpful from check in to city must-do recommendations. The hotel is beautiful and I love that they allow dogs - we will consider bringing ours on our next trip. As we settled in our room to clean up for a night on the town, the most amazing music bellowed from the roof top as a wedding reception was going on. The wine in the evening, the coffe in the morning just added to the experience. I loved the sassy waiter in the hotel restaurant with the real scoop on what to see and do. The location is fantastic for checking out Gaslamp. I could go on and on, but bottom line- it was one of the best hotel experiences ever. We hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: tommy25
Reviews.Content: Just finished a wonderful stay at this hotel with my family. We stayed over New Year's wtih our little kids. The location is great - in the heart of the Gas Lamp district and close to the convention center and many restaurants. I have never had more friendly/helpful valets and hotel staff at a hotel as I have experienced during this stay. The rooms were comfortable and decently sized. Valet parking was $35 per day - so we instead parked further down the street at an ACE parking garage which worked well and cost $17 per day. The hotel had great coffee in the lobby each morning and we absolutely loved the wine hour (each night between 5 and 6pm). We asked for a quiet room - and ended up on the 8th floor. The pool deck was really loud over new year's eve from the party there - but we expected that. The hotel staff were great for restaurant recommendations. We ate at the Tin Fish - good fish and chips. Broken Yolk - excellent breakfast - right next to the hotel - we highly recommend this place (I think it was even featured on Man vs. Food. Rockin Baja Lobster restaurant - awful food and service - but loud enough to have to eat there with our kids. Joe's Crab Shack - was fine. Saffron - (on India street) excellent Thai takeaway - especially the grilled Thai chicken - great if you have a car. A few cons though: 1) Expensive valet fees 2) The room smelled a little funny. 3) My wife's allergies acted up during our stay - prob because this is a very pet friendly hotel.
