In addition to all of this, beds are great, the service very attentive, rooms are super clean and trendy and we got a break on the parking because we drive a hybrid. How cool is that? We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not as Kimptonesque...”
Reviews.Author: flannelpajamas
Reviews.Content: There's something distant and uncomfortable about this hotel, and I guess it's the little things that irk me. The good: 1. I was able to get a good two-day rate on the Kimpton website ($158.00) which is probably the only reason why I'm here. With the economy, my company is really scrutinizing my travel expenses. 2. The location is also convenient for food and walking around the Gaslamp District and it's less than three miles from the airport. 3. The decor is contemporary, but cold. Most Kimptons that I have been to are stylish and contemporary but not cold. I couldn't put my finger on it. 4. Nice big flat-screen TV. The not so good: 1. Yes, the location is convenient, but it's also really noisy. I don't know if other rooms are the same, but ask for a quiet room if they have one. 2. The bathroom sink is really high...so this is not so good for me at 5'3" but might be great for someone that's 6'3". Water splashes everywhere because the sink is too shallow and gets all over my things. The bathroom was clean, but generally smallish. 3. The hotel includes internet with the room cost, except there is no wireless or too weak of a signal. You have to be hard-wired to the internet cable which restricts your mobility. This irks me. 4. Valet parking is $32.00 a night...kind of an oxymoron decision to stay here for the cheaper room rate, but throw in parking...and well...you're back up to where you wanted to avoid in price. The Bad 1. The king-sized bed in my room was so uncomfortable, I barely slept. It dips on either side, and is slightly raised in the middle. Basically the bed felt like it was 100 years old and need to be thrown out. 2. The nice comforter I'm used to from Kimpton turned out to be so worn down and thin, I thought they forgot to include a comforter in my bed. I basically had to get up at 3am and put on my fleece jacket, because I was freezing to death. 3. No IN-room coffee. So I ordered room service for breakfast, and my coffee that came with room service tasted like water. I couldn't believe how weak it was for $4, plus 22% gratuity, plus $3 service charge. I probably could have bought a coffee maker for that price. They do serve coffee in the lounge in the morning until 9:30am, but who wants to go down there in the morning when there's work to do or in my case trying to get a little more sleep due to the lumpy bed? In summary: I'm not coming back...based on the bed issue alone...and I really wanted to like this place. I still gave this place a good rating, because it is MOSTLY good for the average person on vacation...really bad for business person. There might be better beds in other rooms, and I just happened to have the worst room in the house. Maybe you get what you pay for at the Kimpton.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great pool area, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: bagjag27
Reviews.Content: At full price this place isn't the best value. However I paid only $150 so it was great. Nice pool and lounge area on the 4th floor deck but it can be pretty noisy on weekend nights since there's a big bar and a DJ. Request a higher floor on the other side if you want peace and quiet. Parking is very expensive but there are public lots in the area so hunt around. Kimpton does a great job with making you feel special: free upgrades to intouch members, free wine from 5-6 in the lobby etc. Great chain

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Saroo72000
Reviews.Content: Relatively to its price, the hotel was a semi-disappointment. The rooms are very small, bathrooms even smaller, staff not too impressive, restaurant decent but overpriced for the limited menu and slow service. We enjoyed San Diego and luckily didn't spend much time in the hotel. And what is up with the drunks across the hallway? Don't mind an occasional friendly drunk but banging on my door at 2 am? Made me cranky.

Reviews.Title: “Not Priceline Friendly, Problems with Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cefiro06
Reviews.Content: I am assuming and hoping that the problems that I ran into were because I booked the rooms on priceline for less than half the rack rate from the hotel's website, because if this is the norm for their regular paying customers some people need to be fired. My biggest complaint was with a lady that was working the front desk overnight. When we arrived I requested rooms with two queen beds. We were told that there were none available (which was okay). After completing our stay I realized that the hotel was very empty for our entire stay. I also requested extra keys as we had a larger party. I was told that they were out of keys and could only provide one per room! The next night, we came back a little late and we needed our room key to get into the front door. Because we were only given one key, we didn't have a key with us and the same lady that checked us in quickly offered us TWO extra keys (one for each of our rooms). After pulling up our room in the computer, she handed me ONE key and said goodnight. The next day, I found out that the new key worked just fine, but the original key had been deactivated!! After asking I was quickly given extra keys for both rooms by a much nicer girl at the front desk (during the day). I hope it was just a coincidence or computer error but if she pulled this because we got a good deal on the rooms she should be fired or Solamar should not sell rooms through Priceline. My other big complaint was with the stench in the hallway. Many times when we returned to our rooms we could immediately smell the stench of bathroom (#2) as soon as we entered the hallway. The vent that is near the elevator must be for the bathrooms as you can see it as soon as you get off of the elevator. Even our guests immediately noticed this. Also, the $32 valet service was not what I expected for that price. The valets were friendly, but we waited way too long for our cars to be retrieved (up to 10 minutes). Also, when we returned late one night the valet (24 hours) was nowhere to be found. We had to stand around for another 10 minutes and notify the front desk before anyone came out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, clean/modern rooms. . . we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: diatsuzuk
Reviews.Content: I was trying to find a great place to stay for my 40th birthday getaway and got lucky on Hotwire.com with the Hotel Solamar. The staff was friendly and welcoming. The rooms were clean (includes Aveda amenities). I won't lie the $32/night rate to park our car (valet service) was a little steep, but that's to be expected in downtown San Diego. I read through all the reviews and was a little nervous, as I didn't know what to expect, but upon staying there, we couldn't be happier. The hotel has a great location. Once we parked, we were able to walk everywhere, including shopping at Shorelines Gallery on Market / 4th. The bar at the pool also has great nightlife. I read reviews that the music could be a bit loud, but our room was on the opposite side, and we didn't hear a thing. We will definitely be back for another weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: MCaseNC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while in San Diego on business and would certainly stay here again. I have fallen in love with Kimpton hotels and try to stay in one where available in my travels. I find them trendy, with comfortable rooms and helpful staffs. This one was no exception -- the room was very comfortable and the staff was very friendly and helpful (for my minimal needs). I found the poor bar to be fun and entered business guests here one evening - the service was exceptional. The attached restaurant, Jsix, was a bit uninspiring (very unusual for a Kimpton restaurant) but the staff was still very friendly and attentive. Otherwise, a fine hotel living up to Kimpton's excellent standards.

Reviews.Title: “just didn't do it”
Reviews.Author: mpdu2
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights for a business trip. Got a great rate on Expedia which Kimpton matched. Also got a suite upgrade thru their e-upgrade program. Thank god I did as even the suite seemed small. Overall I wanted to like it so much more than I did as I had heard all these great things about Kimpton , but it just didn't come together. Staff were young and nice, but not as crisp as they should have been. No one opened doors for you, staff greeted you with "hey, what's up?". Bartender at the pool watched TV instead of coming over to the cabanas to see if we wanted cocktail service. For a new hotel I was surpirsed at how "banged up" our room was. The bed had an incredible sag on one side. (We even checked the bed frame to see if it was broken.) Remember that this is a downtown hotel so the views are non-existent. (Our room overlooked a parking lot) None of these things are really major but for $350 a night? Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in Great Location in Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: dburkett
Reviews.Content: Hotel Solamar is another fine example of a Kimpton Hotel - chic and swanky. Its location is ideal with respect to the gaslamp district. It is in walking distance to many fine restaurants, a movie theater and Petco park. It is an amitious walk to Balboa Park but it is certainly is an option for most. The hotel was clean and appeared to be newer. The pool / bar area is very nice although I am not sure everyone would be comfortable with the pool area being combined with the bar. The hotel offers complimentary wine each evening in the lobby for an hour. I would highly recommend this hotel to adults. I am not sure it is the best selection for those traveling with children. If you are staying at Hotel Solamar you must visit Heavenly Cupcake across the street and up a block or two. It is a cupcake lounge - serving only cupcakes. A great little treat!

Reviews.Title: “okay hotel , not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: jassmi4
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel solamar in med january. my boss had given the trip to sandiego at this hotel to me for x-mas. i grew up in sandiego and love it . i know he paid alot of money for the room we got and he was looking for a high quality hotel with a good laocation. when we drove in we were met by a valet that the first thing he said was . the price to park here is blah blah and how do you plan on taking care of that. i told him and he told me to go check with the front desk. we felt somewhat like it was a little tacky and not real top notch service to be greated that way. took awhile to get the right person to be able to see that it was included in our sty by my boss. my first impression of the room was it was not well kept up, wall paper peeling,a sqished bug on the roof and or view was looking over an ally that was really very ugly. had i paid for it i would have been very disappointed with the quality of the room and the staff did not exude friedliness, even the guy at the pool bar seemed to lack any personality or great customer service. the location was good because you were right in the gaslamp and the shopping and restaurants but i would have preferred to stay somewhere else especially for the price. at night there is a bar on the roof across the street so unless you really like to stay awake listening to the boom boom boom all night until 2-3 am then you probably want to stay elsewhere. i felt the hotel needed more polish, better customer service and it totally lacked the feel of a higher class establishment. the freet breakfast in the hotel was a real value, great food and you could add other items on the menu other than the just what they offered for free, like bacon hashbrowns for a min cost.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Stylish at the Solamar!”
Reviews.Author: DAL504
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Solamar on a recent business trip to San Diego. This is the new place where my company is booking people which is a welcome relief and change from the boring suburban business hotel I had stayed at previously there. The rooms and the hotel all around were very cutting edge and modern - great decor and lovely fixtures. Colors were great, as was the overall design ethic. I wonder how dated that will look in 5 years though...Only complaint I had with the room itself was the desk chair - there's all this über modern furniture and then the desk chair, while covered in a modern fabric, is a tired old metal framed convention chair. That would really be the only thing I'd change furniture wise in the room. The bathroom was big enough to have a party in with a jacuzzi tub and everything and who doesn't love Aveda amenities? Now, I was a little worried because I had a pretty low floor room right against the pool area, and there was some sort of gathering there the second night I was there, but honestly, I didn't hear a thing! I do agree about the last review and the workout room. It was very small a probably could be a little bigger. I was able to get a machine both days (and the second day I was the first one down there) so felt I did get an adequate workout, but yes, you have to be an early bird to get what you want on that front and it is a little odd that you need to call security to let you in if you are the first one (they said it was because of pool access liability, but yet the just unlocked the door and put a towel there to keep it open!) Anything bad was minor enough for me to overlook it and it was right in gaslight which is nice at night to stroll and get a bite to eat!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Solamar”
Reviews.Author: rowingman
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate by using hotels.com, then calling the hotel which met the rate, so what should I expect? After listening to the CEO of Kimpton indicate they have "the highest guest approval rating", frankly I would have expected more. I am not a complainer, but having heard Kimpton brag about tripadvisor feedback, here is honesty: Room was average, but mattress was worn (sagging). Fitness room is small to non-existent (two treadmills, one bike, one elliptical) and only opens at 7am (which they do not tell you, because there is no "hotel guide" in the room explaining hotel features). For the Kimpton window dressing about "green hotels" the outdoor heated pool was steaming in the January morning, and the outdoor fireplace was left on all night (Al Gore would not be happy). Worse, after finding the entire fitness room occupied at 5am (one needs to go to the front desk, and security will open it on request) I went out into the pool area to swim, the door closing behind me, and you are locked onto the pool deck (before business hours, this being a 5am swim in the dark), and your card key does not get you back inside. Only by knocking on the door of the crowded fitness room did I get back indoors. After the 2am wakeup from the drunks coming back into the bldg after closing time (security called not by me, but altercation was loud in the hallway), trying to replicate my early morning swim (propping the door this time) only to find the pool filthy and not venturing in, waiting 35 minutes for two poached eggs, two coffees, two toasts, one smoothie ($30+ thank you very much), and replying to the check out clerk when asked "how was everything" indicating that I found the workout room too small for the hotel, was told, "oh, you can use the health club across the street, we have a reciprocal agreement" I thought that management has a way to go with respect to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton's are Reliable”
Reviews.Author: miamitola
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night at Hotel Solamar. It has a great location in the gaslamp district and was in walking distance to great restaurants and the movie theater. We stayed on the eigth floor in a king bed room. The rooms are small, but they have all the amenities, LCD TV, refrigerator and nice bathroom. If you stay in rooms from _21 through _33 you will be facing the roof deck pool. The night we were staying was a little loud until after midnight. Also, you pretty much have to valet your car. It's $32 for the night, except for our hybrid the price was cut in half!!! I love the idea of the wine hour (which we did not go to) but we did enjoy the complimentary coffee and tea in the morning. The staff were nice and helpful. We are fans of Kimpton hotels but got a better deal when we booked through expedia, versus their website. They would not allow us to use add the room to our rewards card because we booked throuh a third party. They suggested that next time we call Kimpton, tell them the deal we could get, they'll match it and then we can get our rewards.

Reviews.Title: “we love it”
Reviews.Author: Rolix
Reviews.Content: Great location, in the heart of San Diego.... almost walking distance to everythings. Hotel is well decorated... the room is beautiful and comfortable, the view.... the spa tub.... the large shower...........all the staff are great and well professionl... except the concierge, she was a little unpleasant. Complimentary coffee in the morning and complimentary wine hour in the evening, .....don't forget to try the breakfast is SUPER !!!

Reviews.Title: “My Choice for Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal415
Reviews.Content: I stay in San Diego frequently for business so I am familiar with the hotel options (have stayed at the Hilton, Hyatt, Hard Rock, W). This hotel is my favorite for the location (next to Petco Park and steps away from the Gaslamp District), nightly wine reception, decor, room size and cleanliness. The hotel is on the smaller size (along with the rooms), so I would recommend the Hyatt or Hilton if you are traveling on business and space is important to you (small lobby and rooms). My girlfriends and I stayed here for a concert at Petco Park. We enjoyed the wine reception, headed across the street to Stingaree (restaurant) and then walked over to the ball park. Everything was very convenient and perfect for a girls trip- plus we didn't have to worry about traffic going to/from the ball park. Stay her if: - You like boutique hotels - Space is not your top priority (small lobbies/rooms but they are decorated beautifully) - You like Aveda bath products - You like wine receptions - You like a "city" atmosphere - You like to travel with your four legged friend (they are a pet friendly hotel) - You want a good pool scene in an urban setting Don't stay here if: - Space is your top priority (stay at the Hyatt) - You want to be on the water or want a water view (stay at the Hyatt or Marriott) - You like large hotels (stay at the Hyatt, Marriot or Omni)

Reviews.Title: “great location stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: cemm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for an inexpensive get-away to San Diego and got a great price on this hotel! We were only staying 1 night so we took the city bus from the airport and walked the 4 blocks to the Solamar. The hotel was in a great location and the rooms were beautiful. They have a complementry wine hour in the lobby and a coffee service in the morning that was excellent. We toured the Midway the first afternoon-totally worth the 17.00 admission fee! The next day we took the water taxi to Coronado Island and had lunch before our flight home. Had a great time for a song-we would recommend this hotel to anyone. The pool is small with no hot tub-we didint use it and it was largely abandoned during our stay.The only problem we had was with internet access. The morning of our departure we could not connect and was told the hotel was having issues with their computer system and to call their support number.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased With Stay”
Reviews.Author: Quinnly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a last minute trip to San Diego after getting good airfare. I had never booked with Priceline but gave it a shot. When we got the Hotel Solomar, I was only nervous because it wasn't the familiar Omni, Marriott, Hyatt chains but with a four star rating, I assumed it had to be in line with them. And the price was right for sure. The hotel is very chic and modern. The rooms are nice, but as couple posters have said, no dressers and that is slightly inconvenient if you have a longer stay as we did - 5 nights. But beds were comfy. The best part of hotel is staff. The front desk staff were amazing. Even when we had minor complaints or maybe requests, they tried to be as accomodating as possible and never made us feel they were put out. We did move once because we stayed during Halloween and a loud street concert was going on right out our window. They moved us to 10th floor which they didn't have to do. The view was amazing. City, litte of the ocean. Right now there is some construction going on at properties near the hotel. The only time it even bothered me was during the weekday by the pool. Hard to relax with the construction noise. Valet parking is pricey ($32) but if you go in and out a lot, its probably worth it than trying to find public parking. So much is within walking distance. Restaurants, Petco Park (for summer events especially), nice mall. All in all, I would recommend the hotel. I have heard that some rooms experience noise from the pool bar but I would think it would have to be extremely busy for that to happen. And yes, some ocassions they do close the pool to guests to accomodate a private party which does put you off a little. They only did that once during our stay so we didn't mind. The morning coffee and tea and the afternoon wine is a very nice extra touch as well. Go and have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: randallbellaire
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of a 5 day stay at the Solamar while attending a conference in San Diego. We traveled with another couple and they echo our experience. We arrived hours before official check-in time, but received our rooms immediately. During our entire stay the staff was courteous, professional, and always assisting. Housekeeping service was efficient and excellent. The 4th floor roof top pool/bar is wonderful!! A great place for a relaxing drink in the evening with a view of the Gaslamp district. Never really saw anyone swimming, appears to be more of a social gathering place for guests. The hotel location cannot be beat. Walking distance to just about everything including the convention center and the Gaslamp district which is full of restaurants, shops, pubs, etc. You dont need a car if you are staying in this district. We took taxis to/from the airport and San Diego Zoo, very reasonable taxi rates. The hotel has a free wine tasting every evening from 5p to 6p, very nice. Free coffee in the lobby every morning for 3 hours or so. The decor is wonderful, if you like W hotels, you will like the Solamar. The hotel was spotless as far as cleanliness is concerned and the hotel is well maintained. Great down bed comforters and pillow. A room with a view of the 4th floor pool/bar deck was nice. Although the hotel really doesnt have a bay view, you cant beat the location, ambience, and service. This would be a great place to stay for a romantic couples retreat. Highly recommend this hotel and we will stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: flossyfizzdog
Reviews.Content: This was a post-cruise hotel for us, and although our room wasn't ready upon arrival (it was 10am!), our luggage was stored and the lovliest concierge I've ever encountered, Molly, gave us directions for shopping. We returned just after lunch, and our bags were taken up to our room. We splurged on a King Spa room, and it was worth every penny. Elegant yet quirky decorating, clean, quiet, luxuriously comfortable, and the best tub I've ever had in a hotel room. We were able to watch TV whilst soaking. The complimentary drinks in the lobby lounge were very well received, and we were directed to a great, cheap Mexican restaurant just a couple of blocks away. Again in the morning, our flight wasn't until later in the afternoon, but no problem with luggage, we just collected it all after we'd done a bit more shopping. If you're looking for something a bit different, yet with superior customer service, I wouldn't look any further. I'll also be keeping an eye out for Klimpton hotels in the future when I travel - they appear to be successfully breaking the stuffy corporate hotel image.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Eskimo_Monkey_Travel
Reviews.Content: We landed at San Diego Airport at about 4.30pm on a Sunday afternoon and took a cab the 10 min drive to the Solamar. We were welcomed by the very friendly concierge with a nice glass of wine (they have wine tasting every evening between 5pm and 6pm). The hotel has a lovely 'living room' area to relax after a day exploring San Diego. There is of course the JSix pool bar to also have a few drinks. The room was spacious, clean and quiet. They have Aveda toiletries in the bathroom. The hotel has a fantastic location on 6th and J Street. It's about a 20 min walk to the Coronado Ferry, 15 mins to Seaport Village, 2 mins to the Altitude Skybar and 2 mins to a fantastic seafood restaurant called The Oceanaire, even San Diego Zoo is walkable in about 40 mins. All the staff were exceptionally friendly. Probably a 4.5* really, but excellent all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: smalld
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at the hotel. they gave us a grea corner suite (601) for friday and saturday night. we were originally booked into the IVY hotel but changed due to some reviews that mentioned the nightclubs could be noisy. when we checked in we told them that and they assured us we would have a "quiet" stay. Got back to the Hotel last night and there was a roof top nightclub accross the street that had music blaring so loud our room was shaking. when we called down they offered two suggestions: 1. they would send up a fan to drown out the noise (seriously), and / or 2. they would send up ear plugs. since they would have needed a jet engine t put out the noise i went wth the ear plugs. called down this morning and they had no notation on the file that we were displeased. they offered us another room and when we insisted on a refund for that night they argued. they finally offered it after agreeing that this is a well known problem and they get frequent complaint about it. Our new room is not as nice but nice enough. Now at the pool and at 4pm i am told they are closing the pool area and we have to move to facilitate a wedding. This was not told to us when we checked in and in my opinion is unacceptable. There are no other exterio common areas to use. So not impressed. tons of choices in this city and this will never be our choice again. it is too bad as the location is great, hotel is very nice, valets are great, and the concierge was amazing. The hotel managers need to be re-trained in their people skills and although problems do arise they need to be able to resolve them. We travel the world and this is the worst back to back experiences we have had where the hotel has absolutely failed to resolve anything.

Reviews.Title: “The best!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FlowergirlMichigan
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of staying at this lovely hotel...we loved this place the moment we arrived. The valets were so polite...Mollie greeted us the moment we walked in, gave us fresh water with lemons & limes...complimentary wine tasting in the evening, complimentary coffee in the morning...she set up hair appointments for us...the valets were always professional, the front desk staff was so courteous & pleasant, the young man who brought our bags to our room was so nice & polite... a "boutique" hotel - small, yet personal, everyone who worked there was extremely polished, professional & friendly..the rooms were clean & beautifully decorated.....WE LOVED OUR STAY HERE!!! Loved everything about this hotel....and, it is in a great location...close to everything...would highly recommend this hotel to anyone & everyone...

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: luvs2travelmel
Reviews.Content: Very Good Stay. After a quick check-in, we found our room exactly as requested - King Spa Corner Room , high floor, city view. The room was large, the jacuzzi bathtub was HUGE, definitely large enough for 2. We opened the windows and heard some noise around 1AM from the bar across the street, but otherwise pretty quiet. After checking out the bar Jsix on the pool deck, all complaints are warranted. Small pool, I wouldn't swim in it, it is basically a water feature for the bar. They were having a private event that evening, and a large section was blocked off from the rest of us, still leaving enough room to pick tables, but had to go up to bar for food/beverage service. A woman did complain about how long her food was taking, but I don't know how long it actually was. Wine hour is very busy and there is definitely NOT enough seating for everyone, but the wine was very good (and free) and the attendant was very friendly. Room service was prompt, but the food was below average for my taste. We went to the Hard Rock Hotel's diner the next day where the food was good, but the service was lacking. Did not eat at the JSix restaurant. No major complaints about the hotel at all - it was a very good stay. I'm not a pet-friendly person, but this is a pet-friendly hotel and there were quite a few animals at this hotel, but no pet smells or noise were noticeable.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Weekend Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Dominici
Reviews.Content: Expedia had a great deal per night at the Hotel Solamar, so I booked a long weekend stay. The lobby of the hotel was very clean and modern and the check-in service was very prompt. As we entered our room on the sixth floor, we were pleasantly surprised. The colors were nice, the amenities were great, and the overall comfort and cleanliness of the room was perfect. The hot tub is a must. The walls are a little thin, but luckily it didn't turn into a problem. Overall, the location and price of the hotel would bring me back for another visit. You are within walking distance to so much, including Petco Park, if you are there for a game. The Gaslamp District is right there with many restaurants to choose from. My suggestions...Mary Jane's Coffee Shop for breakfast and Lou and Mickey's for dinner. They won't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTCPD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a romantic getaway and it was delightful!!! Our "travel agent" booked us here and downgraded our room without our authorization. When we went to check in and found out about the downgrade (for the same price!), we brought it to the attention of the hotel staff. They contacted the manager and within 10 minutes, we had one of the best rooms in the hotel on the top floor. The staff went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of which is more than I can say for our "travel agent". The hotel is just awesome! The rooms are beautiful and the location is well, location, location, location. We stayed in a room facing the bar/pool and we did not hear the noise others complained about and we left our windows open. The room was amazing, clean, spotless, with wonderful shower and hot-tub. We can't say enough good things about the Hotel and the Staff. They were absolutely delightful. We felt like we were staying at "Hotel Babylon" for you BBC fans. One thing about parking. "Park It On Market" is just around the corner on Market St and costs half as much as the Solomar.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: LisaChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the hotel and had a very nice stay here. The rooms are very spacious and the beds are quite comfortable. They offer a complimentary coffee bar every morning and a wine reception every evening. The location is central to shops and restaurants. The pool and bar on the fourth floor are alot of fun. The only complaint I have is the very poor water pressure in the shower. I know they are trying to conserve water, but when it takes two to three times as long to rinse the shampoo from your hair, it kind of defeats the purpose.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: suebob
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little different from most with a somewhat more edgy decor, but otherwise it is a typical above-average 4 star hotel. The location, on the edge of the Gaslamp district, is very convenient. The staff were helpful. The rooms were very good; my only complaints were the pressure from the shower head and the fact that there was no separate shower. Adjacent restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Nice Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: WorldAdventurer_7
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at a Kimpton property and I must say they have a nice track record going. Love the hotel and room decor. Service is always the pampered, kind, courteous treatment I think we would all love from every travel related chain. Free wine in the evenings, flexibility to get you whatever you or to wherever you need to go. I am typically wary of posters who are this positive about a place, but, I can't imagine any of what I have written above to be hyperbole.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: weloveholidaysNewark
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Virgin holidays as it was the best price we could find. The hotel is great. Ths staff were all fab and friendly, the rooms were very clean and to a high standard and the free wine hour everyday is spot on. We had a room overlooking the pool, but as the bar closes at 12 it was never a problem to us. The atmosphere around the pool and bar area at night was great. The location is also ideal if you are looking at being near all the bars and restaurants in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: JulianNewbury
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the solomar aug 25th - aug 28th 2008. Very nice, and clean 4star hotel which deserves 4 stars! The mood and lighting is very sombre in the public area's, and the check in girls are very pretty (for us guys!!!) The room was very nice, and the bathroom rocked. The only down side is the pool area. The area itself is absolutely great, but I think they have pool parties, and sometimes after a hard day all you want to do is pop down the pool at 4pm have a lay and have a swim, but you kinda feel a little out of place walking through with your towel and shorts, when everyones dressed up and stood at the bar listening to loud music! But this didn't deter me

Reviews.Title: “pretty good experience”
Reviews.Author: trippin76
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here over Labor Day weekend and I wouldn't say it was the best place we've stayed but it wasn't the worst. We stayed at a couple Kimpton hotels in Seattle and were very impressed so we were looking forward to Hotel Solamar. Compared to the hotels in Seattle this was a notch down. The bed was good, but not as comfy as the others. The TV wasn't as nice and neither was the bathroom. The blinds were almost impossible to open and close and obviously we weren't the only ones who had trouble with them as the bar you pull on was broken. Over the weekend the pool was THE place to party. There was a DJ and tons of people everywhere. Which is fine if you're into that, we were just hoping for a more laid back atmosphere. On Monday the bar was closed during the day and we were able to have a very relaxing time by the pool. I would say if you're in your 20's or 30's and looking for a party, stay here on the weekend. If you're not, stay here during the week. And if you get a room facing the pool bar get ready to hear the music.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mfost
Reviews.Content: This was a decent hotel. We chose it because so many of the other hotels in the Gaslamp area were extremely overpriced, and we were looking for a hotel with a nice pool. We booked this online through expedia for about 150 per night, and it was certainly worth that amount. The rooms were clean, done in a pretty beachy decor, and were comfortable. The maids always did a good job of keeping the room in order, although they never seemed to leave us enough towels (2 towels for 2 ppl isn't enough in my opinion)...so we just requested more, which was no problem. The hotel is busy. There are lots of people there at night, especially in the pool area. Our friends had a room over the pool and they said that the noise at night wasn't an issue. The pool is beautiful and gets great sun. However, there isn't much space for lounging. They have about 6 lounge chairs out, and 3 cabanas. One day we arrived in the afternoon and there was no place to lie out. When I asked the bartender where we were supposed to sit, he kindly offered up the cabana for free (for which they normally charge $250 per day). On our last day we also noticed that they had a stack of lounge chairs behind the bar, which you can take and set up if you want to. The pool was pretty and a lot of fun! The hotel is within walking distance to some clubs, restaurants and bars, and they offer you free coffee and tea in the morning, which is a nice touch. Now for my gripes. I didn't find the hotel to be overly functional. I compare it to a really hot girl without a brain. The rooms looked nice but there was no good area for putting on makeup, and there was a lack of counter space and shelving. The pool looked beautiful, but the lack of sitting space was a bit annoying and somewhat stressful. They have sex kits for purchase in the room - lubricant, condoms, etc. I guess paying $7 for a sex kit when in dire need is worth it, but I don't need to be reminded of the thousands of people who have had sex in the bed that I'm paying $150 per night for! Yuck! They also have these strange leopard housecoats for purchase. These two things made me think that the hotel might secretly be frequented by pimps and people with weird sexual fetishes. Finally, parking was $30 per day - insane! We had no real problems with this hotel, but I just didn't find it functional enough overall. See what else you can find, but if this is the hotel you end up with, then that's certainly okay, too, and I'm sure you'll have an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Sad Little Gym”
Reviews.Author: boston02118
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel. The good: the room was clean and well-appointed. Beds were very comfortable and sheets were high quality. Great location (Petco Park is a block away; the convention center a couple of blocks; lots of restaurants in Gas Lamp District). Very friendly and polite staff. Small but well-maintained outdoor pool on the third level with a bar area. Very sleek and modern public areas. The bad: The ONLY downside to the hotel was the fitness facility. It was pretty lame. Few cardio options crammed into a tiny space. Too bad...I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat for a one night stay. But anything more than that, I'd look for a hotel with a better fitness room. Kimpton, put a decent fitness room in the hotel -- it would pay off in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely botique hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller100
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in August 2008. Overall, I am really satisfied with this hotel. It is worthy of the 4-star title. The decor, both in the lobby and in the rooms, was artistic and tasteful, and the service at the front desk was excellent. They also offered free coffee/tea in the morning and free wine tasting in the afternoon, everyday. Though I was not able to take advantage of the wine tasting, by the number of people who did everyday, I gathered the wine couldn't be too bad. My only complains are: (1) the room was just a bit too small, so only one soft chair was provided -- I would have preferred two, so both my mom and I could sit comfortably. (2) The newly-renovated bathroom had a really shallow sink. While it is stylish, it is really not very practical. Oh, also, the valet parking was expensive -- $32 a day! But I took the advice of other trip-advisor reviewers, and parked in a nearby covered parking lot for $8/day. Complementary wired high-speed Internet is really nice! If I visit San Diego again, I would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Solamar is outstanding in very way!”
Reviews.Author: JacksonCapps
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Solamar for four nights recently. We were absolutely happy with all aspects of the hotel. The rooms are lovely, comfortable, decorated well, but most of all the hotel staff members are truly professionals. They are efficient, polite, and appear to want their guests to feel welcome ~ which we did. We have stayed at most of the four star hotels in downtown San Diego over the past ten years, but I would recommend the Hotel Solamar over them all (and I have no complaints with the others) but, the Solamar was just a little more inviting. I read some of the previous reviews about the bizarre pool scene. I checked out the pool every day and night we were there which included a Saturday. I didn't see anything that was bizarre. All I saw was a few people having a drink at the bar and other guests sitting in lounge chairs reading. And, as my husband who teaches English pointed out, "they weren't even very racey books!" There are a lot of great hotels in San Diego, but if Hotel Solamar is conveniently located to what you want to do in the area, I highly recommend it. Also, I would suggest not renting a car for any downtown hotel unless it is a must. The hotel parking fees are all about the same whether you are at the Hyatt, Marriott, or Solamar, and how many times are you going to use a car? The public transportation system is sufficent to get you anywhere within the downtown area; we found taxis are not that expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Solamar and Meeting San Diego”
Reviews.Author: CFANTAUZZI
Reviews.Content: This August was our first trip to San Diego so we picked this hotel and it was just fantastic. Took in a Padres game so it was a short walk to the stadium and back. Enjoyed drinks on the roof with the fire pots going that night. As it was my birthday, the whole setting was just right. We're New Yorkers and we were totally impressed by the hotel's location and setting, as well as the West Coast feel of SD. We'll definitely come back and revisit the Solamar and spend more time in the city and sail the harbor again. Thanks San Diego, and thanks to the Hotel Solamar for our great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: relliebelle
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Solamar was great place to stay for my quick visit to San Diego. We booked a regular king room, but were given a corner king room, which gave us a view of Petco park and the fireworks after the game. The hotel is very close to restaurants and shops in the downtown area and is also close to the major highways. The staff at the hotel were very nice, they gave us a coffee maker for the room and the valet guys were friendy as well. The decor is really funky and fun and the small details in the room and throughout the hotel were nice. There are only two things that I did not like - the pool is small and our bathroom only had a light behind the mirror, which did not provide any light in the shower. Overall, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bplus
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute stay at the Solamar for our anniversary on a Monday night. The hotel was well decorated and was just as we expected. They sent a bottle of champagne up for our special night and we enjoyed the pool, wine, and coffee in the morning. We stayed on the pool level and it was really quiet on the weekdays. I would recommend the hotel to anyone, though we did park down the street to avoid the expensive valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fun vibe”
Reviews.Author: game_misconduct
Reviews.Content: Booked a three night stay from Sunday to Wednesday in July 2008. Overall, it was a good stay. Location can't be beat. It's within three blocks of the Convention Centre, the orange line of the trolley system, and Petco Park. The major restaurants of Gaslamp are within 2 blocks. It's also only a $10 taxi ride from the airport and about a $10 ride to the zoo. Staff at front desk were friendly and helpful. Bell desk was hit and miss as they were rushing to get to the people using valet parking. A major perk was that they enabled me to store my bags there for one extra day beyond my stay. I couldn't get the hotel for one extra night because of Comic Con so I stayed with a friend in Sorrento. I left my bags at the Solamar and picked them up the next afternoon before going to the airport. I requested a room away from the pool and found that this was already the case. My room preference of two double beds was accommodated also. My only criticism of the 10th floor room was that it was quite noisy due to the hotel's ventilation fan. Maintenance said that all 10th floor rooms were noisier due to the ventilation fan. I found it a bit distracting when we were relaxing in our room but it wasn't distracting enough to disturb sleep. We went off site for most food and beverage, with the exception of a nightcap at JSix on Monday night. Service and the house red wines were very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JamesBondMI6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week and had a very good experience. Based on some of the other reviews about the noise level at the pool, we requested a "quiet room" and were placed on the top floor(10th) on the opposite side of the building. We spent several days and evenings at the pool but avoided the weekend and the wild scene on those days. This worked out perfectly. The room and hotel itself were very clean and had a nice decor. The staff was friendly and helpful. The best part is the location. The hotel is within walking distance of many, many attractions, restaurants, bars, shops and galleries. Even the walk to the zoo and back was manageable. We also went to two Padres games at Petco Park, which is literally one block from the hotel. We would definitely stay here again on a return trip to San Diego. Just request a quiet room and avoid the pool on the weekend if you're not into the party scene.

Reviews.Title: “Great base in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: rogar
Reviews.Content: My wife and i booked our stay here through hotwire at a great price (well, i think so) of $139 per night. I had already been warned by previous reviews about the parking costs and as expected it was $32 (plus tips) to park here. Therefore, i completely ignored the car park and parked at the enclosed multi story car park about 100 metres along the road. There were a choice of two car parks and i parked from approx 6pm to 10am the following days and it cost me $8 per night - a much better deal! The reception staff were very friendly and they offer complimentary tea/coffee in an hour slot in the morning and wine between 5-6pm in the evening. The rooms were very clean and funky. They weren't huge in size but the decor was pretty fun and the tiger skin print dressing gowns a nice touch! Our room overlooked the pool/bar area and couldn't really hear any noise when inside the room and we enjoyed an evening drinking by the fire in this area. The massive plus to this hotel is the location. The gaslamp is full of bars and restaurants and the hotel is in the heart of this area. Overall - an excellent choice for a young couple but not the ideal choice for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, ridiculous pool scene”
Reviews.Author: rosco101
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is destroyed by the most bizarre pool scene I have ever come across in all my years of travelling. Im in my early 30's and my girlfriend in her late twenties and we found it way too much. At the weekend they bring in a local DJ from about 11am who plays unbelievably loud dance music right throughout the day, you cannot hear yourself think nevermind talking. The pool has hardly any beds but at the weekend when it fills up with obnoxious drunk people that the DJ brings with him you cant get a spot in the pool nevermind a sun lounger. They also rent out the cabanas so you may arrive down at 9 in the morning to be greeted with reserved signs on all the beds which sit their idle for most of the day because even when the beautiful people who booked them arrive they only want to be seen drinking in the pool. The pool area itself can be rented out to businesses and during one night of our stay was completely shut off to guests. If your a party animal you will of course love this vibe at the weekends but this is certainly not the place you want to go to at the weekends if you have children or just want to relax. One other thing about this hotel is the car parking, between tipping the valet and the car park fee be prepared to pay at least $40 a day.

Reviews.Title: “If You Love To Party This is the Place for You”
Reviews.Author: nhonzel
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely has the potential to be a wonderful place to stay. Unfortunately there are so many problems with the property that I cannot imagine staying here again. We arrived on a very early flight and had asked for an early check in which ended up being no problem. We were in town for a wedding and told by the groom that a gift bag had been delivered to our room but to our dismay there was no gift bag in our room or at the front desk. The Concierge said they couldn't find it and suggested that it was accidentally given to someone else in another wedding party. Then he offered their gift bag to us! Obviously we declined as that is not exactly the appropriate resolution to the problem. Valet and Concierge services very slow and rather detached. If you enjoy good service with a finer touch you will not find it here. I found the previous reviews describing the service as catering to the 20 - something crowd (meaning they cater to the party/drunk crowds) to be very accurate. Lines were very long at the front desk for people either checking in or asking questions. Lines to get your car were even worse. Attempts to call down to the valet to have the car ready went unanswered several times. Room service was disappointing at best. We called most nights for a late snack and they either never answered the phone or said they would call back and never did. The front desk also called our room several times by mistake sometimes in the early morning or very late at night. The biggest problem at this hotel is the constant pool party. I cannot stress enough to people booking this hotel to book a room that doesn't overlook the pool and bar on the 4th floor. If you want a hotel to relax by the pool then this is not the hotel for you. The few chairs they have are taken first thing in the morning and the place is crawling with people in their 20s and 30s and DRUNK. By the end of the afternoon the pool area was littered with plates of half eaten food, beer bottles, dirty towels and other garbage these people left. The DJ started at noon and went until 11:30 or 12 at night. The music was a constant "thump thump thump" of house/techno mixed in with the noise of bar and pool patrons singing at the top of their lungs. Think of it as a nightclub right in the middle of the property. The drunk partygoers would then spill into the lobby every now and then and harass hotel guests. For a hotel that charges almost $250 per night (and $32 for parking per night) I was appalled that they were ok with all this. Several other guests we spoke to in the lobby were also very disappointed and angry. We demanded a room on the other side of the building to get away from the pool. Our new room was a little quieter but I began to realize that we were smack dab in the midst of more partygoers later that night who had rooms near ours. The noise from their rooms drifted down that halls and into our room. We called security about 4 times to complain about the yelling and screaming which finally ceased around 1am. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't sit well with the younger crowd, partygoers and noise because that is what this hotel is all about. I fully intend on contacting this hotel and the manager about my experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Kimptons are different but great”
Reviews.Author: cobwabo
Reviews.Content: The Solamar is a typical Kimpton hotel where each one surprises because of its modern, tastefully decorated rooms and the unusually relaxed staff. They are very dogfriendly and are the only ones that I know of that do not charge a dime for your dog to come with you. We enjoyed the stay in the Gaslampquarter and will come back here.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay with your dogs in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: codobai
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a hip, sleek place with a cool, modern decor, perfectly located to be a convenient launching pad to walk the Gaslamp/Harborside/East Village neighborhoods. Petco Ballpark is a couple of blocks away. The 4th floor pool is neat. The staff was super-friendly too. The few down points were the noise levels from the neighboring rooms and the rather sluggish air conditioning. The weather was warm during our stay and we had a hard time cooling the room down. Our dogs were welcomed (a gem among the San Diego hotels) but they didn't get the special turndown service advertised. Nonetheless we had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Lewy8
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Solarmar is a lovely boutique hotel with great aesthetics & very clean. We stayed for 6 nights, in early June and the location was perfect! We are pretty independent tourists, I had planned most of our activities before we arrived; but Timin, their Concierge, was great by pointing out the various places throughout the Gaslamp District to be sure to check out during our stay. And he gave us a real variety, not just several places all doing the same thing. If you plan on visiting La Jolla, we cannot recommend ENOUGH, "LaJolla Kayak" (with the blue awnings, on the 2 opposite corners of Ave. de la Playa). The staff will seriously go out of their way for you. Most of their Guides have lived their whole lives in La Jolla, & they care a lot about the area, so they make the tours educational and great! Kevin & I cannot thank Mike and Dre enough for everything. If you go anywhere else, you just might be crazy... :) Favorite bike & kayak tours: La Jolla Kayak, for sure!! Favorite restaurant: Panevino Favorite breakfast: Cafe 222 Best beer selection: The Yard House Best fish tacos: Kotija Jr. (Encinitas) Favorite baseball: The Storm (Lake Elsinore) Biggest disappointment: Taka Sushi Favorite Cabbie: Tres McFadden

Reviews.Title: “Good Trip”
Reviews.Author: ChiRay
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Solamar for 7 nights. The Bad Noise can be a challenge if you are sensitive or a light sleeper. $30 a day for valet. Parking in general. Condescending/ indifferent responses to 2 of our housekeeping requests. Getting used to the funky (cool) sink so that you do not splash (especially for my height challenged spouse) water all over. Rude Drunks. J-bar (j-six) is a fun place for the guests and locals. Some of them migrate to hotel lobby and may inconvience/hassle hotel guests. Honor bar did not leave any space for anything else. The Good Fun place. Funky styling. Cool Lighting. Great location. Exceptional response time to all housekeeping requests/issues. J-bar Courteous friendly staff that greeted us every time we came or left, sometimes by name. Doors were always opened for everyone. Excellent check- in and check out. Free upgrade! Comfortable beds and great linens. We arrived early (noon) and were pleasantly surprised that we were promptly checked-in. We had asked the valet to leave our car out of the way while we checked to see if we could check-in. When we went to get our car, it was gone (put in the garage), and we had no claim ticket, so we had to wait until the guy that we left the keys with returned. The valet area is small so I understood. We booked through Priceline, so we unsure what kind of room we would receive. We were given a standard room on the 5th floor with a king bed and a standard tub. The room was very similar to the pictures that we saw online, except for the decorative (polka dot) mini-comforter. We called the front desk to ask for the comforter, thinner pillows, a fan, and to fix the TV (awful picture on all channels). Within 2 minutes a technician was there for the TV. We left the room to check out the pool area. When we returned in a few minutes everything we asked for was taken care of. This was the theme throughout our stay. The only speed bump was on one day after a very late night we slept in until 1, and left our room at 2. I saw the maid 2 doors down so I assumed that we would be ok. We got back at 2am to find that our room was not cleaned. I called the front desk and I got the condescending/indifferent person. The maid was at my room in 2 minutes to clean the room, but I just asked for towels, as we were very tired and still needed to shower. The maid was very pleasant and offered to clean the room. I declined as I heard her radio say that she was needed to clean another room. The area around the hotel is an active entertainment area. There is activity everywhere and lots of people. You can park 2 blocks down from the hotel for $16 a day or less (no in and out privileges). During the day parking can be had for $1 hour. There was a situation where I dropped my wife off at the hotel and went to park. She called me and said that some drunk was hassling her in the lobby. I raced back ready to confront the drunk and was immediately approached by security and asked for my room key. I presented it and explained why I was hyped. He explained that they had dealt with the several disruptive individuals and apologized. He asked if there was anything that they could do to compensate us for our trouble. We declined. He apologized again for stopping a guest. I stated that I had no issues with him for doing his job. Bottom line. Great stay! We would definitely like to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: motonica
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel to celebrate his birthday along with our anniversary. The place was perfect. Very clean, very modern, great location, wonderful service, cool/young vibe. The rooms were very clean with a nice hip decor. Our window looked over to Petco Park, and we even walked over and watched the team practice on opening day. The rooftop pool was great even though we didn't really get to take a dip because the weather was a bit chilly. Although I must say they didn't have too many lounge chairs so I'm assuming if you don't get there early enough to get a spot then you're out of luck. They had a great poolside party one of the afternoons with a DJ and a large young crowd of partiers. We loved it and had a great time... But I'm pretty sure it must have been very loud for the rooms that were overlooking the pool. So I probably wouldn't recommend this hotel for older guests who are looking to relax. The location is also very central. It's a few blocks from the heart of gaslamp district and walking distance to Seaport village, the marina, convention center, and LOTS of great restaurants and bars nearby. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: mhernan44
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel room through Hotwire.com...I was crossing my fingers that I would be assigned to Hotel Solamar and luckily i was. i only stayed for one night but i was impressed during my short stay. pros: spacious rooms decorated very nice. beds were sooo comfy. Free Internet! excellent customer service: all staff was friendly. concierge put my friends and i on the guestlist for two near by clubs, the Ivy (the new place to be in SD) and Stingerray (right across the street). they offer a large variety of complimentary items in case you forgot something at home..my back was aching so i called the front desk and within minutes they sent up a heating pad. also it was raining that weekend, the hotel offered free umbrellas to their guests...i give 5 stars to the hotels attention to detail and remembering that even the little things count. free wine hour in the early evening and free starbucks coffee in the morning excellent location: walking distance from most of the clubs and popular shopping and dinning spots in gaslamp...and i think its walking distance from petco park because i saw a lot of people parking by our hotel then heading to the game. When staying in the gaslamp area some parts start to get a little seedy or ghetto, but not this location i felt safe when walking on the streets at night lots of parking options near by: luckily my friend and i found parking on the street, but you can easily find less expensive parking than the hotel's parking rate poolside bar/lounge located in the hotel: due to the rain it was closed but it looked like a very nice atmosphere. if you stay at the hotel you get free entrance and you dont have to wait in line. i would recommend this hotel for all ages. Its quiet hotel for those that would like to relax and get away but also close enough to walk to clubs for those party goers I will definitely return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time at Hotel Solamar”
Reviews.Author: AP_Phoenix
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Hotel Solamar this past Memorial Day weekend. Stayed with a big group of friends and had a blast!! Trendy interior...Nicely appointed rooms. Great service at front desk and concierge. Stayed on the 4th floor..same level as the pool. Very social, fun place to hang out at hotel pool bar/cabana. Was also in a great location...walking distance to restaurants and nightlife. Would DEFINITELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room”
Reviews.Author: lite2shine
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights for a conference and I really loved the nice decor room. I love the free wi-fi and the amenities were great (L'Occtiane). The front staff were hit and miss. Some are friendly but some are snobbish. My room was at 9th floor, and the week I stayed it was pretty chilly/cold, so the notorious pool scene was very quiet. This hotel let you bring your pet. So one day the hall way had a very foul smell, and I had to call the front desk. There was no coffee maker, but when you call they will bring one in for you. The hotel is at a nice location and you really don't need a rental car if you are going to stay around the downtown. The parking is $30/night at this hotel. I shared a cab with my co-worker and took a city bus to Balboa Park ($5 round trip).

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ibct
Reviews.Content: We were treated so well from the time we arrived, to the time we checked out. Our rooms were beautiful and very clean, ,just like any other Kimpton hotel. The only problem that I experienced was the jets in my jacuzzi were broken. Someone came up to fix them during the day, and left a card that they were fixed, but they weren't. So, I had to call down again in the evening, and they sent someone else up; he was super curteous, but it took him a while; not sure how the guy before him could have said they were fixed because clearly, they were not. Other than that , I slept great and didn't find the hotel to be noisy at all, and my room faced the pool. I could see how it could be noisy if there was a big party going on though. We ate mostly at restaraunts in the Gaslamp - there are so many of them. They are good, but not as good as the Mexican restaurants in Old Town - I'd go there if you like good Mexican food.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: r_c311
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at this hotel the night of May 25. The hotel looked really nice from the moment we walked in. We were given a room on the 8th floor overlooking the pool on the 4th floor. The room was nice, clean and everything looked fine. We spent a few hours down at the pool/bar area. It would've been nice if the pool was a little bigger, as it seemed that the pool was too small for the size of the hotel. We still had a nice time down there. The location of the hotel is excellent. It's right next to the Gaslamp area and all the restaraunts and bars. If loud music bothers you and you need to be in bed before midnight, then you probably don't want to stay here. If you'd like to stay at a fun lively place and don't mind loud music during the day, you'll have a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our anniversary weekend. We are Kimpton members, and were upgraded to a corner jacuzzi room by the cheerful check-in clerk. Our room was spotless, and had a nice view of Petco Park. The wine service from 5-6 is a nice touch. We even took our glasses to our room while we got ready for our night out on the town. We returned to the hotel around 12:30 a.m., and the hotel was very quiet. The beds were very comfortable too. We had no problems sleeping. Coffee and tea were served in the lobby each morning too. All in all, a very nice stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel For Partiers”
Reviews.Author: Jillianmcdermott
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, upscale hotel, but do not stay here if you want a good night sleep. The pool area and bar, located on the 4th floor, is surrounded by many rooms in the hotel. The pool area is a party area all day and night, until 1 am. It's a great place for 20 - 30 year olds who want to party all night, but forget about a restful night sleep before 1 am.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - Unique Design, Nice Vibe, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: usflyer
Reviews.Content: CONTEXT: Room rate for a single king was about $154 plus tax. First Kimpton hotel for us (normally Hilton/ Marriott people). GOOD: - Very cool stylish hotel with unique designs and great vibe. Mood lighting all around the hotel, fans in the halls, each floor has different mood, and the rooftop bar is very classy looking with fireplaces. - Staff were all VERY friendly and nice. They recommended that we try Richard Walker's Pancake House (5 minute walk from hotel), and this was GREAT. - Perfect location in gaslamp district with easy walking to the ballpark, limitless bars/ restaurants, and 10 minute walk to waterfront and park. - Free Starbucks coffee bar in the lounge in the morning. - Nice toiletries and amenities (although be careful what you use, as anything non-standard is charged here). BAD: - Hotel parking is a steep $20+ per night. We took the advice of a fellow traveler and drove 1-2 blocks on down 6th Ave and parked in the large 24 hour modern garage on the left. We parked at 7PM and left at 11AM and the total was a mere $8. CONCLUSION: My wife still talks about this hotel, and based on our stay here, we will be trying out more Kimpton properties in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Rude front desk staff, noisy, never again”
Reviews.Author: Wayfarer35
Reviews.Content: I lived in SD for 4 years and came back for a weekend getaway. In terms of location and aesthetics, this hotel was up to par with the other Kimpton hotels. It's very trendy, modern and bright. The decor is fabulous and the room itself was spacious and beautiful. It's centrally located so we were able to walk everywhere. We had some maintenance issues with the lighting and they were quick to resolve them. The maintenance staff was so friendly and made up for the rude front desk staff. Too bad we didn't get the actual room we initially reserved (smoking room but we complained so they switched us to the non-smoking room, no jacuzzi tub, located near the pool area). Despite its appearance, there were too many cons to this hotel: 1) RUDE front desk staff. From the onset, they gave us huge attitude as if they were only used to dealing with celebs and we were a waste of time. Even when correcting their errors, they acted as if they were doing us a favor. Perhaps they were overwhelmed because it was a holiday weekend, but for a hotel of this magnitude I would assume they'd be used to the large number of guests. 2) We didn't get the room we reserved: smoking instead of non-smoking, no jacuzzi tub, overlooking the pool. There was no apology, just attitude. 3) NOISE. Oh my goodness. I enjoy a good party, music and a few beers just like everyone else. But I thought I was witnessing a taping of MTV Spring Break. The music started in the early afternoon and continued throughout the night. We left the hotel on purpose and walked around just to avoid the annoying house music. The pool area is full of scenesters and people looking to hook up so you can't relax. We didn't even mind the noise in the hallway because the noise from the pool overpowered it. 4) They brag about free tea and coffee in the morning, but they ran out of lids for coffee cups. When asked if they were going to get more, they stated flatly they ran out. Huh? I would never stay here again. It was obnoxious, loud and not worth the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “A Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kristalynn25
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Hotel Solamar for 3 nights after winning it from a bid on priceline.com. We loved the modern, trendy decor and the upscale vibe. The staff was extremely friendly and we loved their wine hour in the evening. We would stay at Hotel Solamar in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, (potentially) good value”
Reviews.Author: nick_rh
Reviews.Content: The Solamar is a lovely space in a great area of Gaslamp, easy walking distance to just about everything. Inside it's elegant, comfortable, and beachy, exactly what we were hoping for on our SD vacation. Great room, friendly service, and the poolside rooftop bar is one of the hottest spots in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location!”
Reviews.Author: ggirl27
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Solamar is a wonderful hotel near Petco Park and smack in the middle of the Gaslamp district. Perfect walking distance to the convention center. As other reviews have stated, it is quite noisy on Friday and Saturday nights, but the bar by the pool is great place to be on those nights! If you are planning on a nice quiet evening in on one of these nights I wouldn't count on it, but there really isn't a hotel in the gaslamp district that isn't affected by the nightlife on the weekend. The service here is fantastic! You'll feel like royality when you stay here. However, I would not recommend the hotel restaurant JSix. It is extremely expensive and small portions which would have been ok if the food was exceptional but it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Noise”
Reviews.Author: JackTheH
Reviews.Content: Like other Kimpton Hotels, this hotel has a unique, boutique feel to it with very cheery, helpful staff. I stayed here on a recent business trip without issue... until the Friday night, before my very early flight Saturday morning, I had a frustrating time getting sleep as I had to deal with the noise of the outside, pool-side bar. The noise, noticeably louder than previous nights, made me wonder if the hotel was more concerned for its 'scene' and the experience of those bar hoppers than those of their hotel occupants, some of whom need to, shockingly, sleep. I laid there contemplating, "Is this place a hotel or is it a bar?" If sleep is your preference, I advise you either avoid the side of the hotel facing the pool on the weekend, or avoid the hotel altogether.

Reviews.Title: “First Class!”
Reviews.Author: chirp78
Reviews.Content: I usually try to stay within the top 25 hotels reviewed on Trip Advisor but this hotel being listed at #35 gives me much hope for future hotel bookings. We booked the Solamar as a post cruise stay. We were treated like VIP's. Sean at the desk was especally gracious. They even held our friends from the ship, luggage as a courtesy, while we visited. We stayed in a corner room on the 9th floor, with a very deep spa tub. Everything was really clean (something I am always concerned about). The hotel has a very classy, contemporary feel to it. The rooms are much better looking in person than in pictures. The roof top pool and bar was a great place to hang out and have drinks and food (even a swim). Complimentary coffee in the morning in real mugs, crazy animal pattern robes, central to many things to do and see. Our stay was all that I was hoping for and more. The parking was $30 per day which I think is steep but it is catching on at many places. I believe you will love the Solamar

Reviews.Title: “over priced and low value”
Reviews.Author: jovenile
Reviews.Content: we are in the design industry and we know a value based stay verses cheap hotel overcharging because location and cheap design. we new it was bad just when we pulled in to see $30 per night to park... we asked the valet what were the other options and he just smiled and said there are no other options. he was lying... parking is just around the corner if you can find it or a $4 lot behind the building. with the valet it was a $300+ per night stay. we were here for a conference and most of our peers felt this place was probably worth may be a $125-150 stay. i understand this is downtown san diego but this isn't new york or los angeles. we felt this hotel was trying to make a buck where ever we went with their $5 in room toothbrushes to $120 zebra print robes in the closet. should you feel super frisky there was a cheetah print silk pajamas tank top or boxer for $30 each. this place is lame with their cheap excuse for complementary wine @ 6pm and poor design. we also didn't like the 10th floor (just getting our of the elevator) smelling like a fart either.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Solamar: THE place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Denver_jetsetter
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to San Diego where we stayed at the Hotel Solamar for four days. This is a Kimpton brand hotel. It is located in the heart of the Gaslamp District, which is by far the best area to stay for entertainment and dining. Our room at the hotel was perfect. With a beach theme, leather walls, great view, and a comfortable bed we could not have asked for more. They have a wine hour everyday from 5pm to 6pm which is the best way to start off an evening there. They also have a roof top bar by the pool that is beautiful. The staff is some of the best I have ever seen in any establishment. They were extremely helpful with our needs within the hotel and throughout the city. The hotel definitely made our trip all the more memorable and we will be returning there as soon as possible. In one word the Hotel Solamar is: amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly Staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Spauly
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading other reviews on Tripadvisor. We had spent Christmas at the Argonaut Hotel in San Francisco and had been very pleased with this group of Hotels. The Hotel is located within walking distance of all the main shops, restuarants etc. Valet parking is available at $20 per day. When i travel I never skimp on incidentals and therefore do not object to paying for valet parking etc however there is a large public car park just across the road from the hotel where you can park for $14 dollars per day. One of the attractions of coming to this hotel was because it had a New Years Eve Party arranged, which we booked tickets for when I made the initial reservation. It wasnt until we got to the Hotel that we were informed that the party was being organised by an outside entertainment company and that the tickets at $75 dollars each did not include dinner. I did complain to the manager about this but regretably she was not very helpful saying that there was nothing they could do. In the end we had some room service food which was ok The party was really good however and everyone was very friendly which made celebrating the new year all that more enjoyable. Overall this is a really good place to stay. If i visit San Diego again I will certainly stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Zacloed1
Reviews.Content: Great place - clean and friendly. This is a pet friendly hotel - so we brought along our dog. Petco park is 1 block down and they have a leash-free dog park which was great for free-time and potty-time for our doggie. The pool was heated and nice. Not a ton of seating - but enough to get by. Seems like a younger crowd when we were there, but everyone was friendly and loved our toddler. They have a complimentary wine hour in the evening and coffee in the morning. Overall - a great stay. Right in downtown - close to EVERYTHING - especially the stadium if you go for a Padres game.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of weekend stays”
Reviews.Author: She_laughs
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful, overlooking the pool area. Unfortunately, we were not warned that they run a nightclub on weekends, and play load dance music until 2:00 am. The next morning we requested our room be changed to a room away from the pool area. They moved us, but downsized us to a smaller, less delux room.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Restaurant and Nice Outdoor bar”
Reviews.Author: Borntotravel2
Reviews.Content: Normally we avoid hotel restaurants but hearing good reviews we gave it a try. It was nothing short of exceptional! If you don't go to JSix you're missing out. Hotel is nicely done, rooms are comtemporary and it's a matter of taste. Free internet and complimenary wine are nice features. The pool and bar area with the firepits is a nice touch....very cosmopolitian in feel.

Reviews.Title: “Solamar is perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Dixie_in_UK
Reviews.Content: I arrived from London tired, dirty and braindead. I was in San Diego for a meeting and was booked into the nearby Omni for all but the first night. Lucky me that I had one night in the Solamar! Check in was easy-peasy and was upgraded to a luxury room (just because!). The room was wonderful - bedding comfortable, bathroom spacious, and the (free) wireless was superfast. The next morning I ordered breakfast from room service (egg white omelet with spinach and mushrooms) and it was quick and delicious. Check out was simple and they even pointed the way to the Omni down the street (the Omni was perfectly fine... but paled in comparison to the Solamar).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Aurorabo
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I planned a girls' weekend in SD and we enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much. The only glitch was that I had called in advance to request a room with double beds and the receptionist confirmed, but when we checked in the following day they said that if you book through hotwire you only get the option of a room with a king bed. The hotel is nicely decorated and very clean. It is a non-smoking hotel. We don't like pets but pets are allowed at this hotel, they have managed to keep it very clean and odor-free. Our room was very clean and also nicely decorated. And the very best of all, they have a nightly wine hour with your choice of red or white wine. Location is great.
