The immediate surrounding area isn't really pretty..a parking lot and some empty commerical buildings but within walking distance to Gaslamp, the Marina, the ball park, and Horton Plaza. Plenty of restuarants and bars near by to keep you entertained.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: JLFERG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Hotel Solamar for one Saturday night. Because he is a member of Kimpton's loyalty club, we were automatically upgraded to a jacuzzi suite on the 8th floor, and brought complimentary nuts, Swedish fish, and chocolate covered raisins. Our room was spacious, with city views, and great furnishings and magazines. L'Occitaine bath amenities are always appreciated, as is Kimpton hotels' commitment to eco-practices. This hotel is located in the gaslight district and is close to so many things--great shops, fabulous restaurants (we highly recommend Bondi for its delicious food and drink and funky, industrial chic atmosphere.) The wine at the evening wine reception at the hotel (from 5-6) was mediocre; we've had much better at other Kimpton properties. So we went up to the rooftop pool and lounge area and exchanged it for some better drinks. Be aware that while their bar is fully stocked, drink prices at JSix's rooftop bar are pricey. I had a mojito and my husband had a small beer and it cost us nearly $20; a man near us complained that the two glasses of wine he ordered were $25. (And we live in California so we are used to exorbitant prices for everything.) The tea and coffee service the next morning was great--Starbucks and Tazo products for everyone, along with the Sunday New York Times. The staff at this hotel is very friendly. We recommend renting a Prius or other hybrid if you are staying at the Hotel Solamar (or any other Kimpton property) as your overnight parking will then be comped, saying you a good bit of money per night. We'd stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but...”
Reviews.Author: moncherrie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. The staff was very nice and accommodating. However, when you pay this much money for a hotel, they should not charge you for internet access or to make copies in the business center. Besides not having soda machines. I do not care how wealthy you are, no one in their right mind is going to pay $5 for a Coca Cola or a bottle of water.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, surprisingly kid friendly, hip funky decor”
Reviews.Author: ValueSeekerRW
Reviews.Content: Via Hotwire, I booked 2 rooms for one night during the President's Day weekend. The rate was $139/night...and I was initially a bit apprehensive about this being the hotel revealed. It looked very adult-oriented and the reviews have tended to reflect this opinion...and we had two families with one pre-schooler apiece. There wasn't even a mention of cribs being available on the website---although a lot of cool services available for dogs were highlighted. I wrote the property via their website to inquire about the cribs. I quickly received a voice mail message from a very nice man who assured me that they had cribs and to call if I had any questions or further requests. And thus began an amazing experience with the Hotel Solamar's customer service from every single employee we dealt with---from the front desk check-in to the cleaning people we saw in the hall. Everyone seems genuinely delighted to see you and eager to offer recommendations on how to make your stay in the hotel and the area more enjoyable. And bear in mind our party had two almost 3-year old boys in tow (enough to make most people head for the hills). Parents will appreciate how one host named Gordie got down to my son's level, really listened and had a nice conversation with him, and then greeted him by name whenever he saw him. Each child was also presented with a little goody bag of toys, including a thoughtful pre-soaped, duck-shaped sponge that made bathtime a real treat. When the crib was delivered, it was already assembled and was made up with sheets---this in itself is rather unusual! The rooms are a little small, but very well decorated in a hip, modern style. Even the bathrobes are funky----zebra and leopard skin patterned terry cloth! Hilarious! Our bellman who delivered our luggage also kindly pointed out that the honor bar doesn't have those annoying sensors that charge your room if any of the fridge contents get moved---so if you can refrigerate a few small items of your own. The one slight service gaffe was that there was no honor bar key in our room, and it took about half an hour for them to locate an extra one. It seems that most people who get rooms via a discount website get placed on the 4th floor which is the same floor as their pool and poolside bar. The front desk lady was proactive in giving us our rooms facing away from the pool to limit our exposure to DJ noise (seeing as we had young kids), but there was some hallway rowdiness from partygoers entering/leaving the pool area. Nothing terrible though, and the pool closes at 9. The hotel's restaurant JSix is gorgeously appointed, and serves delicious breakfast for a surprisingly reasonable price! Try the Chilaquiles which are amazing! Again, the wait staff were extremely gracious and accommodating to young children. A couple blocks away, the excellent restaurant Basics serves just pizza and salad---but oh, what pizza and salad! The other family vacationing with us originally hail from New York, and they proclaimed it the best pizza they've had on the West Coast. Another great recommendation from the front desk! The location is excellent, only a a few miles away from the San Diego zoo---and a far, far better choice than staying at one of the places on Hotel Circle (especially if you can get a Priceline or Hotwire deal). We will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service and Great Food”
Reviews.Author: Joe_D123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just one night to celebrate my wife's birthday and had such a good experience. Our porter found out it was my wife's birthday and after delivering our luggage, promptly returned with complementary champaign! It was very good champaign too. The concierge welcomed us with a plate of trail mixes and bottles of water. And he made special arrangements at the restaurant at jSix (located in the hotel). We were given more champaign, special appetizers, and desert. I was most impressed because we didn't ask for any of this and it was all complementary. Everyone we saw working at the hotel greeted us with a smile and they were all friendly. The food at jSix was fantastic. Easily worth twice as much as they charge. The room was clean and comfortable. Even the weather cooperated and the rain stopped for our visit. I would highly recommend this hotel and any Kimpton property. They always seem to go out of their way to make the visit a good one.

Reviews.Title: “All the hallmarks of a Kimpton Property”
Reviews.Author: KinWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exactly what I've come to expect from Kimpton -- funky decor, nice bathroom, comfortable bed. Free wireless access in the room was an added bonus. The staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful (but note that we were there on a very quiet evening when not much else was demanding their attention). The hotel is right int he Gaslamp Quarter within easy walking distance of many restaurants and bars. Parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: michbren
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at this hotel and could not have had a more enjoyable experience. We always try to stay at a Kimpton hotel if the city we are traveling to has one and this is one of their better properties for ambiance, quality and outstanding service. It is certainly a beautiful hotel. Having read some past negative reviews I was somewhat apprehensive but either the reviews were wrong or the hotel has greatly improved. Check-in went well, our room was perfect, our stay was without any problems and check-out was easy. The hotel atmosphere is very relaxing and lends itself to having a great time. The wine hour was enjoyable and two of the evenings the manager circulated the room to make sure the guests were pleased with the hotel. Housekeeping did an excellent job each day and never caused us an inconvenience. Every staff member was great. We tried the hotel restaurant for breakfast and it was excellent. Went to the fourth floor outdoor bar. The area was nice but it was too cold to stay. The fitness room was so-so - not very big with limited equipment. The location of the Hotel Solamar is convenient to both the Gaslamp District and the Convention Center area. Public transportation is nearby and the city bus to the airport is a few steps outside the hotel. We took it back to the airport and it took about thirlty minutes. We would definitely stay at this hotel should we visit San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, great location”
Reviews.Author: GogginDE
Reviews.Content: Possibly the best service I've ever received at a hotel. The front desk staff was as friendly and accomodating as could be, as was the rest of the staff. We Pricelined this hotel, and they were still very accomodating about providing a room on highest floor possible,away from any possible street or nightlife noise. I think it helped that it was December, and hotel was probably not near capacity. My one complaint was the pricing for the parking and for the J-Bar (outside bar on 4th floor). $30/night plus tip for valet parking is excessive. Then I ordered 2 glasses of house wine from J-Bar, at $9/glass for the house wine - again, seems excessive for house wine. But with great location of this hotel, there's so many other options available that it wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego: Convient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JRMKentucky
Reviews.Content: Hotel Solamar had a great location in the Gas Lamp District. It was close walk (3 blocks or less) to the convention center and many restaurants and shops in the area. A longer walk (5 to 6 blocks) gets you to the seaside village and Midway aircraft carrier. Beware of the falsely advertised seafood restaurant Anthony's in that area. It was average at best. The hotel featured a nice wine tasting each night in the lobby. It had a fun and relaxed feeling as people interacted in the comfortable setting. The JSix restaurant was delicious and had a lovely atmosphere. The fresh squeezed juices, though adding to the cost of breakfast, were wonderful. Finally, the roof top bar was most pleasant during the wonderful San Diego evenings. I rated this hotel above average only because the room was a bit small, though nicely decorated and quite comfortable with nice linens and matresses. We received the New York Times every morning, and any requests we made were promptly and courteously addressed. Dogs are welcomed at the hotel, but they were never a problem or too numerous. (There were none that I saw during the week, with ony three during the weekend.) I highly recommend this lovely hotel for your stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: debntim1
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for the deal of the day.. WERE WE LUCKY!.. ahhhhhhhhh .. loved the contemporary vib and look.. wine tasting.. we walked everywhere.. make sure to take trolley tour.. worth the$$$ .and Balboa Park is awesome!... everyone at the hotel was friendly and nice!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: batravellerToronto
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through the website and received a really good rate off $147 per night. The hotel is in a great area, the furnishings are mordern and the staff is extremely helpful. We also had dinner at the hotel restaurant J-six which was also excellent. Just wished we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Rendez-Vous ruined :(”
Reviews.Author: maranna4life
Reviews.Content: I booked a surprise get away for my fiencee and I. We were in need of a nice getaway following Thanksgiving. When finding the Hotel Solomar and checking out the website it seemed cool enough with this kind of peaceful, serenity vibe. Even had yoga chick looking ultra relaxed. The picture showed a nice décor, a bit trendy and then I saw a special for “Romantic Rendezvous”. Perfect! The special was to include cold champagne waiting our arrival, chocolate truffles on our bed, and bed and breakfast.yummy! Sounds pretty romantic eh? Oh but NO. Once we got there, the bubbly but unhelpful reservation woman informed us that we did not have the “Romantic Rendezvous” special and instead had some other promotion. Huh? We don’t want another special. I paid for romance so I expect romance dammit! Soon the manager (I guess) sensing a little trouble tried to help saying he would “look into it and let us know if the morning”. Let us know in the morning? That too late! We want our breakfast in bed so this needed to be taken care of right now. Later we got a call that because of the confusion (in which there was no “confusion”), they would credit us $50 for room service (More on this in a second). But what about our champagne? What about our truffles? At least a Snickers bar or something! A bit about the hotel: Actually, in all fairness, it’s not that bad. The location is nice in that it is walking distance to the popular Gas lamp district with lots of shopping and restaurants. The décor was pretty funky, no complaints. The room was nice although small. We were warned about all the noise we would receive since the bar and pool is in the center of the hotel. Hopefully, it was just a bad week for them on this Friday and Saturday night, because there may have been seven people max (2 were bartenders…and 1 bar back). So, huh, noise was not an issue. Probably our favorite part was their complimentary wine hour where the guests can mingle in a pretty cool lounge/sitting area and if nothing else, look cool. More importantly, we found this a time to cash in on our missing romantic package, so we helped ourselves to refills oh about every 10 minutes, “borrowed” the wine glasses (they’re in our cupboard right now) and proceeded to purposely get very buzzed and well, romantic! In passing the front desk, another cheery unhelpful reservation girl asked if there was anything she could do for me. Well yes…give us some champagne! I explained once again how they screwed us out of our romantic package and quite possibly jeopardized our chances of an everlasting marriage. I should sue! She said she would send up a bottle of Champagne. Ok, now we’re getting somewhere. Not even 5 minutes later, they call the room saying they out of champagne. $&*&^! – WTF, how can a hotel be fresh out of champagne. Especially an EMPTY hotel?? Instead we got another bottle of the wine we had already abused earlier. Great. So that evening get ready for our ghetto breakfast in bed with our $50 credit for room service breakfast due to “confusion”. So we decide on eggs some bacon, toast, a bagel, lox and cheese. With delivery charge, tax, and gratuity….$47!!! Double WTF? Another nice thing was that the Hotel Solomar was pet friendly, so we brought our cute little dog, Pepper along. Even he was unhappy as he got attacked by two stray pit bulls in the Gas lamp District. So, considering everything, upon checking out we let him poop on the front lawn (and didn’t pick it up…J/K wink) – Still, this is about how we felt about their “Romantic Rendezvous”…it was crap. The Hotel Solomar is actually a decent place to stay. I think the main problem is marketing it as something it is not. No, you will not have romance there (although the free wine hour helps). You will not find a happening bar filled with drunken chicks. You will not find a real yoga retreat. You will not find a spacious room. You will get an average to slightly above average place to rest your head with a touch of style. Make sure you get a cheap special otherwise if you pay more you are more likely to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location beautiful decor can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: elana25
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Solamar is in a great location with beautiful decor. The pool is located on the 4th floor. There is a bar with loud music by the pool. If you have to get to bed early or need quiet, the rooms on the pool side or probably not a good choice for the weekends. I stayed on the 8th floor on the pool side and could hear some of the music beat but not enough to keep me awake. The staff was very friendly. The hotel allows pets, even large dogs, so if you're allergic, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Solamar: A Great Boutique Experiance!”
Reviews.Author: Wiley12
Reviews.Content: From time to time my wife and I will choose a hotel in the Gaslamp to stay at for the night, check out the bar, go to dinner and have a night away from home. We chose the Solamar based on comments from friends who have stayed there. We were not dissapointed from our experiance. Everything from check-in to check-out was first class. The staff really made you feel like an important person. The rooms are set up with the Kimpton flair that make them stand out from other hotels. The outside bar was a good place to grab a couple of cocktails after check in and before we headed out for the night. Overall, a great experiance.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: Kamtini
Reviews.Content: Kimptons are great hotels because they represent a different approach from the cookie-cutter high-end chain norm. I have stayed at several and the Solamar is better than average. It has a fantastic pool/outside bar area complete with firepits and wonderful drinks (I highly recommend the pear martini). Even if you don't stay here, it should not be missed. The room, however, was just okay - better than a usual chain but not as good as others within the Kimpton brand. There is a really strange white shabby chic mirror that is aesthetically jarring and out of scale with the rest of the interior. (I had read about this mirror on TripAdvisor prior to going and it was true). The room service food was terrible and over-priced. I sent my original order back and its replacement was not much better - the hotel was gracious enough to take it off the bill. The restaurants in the area, however, were fantastic (if you like Thai, Rama is a lovely restaurant with excellent food) This review is a bit of a conundrum for me - while I appreciated the Solamar's uniqueness, I was in San Diego for business and perhaps I was not quite in the mindset for what is clearly a trendy boutique hotel - I would definitely recommend it for the younger, affluent, traveller who wants to be close to the action but doubt I would stay there for business again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Solamar is Not to Be Missed”
Reviews.Author: DCflyboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and to be experienced. It is one of the very creative Kimpton hotels -- the difference here (as explained by the staff) is that this hotel was built from the ground up instead of being a rehab in cool old buildings like most Kimptons. The result is a super-cool pool on the fourth floor that has a cocktail lounge that goes late -- it was crowded every night and fun to watch from my hotel room or to join. Outside firepits by the pool really give a great ambience for cocktails with friends. The rooms are very funky, functional, and fun. It is located near a lot of activities downtown. The staff are friendly and helpful. Kimptons are boutique hotels and a nice break from big chains when you want high class and comfort in a smaller setting. The two criticisms of the Solamar are (1) it seems inconsistent that they would charge for web access -- a hotel of this class should provide it free, and (2) their frequent stayer program is VAGUE -- they simply notice how often you stay and then award you with awards. I much prefer getting points and seeing them add up, such as a Hilton or Marriott program.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy execution of details!”
Reviews.Author: CSBSCValencia
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here, September 23-25. Never again! I had read all the reviews about the noise from the 4th floor pool area and called in advance to be moved to a higher floor facing Petco Stadium. That solved one problem, but many more surfaced. The minibar had been emptied at the request of another guest with the same last name and was never restocked even though I requested it. I call for a late night snack when I checked in on Sunday and room service could not tell me if they had any ice cream left, BUT if they did someone would bring it to me in 45-50 minutes. What they could have done is said if there is ice cream I will call you back and let you know, instead, they left me hanging for 40 minutes not knowing. They brought me ice cream; the knock on the door was a surpise...not how I want desert brought to me. I left dry cleaning on Monday mornng and though it was supposed to be returned at 6pm or so, there was a knock on my door at 10:30 that night with the delivery. Before I went to bed on Monday night I called for a 5:30am wakeup call and they phone rang at 5am, a full half hour early. I dropped by the desk on Tuesday night when I returned from dinner and asked for a 5:30am call and it never came. I returned from my business meeting on Tuesday afternoon to my floor and when the elevator door opened, there was a horrible smell throughout the area. I called downstairs to get some attention on this and nothing had changed when I left for dinner an hour later and when I returned four hours later. I believe that this hotel caters to people in their 20s and 30s who do not mind poor service, failure to execute and do not have any level of attention to detail. While this is a chain hotel to some extent, it lacks the policies and procedures that a chain in this price range should have instiutied. Would I stay here again: I would rather sleep in my car. Would I recommend it to anyone: No.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: jsdodger
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel, the location was the best right at the Gaslamp Quarter. Tip, check in then park a block away it cost $12 per 24 hrs. compared to $24 for 24 hrs at hotel. Fantastic room, beautiful lobby and very nice staff. I paid $100 at Priceline, Hotel website at $250.00 It never hurts to bid low and see what pops for a 4-5 star hotel no matter what city

Reviews.Title: “Pretty to look at... and that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Courtesy_Flush
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline for $125/night which is decent considering the time of year. I was excited to stay at a Kimpton property in one of my favorite cities, but as soon as entered, my excitement vanished. Immediately after getting my bid accepted on Priceline, I called to make sure we would get two beds since we would have 4 adults in the room. The cheery person on the phone assured me that we would. When we checked in, we were told there were no rooms with two beds left because other people had "unexpectedly extended their stay." What?! Our options were to walk over to the Gaslamp Hilton at 11pm and then change rooms again the next day or stay at the Solamar with a rollaway bed. We choose the 2nd option. Had I not booked on Priceline, I would have asked for a full refund and stayed at the Hilton. We weren't the only people running into this dilemma. 3 other parties had the same issue within the 20 minutes while we were at the front desk. And we got the last rollaway bed in the house! After an uncomfortable night's sleep, we called the front desk for breakfast suggestions. Clueless Colleen at the front desk sent to place that-- in her words-- was a cafe with a large selection. She gave us incorrect directions, and the place was really a glorified Starbucks. On our way out, it started to rain, and we got umbrellas from the bell captain. He was a big jerk about it, saying "People, I need these umbrellas back!" I was really insulted. Not the kind of service I expect in a "4 star" hotel. I also do not like the fact the hotel bills itself as pet-friendly. I like animals, but like small children, their owners seem to think it is cute when their babies run around wild.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected...”
Reviews.Author: driving_in_LA
Reviews.Content: When I checked into the hotel, I was pleasantly surprised by the modern, yet understated decor. After remarking the same to the check-in staffer, he smiled, shook his head, and said, "You saw the Tripadvisor reviews, didn't you?" Then, to avoid late night noise (as noted in these reviews), he was able to quickly and efficiently give us a room on a higher floor with a view of Petco Park as I requested. The hotel is undeniably stylish and appears to cater to a trendier crowd. However, the theme is tasteful and not overpowering. The bed and room were comfortable, although the room was a bit small, and well designed. The animal-themed his and her robes are a nice touch as were the name brand toiletries, which my girlfriend recognized and appreciated. On the downside, parking is expensive and cheaper parking is available a block or two from the hotel. The hotel is in the Gaslamp district, so you can explore and still be near the hotel. Very convenient. Overall, given some of the hotel's less than positive reviews here, I was very pleasantly surprised by the helpfulness of the hotel's staff, room comfort and quality of the hotel. Would definitely return if I needed to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Many issues to overcome.....”
Reviews.Author: dakar208
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend earlier this month (Sept. 2007). This hotel has major management issues that began at check-in. Arriving 15 minutes after check-in is supposed to begin, we were told that there were no non-smoking rooms available yet as housekeeping was not finished cleaning rooms. We were told to wait in the bar and come back later. An hour later, we return to the front desk and a room is available. Well, when we get to the room, it smells like an all night poker game just broke up - it reeks of cigar smoke. We return to the front desk and tell them we requested non-smoking. They tell us it is non-smoking- we ask for another room. They give us keys to a room on the next floor and we go there to check it out. It does smell better but there is a room of four 20 something guys that are next door that are wrestling (obviously drunk at 4:30 pm) and going ballistic. We return to the front desk and tell them that a smokey room is better than a frat house. The front desk tells us they can send up house-keeping to spray the room with air freshener - (like that is any better). Going back up on the elevator, several other new guests commented about the non-smoking rooms smelling horrible. For the next 3 days, housekepping doesn't even get to our room before 5:00pm even though we were out by 9:00 am. On top of this, on day 3 maintenance barges into our room at 1:00 am without even knocking even though we have a do not disturb on the door. We over hear them in the hall saying they screwed up and went to the wrong room. This hotel caters to the 20 year olds that party all night and do not care about service or anything else besides the pool bar. Go somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “OK, bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: bill2524
Reviews.Content: This hotel offerred the smallest room of our 4 hotel trip to California, and it was the most expensive. I can accept that being in the city was a part of that cost, but I had expected more. The first few upper floors of the hotel are a parking lot for the guests, controlled by valets. There is parking on adjacent lots yet to be developed, but I recommend using the valets, they are quick and efficient. The hotel was on a corner, but with the rooms up from street level, they are mostly quiet. If you overlook the pool, be prepared for some evening noise from the bar area. Also some hallway noise from thoughtless guests. Did go to the bar area for a looksee, felt sooo out of place! We were the oldest people there! Decor in the common areas was mostly dark, brown shades, caramels, and the room was a also bit odd, plenty of dark brown, but with a bizarre mirror with an unpleasant oversized frame, out of scale. Cleaning was reasonable. The bed was fine, and I slept OK. Bathroom was good, the square sink was a good design feature. The Solamar is at the South end of the Gaslamp Quarter, and there's restaurants and bars on within a short walk. However, I didn't feel entirely comfortable afterdark. Once you realise that the hotel entrance is also the entrance to it's own car park, it's OK to find, and the nearby area is easy to walk and drive in. TV was too large for the small room, it would be OK if it was a flat screen one. Easy access to the trams, convention center, and Horton Plaza. I liked San Diego, it's a great place to visit, and this was an OK hotel. I would go to the Solamar again, nothing actually against it, but if I think I'm not in it's target demographic, which is younger and urban.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: NYCGal1978
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at the Solamar. The good news first....If you like modern boutique hotels, you will be impressed by the decor in both the lobby and the hotel room. Also, if you want to stay in the downtown San Diego area and are debating between hotels like the W and the Sofia, this is definitely the one for you because the Solamar is central to Gaslamp - near the trolleys, restaurants, and shops, while the W and the Sofia are in neighborhoods that are the equivalent of Port Authority in NYC (grungy and technically downtown, but further away from the mainstream and undesirable - I walked by and into both hotels during my stay just out of curiosity). I had requested a room on a high floor facing away from the pool as I had read on here that facing the pool basically means you will get no sleep at any hour of the day. I had called to confirm again the day before that I could get a room facing away on the top floor, but wound up with a room on the top floor facing the pool. I thought that would be fine but it was seriously insane - who has a bar in the middle of a hotel's courtyard with thumping music at all hours? (During the day when you may want to nap before dinner, late at night when you need to catch an early flight...) I'm no grandma - but I do need my sleep eventually, especially since I was in San Diego to tour the area. Its completely ridiculous. Also, the reviews on here that say that the walls are incredibly thin in this hotel are correct. You can hear basically every slamming door and chat in the hallway. That basically negated the whole "chic" experience for me and turned it into a lower end hotel - and this hotel is by no means inexpensive. Missing from this hotel are some of the higher end amenities like a state of the art gym and a bellboy (you drag your own luggage to your room and out of the hotel when you leave). Also there was a general aloofness to the staff. I nearly missed my early flight home because the front desk "forgot" my wake up call which I had requested the night before, and I got better tips on the area and touring advice from a nearby hotel than this one. Again, locationwise and decor-wise, this was definitely a good option, but many of these other characteristics soured the overall experience for me. I guess it depends what you're in San Diego to do.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SFAdam
Reviews.Content: I've generally had good experiences with Kimpton properties but not this time. Perhaps its location - in the Gaslamp District a few blocks from the ballpark - attracts the wrong crowd because I got the impression that most of my fellow lodgers had never stayed outside their homes before and, therefore, had no concept of decorum or consideration of others. Within the first hour of our stay we were subject to some fellows in the room above us hanging out their window and yelling obscenities at passers-by. And at 2 a.m. on the first night of our stay, I felt as if we had accidentally checked into one of the frat houses at UCSD during rush week. The hotel staff was unresponsive to the first incident and slow to respond to the second. San Diego is too competitive a hotel market to put up with lackluster service at a property with an abrasive and abusive clientèle. Next time, I will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Caters to the Young, upscale crow..Not for me.”
Reviews.Author: smgdrums
Reviews.Content: Okay some things I dug about this place...Very friendly staff, decent room, excellent location near gaslamp and Petco. But, I doubt I will go back to this hotel and here is why.. We are a 49 year old couple, no kids with us. The swimming pool is pretty darn small and was just loaded with 20-30 year olds enjoying top shelf liquor and sequenced House music. It was the upscale, beautiful college crowd and there was NO room in the pool at all. Drinks are $10 and we did order some chips and dip..for $18...I swear. It was one big singles club in the water. (I do have to admit that I saw some drop dead gorgeous college girls, but they were loaded with silicone.) Around the edge of the pool was a dark dirty ring...that part really surprised me. There was no area for washing off oils. The seating at the pool is very limited as well. At night, the pool area turns into a very busy club for young folks with a dress code. If you want to go to the pool area as a guest...sorry. You stand in line with the people off of the street. It is one of the busier clubs in town I am told/Okay, enough of the pool. The room was small, but nice. On our last morning we had NO towels, not certain why. The restaurant is trendy, $30-$35 per entree. WE ate on the pier most of the nights so I can't comment on the food. So, it was not for us. I do think this place has a target demographic and we did not know that going in. It is excellent for the young, upscale, college crowd. WE did enjoy some parts of it, but will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “BAD BAD Service”
Reviews.Author: digitaleagle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with a good rate through Priceline.com Unfortunately this was a big mistake even with the decent room rate we received. First we checked in and there was rampant confusion at the front desk. They had our reservation, and even though we called a couple of weeks ahead of time and were assured we would receive a double bed room, we were told that we would have to settle with a single bed. The room wasn't ready at 4:30pm and we had to wait for over a half hour before we could check in. It seemed like we were the first people they had actually ever checked in. Once we checked in we waited over 1 hour for our room luggage. We were told at the front desk that valet parking was a whopping $30 per night. We then checked out the fitness center and pool. The fitness center would only hold about 3 people max. The pool, if you want to call it that, was more of a wading pool with tons of people drinking and grabbing just about anything they could of their significant other. The service at the bar was just as bad. I ordered a beer after I was told it was "happy hour". A beer was only 4 bucks where I guess I should have been grateful because apparently normally they are 8. I also waited over 1/2 hour because the waitress apparently forgot my order. Our room was small and the first thing I noticed was that the TV was not in working order. I called the desk and even after two days no one bothered to fix it. There were also problems with the shower and we had cracks and holes in the ceiling. (Not something you would expect from a "4" star hotel. There was also some kind of "Chic" rust all over the bathroom walls. (I think they call it dirt back where I live. The sink in the bathroom is very unique. I'm not sure who designed it but you can't shave or do anything without water spilling all over the floor. I guess this is supposed to be "Chic" - but isn't a sink supposed to drain the water away? I have stayed at hotels all over the world and I can assure you this is not one of the better ones. The service is terrible and the rooms are noisy. This hotel caters to 20 something Yuppies who want to party all night long. It was noisy in the hallways and if your were unfortunate enough to have a pool side room, I doubt you would get any sleep all night long. I would rate this hotel a few notches below a Marriott courtyard or a Holiday Inn express. I guess this hotel can justify their ridiculous prices due to the location, but I would highly recommend finding some other place for your stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the pool view room”
Reviews.Author: OutWanderin
Reviews.Content: Very chic hotel with lovely, solicitous staff. The room was large and lovely. Comfortable bed, large screen television, and designer bathroom. So what's the bad news? Our room overlooked the pool/bar area. While the view was pretty, we were treated to loud thumping music EVERY evening and for long stretches of time during the day. The music was so loud that it interfered with the ability to relax, sleep, and even get caught up on paperwork. Unfortunately, we usually request a room away from the elevators to avoid noise. So if you do choose to stay here, make sure that you request a room that overlooks the street (in the opposite direction).

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool”
Reviews.Author: scooterchuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Master Suite for two nights during the week. The check in was smooth, valet service prompt ($30 per day). When we got into our room, it was rather warm, so we turned the AC down to 68 degrees, unpacked and headed out to the streets to find a place for lunch. The Gaslamp Quarter is very cool. There are lots of shops and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. We got back to our room and it really had not cooled down much (after 2 hours!). It was really warm outside for San Diego - 85 degrees, so we left it set mid 60's and went down to the hotel restaurant where we were seated in a wonderful private booth and the service and food was fantastic! The pool is really cool, we had a glass of wine in the evening on the patio and also took advantage of the nightly wine reception in the lobby sitting room - very nice touch! All in all, we thought the hotel was great. The deep fuji soaking/jetted tub in the bathroom with the window looking out to the downtown buildings was a treat each night before bed!!! It's alitte pricey, but well worth it for the room size, service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: mlstravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Solamar is a great place to stay in San Diego. From the moment we arrived, we were pleased with our stay there. We arrived very early (before 10 AM) and the front desk did everything to get our room ready as quickly as possible. We were in our room within an hour. The room was spacious and well decorated. The beds were extremely comfortable. The only fault we had with the room is probably the bathroom. The lighting was very dim and the faucet made it difficult to not get water all over the place. When we needed directions or recommendations for places to eat, the concierge was very helpful and attentive. The pool and lounge was very trendy. We enjoyed the music and the people watching. If you are looking for a large pool though, this would not be the place to stay. The hotel is in a great location to the ball park, restaurants and shopping. We were able to walk everywhere. If you like boutique hotels, you will like this hotel. We will definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ltcjoecruz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in downtown San Diego - on the edge of the historic Gaslamp District. If you book a AAA rate, you can save $20-$40 per night and get a large, airy room. Complimentary coffee in the morning and wine in the evening is included in your stay. While not inexpensive, it's a reasonably good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Far Better Options”
Reviews.Author: sgm1
Reviews.Content: The good: (1) A modern funky hotel (2) Well located on the verge of the Gaslamp (3) Evening wine reception and morning coffee (4) Hotel staff are very friendly. (5) Free wireless is always nice. The bad: (1) The hotel rooms are depreciating fast. This was out second visit and within a year the bedroom furniture looks very different. Our white chair was covered in coffee stains and the walls are in need of repair. (2) Avoid the Virtuoso Suites. Our previous standard room was almost as big. The suite we booked this time was dark, the bedroom was tiny and the living room had no natural daylight. The oversized bathtub was nice but other than that nothing very exciting about he room. (3) The pool is a disaster – seating for around 10 people in a relatively large hotel is crazy. It also seems that the pool users are mostly non-guests at the weekend. Locals come to the bar, change in the toilets and use the pool. The pool has a DJ playing very loud music on the weekends. We are in our late 20’s, so don’t get us wrong. But on a Saturday at 12 noon you don’t want music so loud that you can’t talk to the person next to you as you relax by the pool (if you could get a seat that is). (4) Room service. Room service is provided by the onsite (but we were told separately managed) restaurant. We never got what we ordered and when we complained were told ‘too bad.’ One morning they did not have orange juice and decided to send apple juice instead. I declined but was charged anyway! This was just one of a few problems with room service so our advise is to go out for food. (5) Bar. I think this hotel was built as an excuse to have a bar. The bar tends to dominate the hotel and tends to focus on non-hotel guests. We asked if it might be possible to get a table and it was, but only for $250. For San Diego this is a little too much even for the public but you would think that a hotel guest could get a seat without this cost. The worst thing about the bar is the attitude of the bouncers who won’t let hotel guests back to their room to use the toilet. The queue at the bar tends to be long and my wife wanted to go to her room but the bouncer on the hotel exit/entrance told her that if she left she would not be readmitted. This despite the fact that the hotel is directly connected to the bar and this door is used only by hotel guests. So overall, we would save money next time and stay in the Omni down the street. From a prior visit we known that the Omni pool is bigger and far superior, the rooms are nicer and the views are better. We returned to the Solamar because it is smaller and more intimate. But it lacks the characteristics of a small high-end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, great get-away!”
Reviews.Author: crtwrnr
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are just plain fun! Colorful, modern, and check out their leopard print robes in the closet. Literally a stroll away from the trendy gaslamp district, and a short drive from the San Diego Zoo, you can't beat this hotel's location. Plus, they had a complimentary free wine hour every evening, and staying there gives you the priviledge to head up to their very swank rooftop bar that all the kids are lining up to get into. We had a wonderful romantic weekend getaway here, and are ready to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Relax In Modern Style”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugLA
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive about our stay after reading some of the postings -- my main concern was about noise, so I phoned ahead and requested a room on a high floor away from the pool. The hotel was able to honor our request and we found the staff as a whole extremely friendly and helpful. The concierge even went so far as to recommend the lobby of a nearby rival for photo opportunities (i photograph architecture as a hobby). I'm probably a bit biased on the subject of Kimpton Hotels, as I have used the decor as a backdrop for design studies, and I have thoroughly enjoyed my stay in Kimpton Hotels in San Francisco and Washington DC. We enjoy the modern decor and furnishings -- the Salomar's common spaces retain a warmth that other hotels lose in a cold sea of tragic hipness, and that frostiness sometimes makes its way into the attitude of the staff, which is not the case here. Our room was quiet and very comfortable; and we did take advantage of the happy hour. Our only regret was that we did not have a chance to sample the food at J-Six, the hotel's restaurant, but we'll definitely stay there again and try it next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely girls' outing at Solamar!”
Reviews.Author: Racetrackrockabettie
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one fab night at the Solamar 7/22 with 2 girlfriends and was once again reassured by the Kimpton group's commitment to service and style. I have stayed in Kimpton hotels all over the country and Solamar was a gem like the rest. On arrival, our room had not been cleaned yet, so the friendly host at the desk sent us up to JBar to have a round of complimentary martinis. Our room was as I had requested- at pool level, with a wonderful little private terrace accessed by french doors. I sat on the terrace in the hotel-provided zebra bathrobe, reading Truman Capote and drinking wine- bliss! The L'Occitane amenities are a nice touch, and we were provided with extra towels literally moments after we asked for them. Late checkout was a breeze and happily accomodated. The restaurant, though a bit pricy, was delicious. We really couldn't hear the bar noise when we shut the french doors at all, and though our neighbors were partying next door, they were quiet long before the bar shut down. The place is definitely more of a young and hip crowd, which was fine for us. The absence of little kids was actually kind of a relief. I will definitely continue to stay at the Kimpton hotels wherever I go, as the quality and service far surpass other "upscale" venues.

Reviews.Title: “sort of expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: circuitboitravel
Reviews.Content: When I went to check into the hotel, Bruce the front desk supervisor said "we don't have a reservation for you" I gave him my confirmation that I printed from Kimpton. He studied it for 10 minutes plus, and kept trying to find the reservation. I then was told, "Was this a price line booking?" I told him "no, it was a travel agent booking, and I am the travel agent" He then quickly got me a room. It was not the room type that I booked and had to call downstairs to get the room changed, which the hotel did in timely manor. The beds were comfortable, but the towels were the best towels that I have ever experienced in a hotel. The staff was somewhat stuck up. We asked to have a cab called for us, and we were told to walk over to 5th street to get one.

Reviews.Title: “Let Your Hair Down (and put your earplugs in)”
Reviews.Author: KenVicLee
Reviews.Content: In the interest of full disclosure, I signed up for the Kimpton In Touch loyalty program having first been steered to a Kimpton hotel in Washington DC, Hotel George, two years ago. And just last month my wife and I picked the Cypress Hotel in Cupertino, California when we went to see our daugher graduate from Santa Clara. I love the unique things Kimpton does with their boutiquey hotels (most have about 200 rooms) and so signed up for their loyalty program in Cupertino. That being said there are some shortcomings at Hotel Solamar as there probably are with all hotel facilities. Yes, the sink was too shallow (but very artsy-fartsy). Yes, the lighting in the bathroom was too "moody," (dark in the shower, hard to shave in the poorly lit mirror, no fan to extract the moisture from a hot shower). And yes, the music out of our tenth floor window looking down on "the 20-something scene" below thumped all night. We came prepared, however. We were in San Diego with two other couples to attend the Padres baseball game. The other two couples were staying at the adjacent Marriott and were paying more ($259.00 as versus our $229.00) for less service. We grabbed our moment to have a drink at the Hotel Solamar bar by meeting the other two couples there for pre-game drinks, before the hip crowd arrived. We always travel with ear plugs so the noise wasn't an issue later on. We are accustomed to the expensive parking fees in that area. But we love the high thread count sheets with the exquisite decorating that Kimpton's do. We like the personal attention their staff gives and their promptness in rendering service. When we needed our car to get called up to go golfing, it was there when we got downstairs. When we called our friends to see where they were, they were still waiting for someone to bring their car around. Everyone from the reception folks to the bell men were anxious to please and engaged in dialogue. I did check around before booking my hotel for this baseball game. We wanted to be within walking distance of Petco Park and the Gaslamp district. The Omni (where we have stayed twice) was quoting $299.00 for this weekend unless you had purchased their baseball special (which had no availability when I checked). The Gaslamp Marriott was at $259.00, the Convention Center Marriott was at $289.00 and originally Hotel Solamar was at $319.00. But with Triple A (or AARP) the rate declined to $239.00 and the loyalty program took another $10.00 a night off. Cheaper price for a more hip environment with better service???...no brainer. I let my hair down (and put my earplugs in). .

Reviews.Title: “Was worried, but our stay was great”
Reviews.Author: psdabj
Reviews.Content: I ended up getting this hotel for a great price but was worried because of the reviews. I was checking in on a Saturday and did not want a room facing the pool. A week before, I sent an e-mail to the hotel explaining my request and received a reply that they would accommodate me. I was happy at check in to see they had blocked a room on the opposite side of the pool on the 10th floor for us. We never had a problem with noise. From the moment we walked into this hotel, the staff could not have been nicer. Everyone went out of his or her way to make sure we had everything we needed. The wine reception is a great plus. There are many restaurants close, but we decided to take the trolley to Anthony’s for dinner on Saturday night. On Saturday night, there were many young people in their 20’s and 30’s, but on Sunday and Monday it changed to all ages and many families. The parking is expensive, but it is everywhere downtown so they are not out of line for the area. I would recommend this hotel, just make sure your needs are communicated to them before you arrive and you will have a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection”
Reviews.Author: chillijilli
Reviews.Content: We are experienced travelers, having lived in Tokyo for 6 yrs and Dusseldorf for 4. We presently split our time between Grand Cayman and AZ. I say all this because we have been fortunate to have been exposed to some very top of the line hotels worldwide, so I feel I can offer some valid comparisons. Previously while in San Diego, we have stayed at both the Omni and the Marriott downtown. Available downtown hotel rooms were limited on the night we needed, so I booked first and read tripadvisor afterward. That's the reverse of my usual procedure. I was more than concerned by the alleged flea issues, and I suppose arrived expecting some kind of disguised claptrap. Also, because we are middle aged, I thought we might feel out of place in a world of trendy twentysomethings. Was I in for a surprise! Yes, the hotel is pet friendly, as almost ALL European hotels are, even the most fashionable. (Remember, Oprah won't travel without her dogs and if a place is good enough for Oprah, it's good enough for me.) I only saw one pet; a small poodle type, adoringly held by it's owner and swaddled in pink accessories. Hotel Solamar was immaculate. From the strikingly designed lobby area to the designer-inspired rooms, the place exuded sophisticated ambience. The staff was friendly, helpful, and professional at all times and went out of the way to make our stay exceptionally enjoyable. The location is perfect: just steps away from the wonderful restaurants in Gaslamp, and a 2 block walk to Petco Park. Since my husband is a huge baseball fan, I planned a surprise B-Day celebration, and therefore had some special needs. Initially, I asked for a room with a view of the baseball park, and even though we made our reservations through Hotwire, Chip went out of his way to accomodate us. I also had to engage the services of the concierge, Christian. The cake ordered from Extraordinary Desserts (beyond belief!) and 2 special-recipe blended drinks we invented in Cayman were waiting for us in our room following the Padres game. I think every single staff member we encountered wished my husband a Happy B-Day and went way beyond expectations to be sure we had a positive experience. I actually had to force a small gratuity into Christian's hand, as nobody wanted to accept a tip for what I thought was amazing service! They all just said the reward for them was the great fun they had participating in such a surprise! There's a nightly free wine tasting---as many glasses as you like. The pool area is on the 4th level, and lovely. It's quite active around Happy Hour. If you're looking for upscale lodging, with a unique sophisticated atmosphere in a sometimes overly branded world, I highly recommend this excellent hotel! The staff is so exceptional that they truly rank among the best we've encountered anywhere in the world. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Very Different!”
Reviews.Author: hepsales
Reviews.Content: Our travel plans worked in such a manner that we spent one night at the San Diego Omni and the following night at Hotel Solamar. The Omni gets our vote hands-down, but we'd give Hotel Solamar a high ranking also. On the positive side, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the entire surroundings very clean. There is complimentary wine for an hour in the evening as well as complimentary coffee in the morning -- both in an area right off the lobby. On the negative side, parking runs $30 a night (!!) and there is no gift shop or vending machines from which to purchase a can of soda or a snack to eat. There were limited chairs around the pool -- all of which were taken. The decor is very art deco which may appeal to many, but not necessarily to us. Overall, however, the stay was a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: srizzuto
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel thru Hotwire and had never heard of it, so was a little leary given some of the reviews here. Turns out, it IS a pretty nice place. The valet/bell/checkin services were top-notch upon checkin and the room was nice. Parking was $30/night, plus all those tips. But that's what you get in a big downtown city. From there, the service got patchy. The oddest thing was that there was no dresser in the room. So we asked for a room that had one, (my husband is an unpack, move in guy) and the next day they put us in a larger room, but still no dresser. There is a small closet, but you end up living out of your suitcase. We asked a housekeeper and she said there were no dressers in the hotel. There was no phone book in the room, and it took 3 calls to get one. Newspaper service was patchy, some days it was there and some days it wasn't. One day after I called for one, a huge THUD hit the door; that was kind of rude. The bathroom is not well-lit and the sink is too shallow. All in all it was ok, and if I found another great deal, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “so chic, so comfy, so recommended!”
Reviews.Author: mini_tako
Reviews.Content: absolutely love and recommend this hotel to anyone. first of all, it's a great location, right smack in the middle of the Gaslamp Quarter, just a nice walk away from many dining choices (try the Strip Club Steakhouse!). also, close to shopping and a short drive to San Diego Zoo and 15 minutes from dreamy La Jolla. the hotel decor was chic, trendy, and fun. the rooms were comfortable with lots of touches of detail. very clean and comfortable beds. they had l'occitane bath products in the bathroom, nice touch! we even brought a little doxie and he enjoyed it too! extra bonus that this was a pet-friendly hotel. the staff was super helpful, courteous and the valet staff was great too. parking can add up - $30 per day for hotel guests. there is street parking, but its mostly all metered and parking lots are not necessary for overnight. got this hotel for an incredible rate on Hotwire (great place to get deals)! another happy customer at Hotel Solamar. would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Way too loud, stay there to party”
Reviews.Author: rataturium
Reviews.Content: We were placed in a room that overlooked the pool which we thought was great, until we realized that meant noise streaming into our top floor room all night long. If you are young and want to party this is a good choice, otherwise look elsewhere. We requested a quieter room and were told that there were none.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Funky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fomayin
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Solamar on Hotwire... and after I saw the other reviews here, I was a bit concerned. I understand why some of the other reviewers disliked the Hotel Solamar, but it's a fun place, in the gaslamp quarter. You just have to know how to do it! As other reviewers have mentioned, the pool area / bar becomes a happening spot weekend nights. If you like that kind of atmosphere, go! If you don't want a part of that, or want to be able to leave it behind to sleep (before about 2AM), then request a room on a high floor that faces away from the pool. Rooms on the fourth floor are loud, as are rooms that face the pool. Also, as the pool is tiny, and is 21+ only after 9, and for other reasons too, this is not the best choice for families with younger children. Although, the gaslamp quarter is not the best place for families with young children, probably, anyway. Not because it's unsafe or anything -- there's just not that much for the younger crowd to do. Hotel Solamar is pet-friendly, and so there will be guests with their dogs. I didn't once notice any problem... no odors, no pet hairs, no bugs... But, if you are allergic or extremely sensitive -- go somewhere else. Evenings from 5 to 6 is wine & beer tasting, where they have a few types of wine and (typically only one) beer -- usually from local wineries/breweries. They don't always tell people this when they check in... but you should try it out, it's a free drink, plus an opportunity to meet the other people visiting that week. Also, others reported paying $300+/night for rooms here. I booked on hotwire and paid about half that. Of course, you never know for sure what you're going to get.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: alisa110
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute trip and the rates were great. Overall, Hotel Solamar was great. The staff was professional and friendly. The bathroom didn't have much lighting and no vents in the bathroom, but the room and the hotel was very clean. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, fabulous, fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: sc1989
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a fair share of 4-star hotels but this one takes the cake. It was fabulous! Very classy, very chic and the room had the coolest decor of any I had ever seen. Sometimes hotels show photos of a demo room on the internet but the actual rooms are not nearly as nice. Not the case here. Our room looked exactly like the advertised pictures - and looked even better in person. A girlfriend and I left the husbands and kids at home for an overnight shopping excursion. We booked our stay through Hotwire for a phenomenal price. I called a little while after booking and requested a double bed room and was told they would try but could give no guarantees. We got the double beds as requested and our view of the city was great. The staff was friendly and offered help at every turn. As we checked out, the valet even asked if we needed any directions or other help. And the location was fantastic. Great shopping, great dining just a couple of blocks away in the trendiest district of San Diego. Will keep my fingers crossed that the next time I go to San Diego, I will be able to book this exact hotel through Hotwire. The pictures say it all about this hotel. Anybody who complains either had something go unusually wrong (bad things do happen occasionally in life) or they're just negative, "glass is half empty" kinds of people. Can't imagine having anything but high praise for the Solomar.

Reviews.Title: “Flees and Thieves”
Reviews.Author: bogueplayer
Reviews.Content: This is a nice and trendy looking hotel, but be warned... The housekeeping will steal your valuables and there are flees in the hotel. Some money and my gold ring was stolen from the room i was in. No forced entry, so i am assuming it was a hotel staff who has access to the rooms. Also, my gf got biten from flees and bugs in the room. I will never stay at a place that allows pets again. A learning experience for the both of us. Avoid Hotel Solamar in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: profgjay
Reviews.Content: Hotel Solamar is another winner from the Kimpton chain. The decor is eccentric but stylish, with a very contemporary feel. Service was outstanding all around, from the attentive car valets and desk manager to the quick service in the wonderful restaurant. I particularly loved the 4th floor pool/bar oasis. Warning: this is a dipping pool, really, quite small and not meant for lap swimming or more than a few people at a time. Still it was refreshing after a day of hot touring. If you want real quiet, make sure to request a room facing away from the pool courtyard. We did, and got a great room on the top floor facing towards the Petco stadium, where we watched the fireworks after the Padres victory. The location puts you right in the middle of the Gaslamp district of restaurants and bars and minutes from the trolley and convention center.

Reviews.Title: “A San Diego Favorite”
Reviews.Author: boosparkles
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this hotel. It's my favorite to stay at in San Diego. Trendy and comfortable. I love the roof top bar on the weekends. The staff was ultra-friendly and extremely helpful in directions, restaurant recommendations and just their overall customer service. Valet parking is a little expensive, but easy access and friendly attendants.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Choice”
Reviews.Author: skeneSeattle
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I had great hopes for this hotel after reading several reviews, however the hotel fell short of my expectations. The room requested was not available and we landed on the smoke filled fourth floor next to the very noisy bar / pool area. (we had requested a top floor king spa suite, non-smoking quiet room)The rooms were "hip" but not functional for seasoned hotel goers. Absolutely no storage, no dresser either, so personal items are strewn about. The gym was also very tiny and impossible to work out in with more than two people present. The gym was rather dirty, the pool had chair pads with stains and was over crowded. I have visited hundreds of hotels around the US and abroad, Kimpton hotels are usually exceptional, hotel Solamar was not. I expect much more when paying 500.00 per night!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky, classy hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: bice710
Reviews.Content: I had a friend who lives in San Diego recommend this hotel as she had hung out there one night. We were traveling through and spent the night there. The hotel staff is fantastic...so friendly and at the top of their game. It's within walking distance of the gaslamp and Horton plaza shopping mall. Actually, it's perfect because it's far enough from the Gaslamp noise but only a couple blocks' walk. This is a Kimpton Hotel by the way, so if you love their style, this is another great example of it. Ultra-chic and very stylish. Lobby is beautiful and there's a fun little sitting area with a big fireplace. Our room was overlooking the pool and bar. The bed was very comfortable and they also upgraded us to an "extended tub"...it was an extra-long jacuzzi tub. Interesting, I'm not sure what the benefit of extra-long was because it didn't fit 2 any better than a regular bathtub, oh well. :) They do have FUN animal print bathrobes...I so wanted to take one but they were custom for the hotel and I'm sure it would have cost about $200! We went down to the pool bar area and again, very swanky with long couches and big bowl firepits all over. Partial view of the city, very cool. One weird thing was that they wouldn't let us smoke over by the firepits (against the edge of the building) but we could smoke at the bar, where all the other people were sitting. Wouldn't it be the other way around? Anyway, all in all we loved the hotel and would definitely stay again. By the way, they are a very pet-friendly hotel if you have pets.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and hip”
Reviews.Author: mrcowan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Solamar for two nights and had wonderful time. Rooms are nice and bed is comfortable. The room was just tad crowded and no room if you have a lot clothes there isn't any storage space besides the closet. Loved the bathroom. Service was great and I loved the Pool area. I have stayed at Omni twice. If you can't get view of water at Omni. Go with Hotel Solamar.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: nails4
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through Priceline and got a great deal. We stayed for 6 days during the last week of March. To start, we were welcomed by a very friendly staff. We arrived at 10 a.m. and the hotel accomodated us by letting us check in and immediately go to our room. Every employee we dealt with was very professional and charming. Make sure to check out the FREE wine and beer tasting from 5 to 6 every night. The best feature of the hotel was the 4th floor bar (Jbar) and pool. The atmosphere at night was very hip and popular, while during the day the pool was very tranquil. I highly reccomend staying at this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel...”
Reviews.Author: einnorcal
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Very modern and cool boutique hotel located downtown San Diego in the Gaslamp district. Decorated beautifully. Our room was decorated in dark chocolate browns, turquoise, dark blue, and white. The bathroom was beautiful. The only small complaints we'd have are two things. The bathroom is gorgeous but the vanity is not very functional. It's a beautiful brown wood with a modern square sink but the water splashes everywhere. There isn't enough counter space to put your toiletries. The other complaint we have is that there is no dresser in the room to put your clothes in. You basically have to live out of your suitcase and for a family of 4, that was a bit tricky. You can tell that the hotel is designed for a quick business trip and not necessarily a family vacation. The other thing to keep in mind is that there is no self-parking. Valet parking is $30 a day. Overall, the hotel was great and we'd stay there again in a heartbeat. You won't be disappointed just keep in mind the few things that we mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy & Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Annettesb
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our weekend in San Diego for our anniversary. I was in heaven when I was there. The Staff from moment we walked in until the time we left was amazing! They all were helpful, polite and very friendly. We stayed in the corner king suite. The room was beautiful. We got to go to the bar at the pool and ate dinner at Jsix. The dinner was absoutly yummy. We got special service because of our anniversary! The chef sent us a compliment of one of his creations. This place was off the charts. Take a look at this place when you visit San Diego. I give five stars. Thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: CherryDerby
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Solamar. Friendly helpful staff, the hotel was stylish and relaxed. Our room was at the back, very comfortable, the bathroom was impressive. The location was near to the trolley which you could take to Seaport village. The Gaslamp area was great for eating out with a lively but friendly atmosphere. We would love to visit again but would probably choose a hotel overlooking the sea next time for a change of location.

Reviews.Title: “The Solamar with Small Children (mid-week)”
Reviews.Author: iname2000
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews for this hotel after having made the reservation, I was very worried about staying here with my two children under 4. However, unlike what is mentioned in some reviews, we never felt out of place with our children. The hotel definitely caters to the well-dressed hip-crowd but having children does not automatically put us on the other end of the hip spectrum. Now this may have to do with the fact that we arrived on a Sunday and left on a Wednesday but all of the hotel's facilities - including the pool bar and especially the restaurant - were very well suited for children. All staff was extremely friendly and The location was phantastic, too, as you are right in middle of the "Gaslamp District", which is great for walking around. There is also a bookstore close by in case you encounter some bad weather like we did. To sum it up, we were really, really pleased with this hotel and the phenomenal service, which we received. We would most definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Solamar Hits the Spot for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: rodndtube
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the chic Gaslamp District of downtown San Diego, close to the convention center and a block or so from the baseball stadium. Trolleys run not too far away. Rooms were clean and comfortable and not cramped. A chest of drawers would have been nice, but the in-room safe is free and easy to use, plenty of outlets, and broadband internet is complimentary (plug in or wireless). Later afternoon features a happy hour with selected wines and a featured Coronado craft beer -- excellent way to top off a day's work. Staff friendly and courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “This place ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: Zonabill
Reviews.Content: I just completed a 2 night stay at the Solomar and couldn't be happier! I'll start with the staff. They were all very friendly, helpful and actually seemed to take pride in their jobs! This started the moment we exited our cab (Even though we arrived prior to 8:00 A.M., check in is at 3:00 P.M.) with the doorman and continued with EVERY employee we encountered for the duration of our stay. The people at the front desk were all very friendly and helpful with local info. When I requested a coffee maker from housekeeping it arrived at our door (With a smile) in about 5 minutes. The rooms decor was very relaxing and had everything I needed from internet access to one of the most comfortable beds I've ever had in a hotel. In fact, it was comfortable to the point that I'll be replacing my own bed within the month. The linens were all of superior quality and seemed to be almost new. In the cleanliness department the only fault I could find would be the windows (This is nit picking as I have been told it had recently rained), other than that the place was immaculate to the point that there weren't even any watermarks in the tub, sink or on any of the fixtures. The other 2 things I'd like to cover is the location (PERFECT!!) and the construction noise. In short, there wasn't any even though there were 3 active construction sites visible within a couple of blocks of my room (520). When I had the window closed the outside world just seemed to disappear. I will definitively be visiting this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaLove_travelling
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets it all! Rich interior. Better than some of the five star hotels I've stayed in. Quick Service. Perfect for a romantic get away. Try it out yourself. I bet you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: CharlesLondon1
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay! The room was very nice, staff was very friendly and the location was perfect. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: improvman
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to book a room here because of mixed reviews. Based on other reviews, I requested a room away from the pool. Our request was fullfilled and our room overlooked Petco Park. The wine social was nice, although the wine was nothing special (choice between sparkling wine and Syrah). The concierge was rarely at his post when I needed him, but it could have been bad timing. Expedia had a GREAT deal on an air + hotel package for this hotel, which may have been due to a bug in the database, but I'm not complaining (it was considerably more on other sites).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: skydisaster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for our 10th anniversary. It was wonderful. The rooms were quiet and very comfortable. The location was great. We were a block from the trolley. We walked to everything in the gaslamp district. We could see Petco Park from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aefaboy
Reviews.Content: Kudos Hotel Solamar! Trendy, upscale and warm. We've stayed in many hotels from NYC to San Francisco and Hotel Solamar competes!!!!! Wonderful decor and excellent service. Had no issues with the Bar or noise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: alfie92
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Solamar hotel as part of our tour down the west coast, we have been to San diego before but we wanted to stop in the city and not on the hotel circle. We loved the hotel, its location just 2 blocks to the Gaslamp area, the rooms were spacious very clean. The restaurant in the hotel J6 was very good we had 1 evening meal there, and we went every morning for breakfast. We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights over a weekend it was very busy and has mentioned in previous reviews the hotel roof bar is very busy with both locals and visitors , our room was overlooking the city so when we went to bed we heard no noise, but i imagine if you had a room overlooking the pool it would be noisy till late! also another point, we decided to go to the pool sunday afternoon for a spot of sunbathing, when we arrived it was very busy but it was like a chilled club night! The above points didnt spoil our stay and i would definately stay at the Solamar again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: jenniferlpatrick
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, the hotel is nicely decorated and the beds are comfortable. I recommed this hotel to young singles. The hotel's charge for parking was high, but that's the way it is at all hotels in the area. Stingaree, the restaurant/ bar across the street was good. Cafe 222 was recommended for breakfast, but the service was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want to sleep at night”
Reviews.Author: AnonTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a hip, trendy hotel with a terrible service. Do not stay here if you want to sleep at night. There is a bar on the second floor by the pool, which is a popular hangout and when we stayed there on a Friday night, they played loud music until well past midnight. We simply could not sleep that night. We called several times to the front desk to complain and they did nothing other than to apologize. Moreover, after the bar closed, the party-goers made big noises in the hallway (I guess they were staying at the hotel) and interruptted our sleep even longer. It was just one of the most umpleasant stays we've had to endure. Don't be fooled by the nice ambiance and spend your dollars elsewhere. By the way the restaurant JSix, which is located on the first floor of this hotel, was excellent. We had a very good breakfast the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Smallhill
Reviews.Content: Overpriced hotel in trendy old town area of San Diego. Rooms are comfortable. Restaurants are limited. Room service food selections very limited, and they charge 20% service plus delivery fee. Parking charge is $26 per day. Wireless internet connection in room is very unstable, frequently breaking off. Service is friendly in a formal, phony way. Not worth $300+ per day. Do yourself a favor, you can get much better value in San Diego than this.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - fab location”
Reviews.Author: ash2020
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego for a week and on check in they seemed surprised that we were staying for so long - guess it is just a short stay place. The room we had was a great size with all mod cons and funky design. The staff were friendly and went out of their way to help - even exchanging travellers cheques which was a service that they didn't usually provide! Hotel is situated in an excellent location a block a way from 5th street where all the funky shops/restaurants and bars are (also they are building the Hard Rock Hotel at the end of the street so this will bring even more life to the area when it opens next year). The food and drink is priced accordingly - the portions are large and you are paying for the location as everywhere else we ate/drank around the gasslamp was similarly priced. The pool area was quiet during the day and the bar was only busy on a Friday and Saturday night but closed at midnight - some friends had a room over looking the pool/bar and said that the noise was not an issue. If i ever go back to San Diego then i will def be staying at the Solamar!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: osutravel
Reviews.Content: Let me say that San Diego is a great city with lots to do. However, if you plan on stayin at a hotel with ZERO service and overpriced atmosphere, then stay at the Hotel Solamar. There is a general sense with the receptionists that having an attitude and lecturing guests is "OK" in the hospitality business. Just ask receptionist Rebecca who instead of rolling with the flow, berated us about luggage checks and even had the audacity to ask "if we've stayed with them before" prior to switching from a $500 a night suite , to a room with 2 double beds. Please look at your guest index to see that when guests have already spent $2000 in 4 nights, that yes, they have stayed with you before. And I havent even mentioned the techno DJ by the pool blasting music nightly till 10pm and even on Sundays! Overall, do not stay here. Stay at the Hilton which is much nicer as is the Omni. San Diego is a very laid back place but if you feel like spending a lot of money for a lack of service, then the Hotel Solamar is yours

Reviews.Title: “If you're in your 20s with no kids, this is the place for you.”
Reviews.Author: normella
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I celebrated our birthdays from August 25th to August 28th at the Hotel Solamar. Beforehand, I read all the reviews and, while many of them were negative, I suddenly realized why. All the people reviewing negatively were either older or had kids with them.
