Upon arriving at the hotel, we were greeted by valet (parking for 24 bucks is not too cool, but whatever). The guys were very attentive and nice the whole weekend. We stayed on the 7th floor, overlooking the Gaslamp District. We never ended up going to the pool bar but it was no biggie. Room service was prompt and very friendly, and the front desk was helpful with recommendations of good restaurants and bars to head to at night. The room was beautiful! We stayed in the king spa suite and I couldn't have asked for anything more wonderful. The tub was big enough for two, the decor was modern and fabulous, and the bed was super comfortable. Overall, I had a great time. I was expecting less because of all the reviews but I have some words of advice. Please don't go to the Hotel Solamar if you have children. For the sake of your good time, their good time, and single people's good time, it might be better to book a room at a more family-friendly spot. But, considering the hotel is centered in the middle of the bars and clubs of San Diego, this is exactly what you would expect. I couldn't have had a better time.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it says on the tin!!”
Reviews.Author: sm16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Friday 25th -Monday 28th August and the previous reviews are spot on. Firstly let me say that I have not got a problem with the twentysomethings around the pool and the fact that it is hectic to say the least - I just wish the Solamar advertised the fact. The good points are very good: 1 Location Fantastic location - an easy stroll to the harbour, near all the restaurants and bars in the Gaslamp area (if you like fish you must try McCormick and Shmidt at the Omni on the same street - wonderful catfish)and if your going to a Padres game, its aroundthe corner. 2. Rooms Our room had a pool view (we will come to that later!!!) and was large, clean and very pleasant. Big bed and a lounger were good. 3. Facilities Gym was small and got crowded very easily. Had breakfast in the restaurant which was very nice. Wine tastin is a must. Early evening for an hour. Worth noting however that if its not busy (as with the Sunday of our stay) they dont hang around. Around ten mins to go and they had took all the wine and no one was around to get anymore. Now the problems. There really is only one problem with the hotel and that is if you go to the hotel at the weekends and you not looking for that type of atmosphere (ie loud music, loud people, no room, bouncers on the door) then forget it. Its like that all day long and goes right the way through the night. This also means that if you have a pool view room get some earplugs - your gonna need em!! I agree with some of the other reviews in that the hotel just does not seem to know what it wants to be. To be fair we got a very good deal through Priceline but if we had paid full price - we would not have been happy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Confused Hotel”
Reviews.Author: grahamc100
Reviews.Content: Like many of the people who hang out here, the Hotel Solamar is trying to figure out what it wants to be. We stayed over Labor Day Weekend and I have to agree with most of the other recent reviewers. First the good: location, location, location. It's an easy walk to the many restaurants of the Gaslamp District, an easy walk to Petco Park and an easy walk to Seaport Village. Our 9th floor corner room was said to have a 'lot more room than our normal rooms." I'd hate to see the normal rooms, then. There was literally no space to put clothes. One small drawer on one side of the bedside, and a mini-drawer under the mini-bar. Even smaller was the bathroom. There was no place to hang a hand-towel. We couldn't find room for our own toilet items. And the sink had good form, but no function. The biggest disappointment was the hotel staff. Pleasant but it felt like they were in WAY over their heads. We asked for directions to two nearby restaurants and they had no clue. There was no concierge to ask, since the hotel doesn't have one. When we asked for information on nearby tourist sites, once again they had none. So, I finally asked the front desk if I could see a phone book to look up a number and was told, "Sorry, we don't have one." There was a Padres game Sunday afternoon, and since it was a holiday weekend, the pool area was packed starting around 3:00 with people who wanted to drink to get drunk. There was no way to use the pool, which shouldn't seem like a lot to ask for rooms going over $350/night. Finally, try to find out how recently a dog stayed in your room. While I was at the desk trying to get a phone book, three different people called, asking for a room change. One was because of the noise from the pool, the other two were because of the animal smells. This is a good place to stay, if you don't plan on spending much time in the hotel, or you don't want any help from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Party is here - for the 20-something crowd”
Reviews.Author: CherHaines
Reviews.Content: If you're going to San Diego to party with the young and fabulous, this is the place to stay. The location is right in the middle of the Gaslamp Quarter nightlife - and the 4th floor rooftop bar at the Solamar is clearly one of THE places. However, if you are a 40+ year-old and just want to be able to chill at the hotel bar or pool where you're staying - think again. After 5:00 p.m. both were a total mob scene and, as a 45 year-old, I was the "adult supervision" in the place. Here were a couple of bad experiences: 5:00 p.m. and I decide to sit by the pool with my book, but the "bouncer" tells me I am not allowed to bring my bottled water with me to my chair. 8:00 p.m. and we go the bar for an evening cocktail - $26 gets us a glass of wine and a mojito. Ok, now to the hotel. The front desk staff were efficient and polite, but neglected to give us a mini-bar key. When we asked for one, they said they were "all out" and we could ask housekeeping. Eventually they did find us a key, but isn't it weird to not have enough keys? The room was very nicely appointed, bed comfy, nice decor, windows that open, high-end ammenities, etc. No complaints there. My favorite part were the leopard print bathrobes. I booked our stay direct through the website on a Kimpton Hotels package. Fri/Sat night in August including Hertz car for $350 including taxes. Not bad. All in all, the trip was fun. Just made me feel my age a bit :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay- Hotel Solamar was flawless!”
Reviews.Author: tammigop
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, the Hotel Solamar was perfect. A welcomed addition to downtown San Diego. The bell staff was extremely attentive, and check in was flawless. I was shown to my King Deluxe Spa room, and it was awesome. The colors were very well paired- chocolate brown and light blue- my favorites! I decided upon arrival to have a massage in my room. I called the concierge, and had a massage therapist at my door in an hour!! The soaking tub was a great treat, (although tough to navigate if you're short like me!).. The amenities were all Aveda, and well sized! It is true, the pool/bar area is totally chic- and NOT suitable for families/kids- which I think is one of the best features of this hotel! Its just nice to have an oasis in San Diego thats relatively kid-free. Spent an entire afternoon out at the pool- it was like heaven. I cannot recommend this place enough- stay here if you think you're cool enough!

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel That Caters To the Party Crowd”
Reviews.Author: PlanBauer
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Ritz, the Quality Inn, and all levels in between. As with any other hotel, one needs to select the hotel based upon the proper mindset and occasion. Hotel Solamar has quite mixed reviews and I was very apprehensive prior to arriving. I'm pleased to say that I can understand why it does have these mixed reviews - people are choosing this hotel for the wrong reason. Solamar is located on the edge of Gaslamp District, which is known for a party atmosphere - the exact reason why I visted the area, a nice wkend to relax with the Missus. Anyhow, Solamar does cater to a younger, "party" crowd, and if you book here, that should be what you are looking for. If you are looking for a place to conduct business or go to sleep at 9pm, this is not your hotel. Staff was very friendly and accomodating, although a formal concierge service would be nice.

Reviews.Title: “posh and trendy, wild weekends”
Reviews.Author: brahmagupta
Reviews.Content: The room was so modern and the decor was very fun. I enjoyed the atmosphere at the hotel and the staff was very courteous. Our room was cleaned early in the day and it felt very clean. We had wanted two beds, but only a King was left, but we were upgraded to a corner room which was very large. Our room overlooked the pool/club area. It was a nice view. The bathroom was very nicely appointed with quality features, but the lighting was very soft. It was nice and calm in the morning until time to take a close look in the mirror and apply makeup and the it was just too dark in there. I was surprised there wasn't better lighting or a better fan. The wallpaper was ubsosrbing all the moisture, which might lead to problems later with mold. We were greeted professionally by the desk upon our arrival. We were offered a roll away, but ended up being fine sharing a bed with my daughter. The bed was VERY comfortable. We had no trouble with the parking, (valet only $24 a day) we were always noticed by the tag in our window and given priority parking and service as hotel guests. On the weekend the club seems to be one of the hottests places to be. THe lobby was filled with security people and the elevators. THere were people posing a guests of the hotel trying to get into the club sneaking around the hotel. It was uncomfortable to be a hotel guest with all these other people lurking around. We went to our room and the minibar hadn't been restocked, my daughter wasn't feeling well and wanted a sprite. We went to go find one from a soft drink machine. We couldn't find a machine, so we made our way down stairs. Maybe there was one on the floor of the pool/gym but the area was full of people all dressed up and so we didn't feel comfortable getting off there in our "loungewear" to look. We asked a few people where we could get a soft drink, but they told us they were all security. We finally went to the frontdesk and were told they would send us up one in 5 minutes, but it never came up. This hotels seems to be two different places, a nice hotel of qualilty service during the day, but the weekend nights seem to be all about the club, and servicing it. THe hotel guests are not the main focus of service, or at least that was our experience. I had been moving my daughter in all day, and was looking forward to a quite soak and swim, which is a usual relaxing experienceat a hotel, but we came back to 200 people surround the pool, which became part of the decor and atmosphere of the club, not something accessible to hotel guests. It seems to me they need to decide what they want to be or offer another area for hotel guests to enjoy. For the price, for a hotel guest to be made to feel like an outsider and second for service was shocking. It is a nice place, just know what to expect and a quiet weekend of being pampered won't be it. Also, I noticed men taking "women" up to their rooms from the club, which seemed a bit awkward and like a skanky Vegas hotel instead of a nice clean upscale hotel. It was a strange mix, but over all during the week I would say it is one of the best hotels in SD. During the weekend expect a party scene, with noise until 1 am easily.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return”
Reviews.Author: ShaunaSchain
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there this weekend for business/leisure. This is the fifth Kimpton property I have stayed in, and I have always had good experiences. Solamar was a major disappointment. The biggest problem is the pool/bar which is managed by an outside company. While fun for the 20-somethings into blaring techno-pop, not so great for the average guest. The bar is open to the public, therefore the pool is open to the public. The loud music starts at 11am and goes well into the night. Particularly brutal is any room facing the pool, unless you don't mind the "thump thump thump" coming through the closed windows all day! My husband and I asked to be moved to a different location, and despite complaints to management, our request fell on deaf ears. There was only one working elevator the entire weekend, which had to be shared with the hoards of 20-somethings going to the pool/bar. It took us 15 minutes to get an elevator to our room! This hotel is so un-Kimpton-like it's unbelievable. I would definitely not recommend if you value peace and tranquility. I couldn't wait to get out of there and check into my quiet room in LA, if that gives you any idea.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST Hotel Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: cpais
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst experience I have ever had at any hotel. First it started with valet telling me their lot was full, and I would have to park across the street. Just as I was about to pay the meter, I realized all cars would be towed between the hours of 2am-6am. I came back and told the valet manager my distress of having to worry about my car being towed. He then informed me, he was not aware of that rule because he did not work that "lot", then suggested I just keep driving around and find a "self-parking" garage. Infuriated and deeply frustrated, since I had booked 3 rooms for the weekend for a bachelorette party, I asked to speak to the hotel manager, who also told me that she was "sorry" and unfortunately the lot was full, blah, blah , blah. Dinner by the pool consisted of bad food and even badder service. Since when was snooty and rude service meant a place was "cool"? Although the ambiance was nice, the service from numerous employees was so atrocious it definitely tainted the experience. Tried to have breakfast at (JSix) the hotel's restaurant the next morning and was told that it would take 20 minutes to sit 7 people and another 20 minutes to sit another 7...so "maybe we should consider going elsewhere". Wow! I thought I was on candid camera...because I couldn't believe it. I would never ever recommend staying at this hotel. There are many other trendy and chic hotels with better customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: KristaLB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Solamar 7/6-9 and had a great time. Granted we fall into the 30 something/bar crowd so my opinion is different from the other reviewers. The hotel and rooms are very modern and clean. I never even saw someone with a pet. The bar around the the pool is a great place to relax and people watch. It's in walking distance to Seaport Village and all the great restaurants and bars in the Gaslamp Quarter. We ate at Croce's one night which was excellent! The hotel food is good but overpriced (like most hotel restaurants). The only negative was we had returned to our room at 5 one evening and housekeeping had not come yet.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about the Solamar”
Reviews.Author: annekr
Reviews.Content: My 17 year old daughter and I arrived on a Thursday. We had booked the accommodation through Virgin Holidays and requested a twin (two bedded room) but on arrival were advised that they didn't have may of these and we would have to share. Disappointing but no major disaster. Pool area was lovely and friendly that afternoon. However as the weekend crowd arrived from Friday onwards it became impossible to get a seat by the pool and as mentioned by others it was uncomfortable to go swimming with the non resident crowd dominating the bar/pool area. The evening wine reception was a welcome bonus and the hotel location was excellent for shopping and eating out. Saw a few dogs around the place but there was no evidence of fleas or odours where we were. The complementary internet access was a bonus. Staff not very geared to tourists however with poor knowledge and information on trolley bus etc. I would stay again if not at weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service and Amenities - Great Ambience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The "new and trendy" hotel in San Diego has a fatal flaw: it caters to the twenty-something crowd, and that's it. My fiancee and I were terribly disappointed when we found out that the pool area, which looks great in the photos, is converted to a local pick-up joint in the evenings. Most, if not all, of the barflys were not hotel guests, and nobody was swimming. So, to swim, a guest would be ogled by about 100 puerile non-guests. Also, a cozy cabana seating area near the pool had a "reserved" sign on it. When we inquired about guests using that particular facility and how to reserve it, we found that anyone can reserve it, guest or not, and paying $300 for the evening with a five drink minimium. Needless to say, we were astonished to discover that advertised amenities were not available to paying guests. Other serious shortcomings were poor service, dirty sheets, and obnoxious bartenders. For the money, the Hotel Solamar is a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Fleas at Hotel Solamar”
Reviews.Author: ilevare
Reviews.Content: THERE ARE FLEAS in the HOTEL SOLAMAR!! I was impressed with the decor, the styling and the comfort of the room UNTIL I discovered that the room had fleas. I was stretching in my room when I discovered at least two fleas hopping on my person and on the carpet. As the SOLAMAR is a pet friendly hotel, the fleas, no doubt, are the results of dogs having been in my room. And while the dogs and their owners may have checked out, not so with the FLEAS. Whilst I found the ambience of the hotel charming and would have loved to have remained there, I had to quickly flee the premises for fear of being bitten by the fleas.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It seems to me that most of the good reviews were patrons who were either local or from LA. Not being local, perhaps my expectations are different, but nevertheless I am a seasoned traveler for many years. My check in clerk was abrupt and did not quite let me finish my sentences. I indicated that I do travel frequently and am excited to be there. The reply was we dont have any more upgrades available. Room was small, had smelly pillows and fridge was noisy. Next day I was giver an even smaller room. The pillows still smelled. The small fitness center had no towels, the water container was empty. I called front desk about the problem. Next day, they had water. No towels. One out of two is still bad. Next evening asked about wine reception, as I overheard guest talking about it the day before, front desk clerk said, your late, it stopped at 6. I dont know what is wrong with asking, but I do expect, a more cordial response of .. I am truly sorry... PS they did not even tell me they had one upon my check in. The only reason I stayed for 4 nights was the proximity to the business I was attending to and a convention was on so rooms are limited. Next time I should stick with my plan. I would rather stay in any other hotel than be treated poorly again. On one slightl positive note, the room service was on time, but they got part of the order wrong. Fool me once shame on you fool me twice shame on me. I most certainly do not recommend this hotel. Unless you tell me you are a meter maid, IRS auditor, or a wise guy.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LQGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here May 13 for a quick getaway! We did our research and heard some really good, and some really bad things about this hotel. Well....having stayed, I'm glad we did! Upon pulling up in our car, we were immediately greeted by both the valet and security. They were prompt and courteous (not sure what happened to those other reviewers who said they were not there). We then walked through a very chic lobby (modern and dark...very urbane and tastefully done). Check-in was prompt (and our schnauzer, Rudy loved the treats given by the receptionist!). The room was also very tastefully decorated! The bed was quite comfortable (I'm usually a fan of Westin's Heavenly bed) but this was close in level of comfort. Lots of nice touches like the large mirror on the side wall, subtle but nice wallpaper, DVD player in room, etc. The bathroom was also quite nice. The sink was really cool to look at. In terms of practicality, I felt sorry for the maid, as the water splashs around the sides and back of it. Great Aveda bath products! We did not dine at the hotel, so we cannot comment on that. The pool area was actually very nicely done as well! Pool is smallish, but the deck area has a bar, fire pits for the evening, etc. Again, very chic...very nice! I'd give this an excellent rating, except that there was one flaw with this hotel. The walls...they're paper-thin! There is nothing worse than being awakened at 2AM by your neighbors doing...well...adult things! To the hotel's credit, apparently these people in the room next to us were SO loud that they were asked to leave, according to the front desk. So at least they addressed the issue (and I don't think that a hotel should bare the blame for irresponsible adults who stay there). So all in all...we would definately return!!

Reviews.Title: “Solamar was perfect for a weekend getaway, especially at the price I paid!”
Reviews.Author: LarkspurGirl
Reviews.Content: I have to confess I was a little nervous about staying here, having read some of the other reviews. I got what looked like a great deal on Travelzoo for a king sized room for $129 a night and grabbed it for my husband and I to spend a weekend in SD tagging it on to a business trip he was taking. Our trip to SD was a heck of a lot longer and more frustrating than it should have been, due to a flight delay and the people at the car rental company who took an inordinately long time to get us in a car and on our way. As a result when we arrived at the hotel we were several hours later than planned, and tired, hungry (had pushed back our dinner reservation TWICE) and cranky. The valet guys were super nice, and when we got inside the guy at the front desk was also incredibly sympathetic and would have upgraded us to a better room had there been any available. When he was telling us about the wine hour hosted in the lobby every afternoon, we sighed and said we should have been there for that if it hadn't been for our delays. And so he went and fetched us a bottle from the back, handed it to us and hoped that our weekend would only get better from here on out. That evening we had dinner at JSix restaurant (attached to the hotel). The food, service and wine were all very good and the staff incredibly attentive and friendly. We had to pay $18 a night parking fees - which is I suppose par for the course for any downtown hotel these days. Other than that, I had no complaints at all about our service, and considering the price I paid for the room, was all in all extremely impressed. And the decor is beautiful. Sometimes the beauty doesn't quite work as functionally as one might like (e.g. the lovely looking sinks in which it's virtually impossible to wash!) The locationis fantastic (Gaslamp quarter) and SD is a clean, neat, friendly and accessible city. We also ate dinner at Buon Appetito in Little Italy (took the city tramline to get there, incredibly easy). Brunch on Sunday at Hash House A Go Go in Hillcrest (don't eat for 24 hours before you go, or SHARE), and dinner Sunday night at George's by the Cove Terrace in La Jolla. Would recommend all of them.

Reviews.Title: “Gaslamp Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: pydnar
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is well-appointed, very contemporary. Our suite was decorated in a West Elm vein, the bathroom was interesting (ours had a large window). However, the staff is at best untrained. We chose the Hotel Solamar for our wedding night because of its Gaslamp Location and their staff's willingness to allow for a late check-out. We did expect with our $600+ per night suite something additional, a nice little touch, anything, a chocolate on the pillow, something, anything, but we didn’t even receive so much as a ’Congratulations’ (except from the passing guests in the hotel lobby). Other hotel downtown were willing to allow for late check-outs but were slightly more expensive for smaller suites. We should have paid the extra money because we ended up paying extra anyway. The next morning we called room service to have some coffee and juice sent up to the room for our parents and friends who we’d asked to stop by. The tray came up. Two carafes apple, two orange, 3 coffee. The bill: $184.00. After several emails, the bill was “corrected” to $112, and we were told that the room service staff would be trained to handle requests of that nature better in the future. I’m not thrilled in being part of the training of a 4-star hotel at now almost $800 per night. And I was not pleased in being gouged, especially in my own town. If staying downtown San Diego, for whatever reason, somewhere other than the Hotel Solamar would be my recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, but that's all it has to offer.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some other comments regarding the Hotel Solamar, I see that in most instances I was not alone. My husband and I thought we just had terrible luck, but it's obvious that this hotel still has a lot of work to do. The hotel its self is beautiful, but they seriously need more training in guest service. Upon my arrival the valet didn't help me with my luggage nor was there a bell person. At the front desk, first they couldn't find my reservation and then the girl checking me in handed me off to someone else because she was trying to check me in and do something else at the same time. Finally, after I was checked in I was not offered to have my bags brought to my room, I had to take them up myself. I read in another review that because it was his/her birthday they got a room upgrade and champagne, not so for me. Not even a "happy birthday." My husband and I ordered room service for some appetizers prior to hitting the town and were told it would be twenty minutes. Well, it never came! After going out that night we were hungry when we got back to the hotel, but it was too late to eat at there restaurant and the late night room service menu only had 3 items. We called the concierge for recommendations for late night dining and he referred us to a place that he said was open and served dinner until 1pm. When we arrived, approximatley 11:45pm, they were closing and had stopped serving dinner at 10pm. I was furious but found a place that was open and served dinner. There were little things that happened that just added up and I was not at all pleased with the service we received from this hotel's staff. I've stayed at many other hotels ranked higher and lower than Hotel Solamar and can promise that I did not receive even close to the level of service at these other hotels. I expected superior service or better from a hotel like Solamar and I was extremely disappointing especially given the amount of money you pay per night. At the end of our stay I made sure to check out at the front desk and tell them my experience, and that too was a disappointing response. I didn't want anything, per say, but I heart felt "I'm sorry" and ask for details would have been somewhat decent of them. I felt like the girl who checked me out did not care and was told by soemone else who over heard my conversation with her that they would have the General Manager contact me. A week later, no reponse. So I emailed the hotel and got a call from the Asst. GM and he was very kind and attentive. He even offered a free night to make it up to me and my husband and so we can "experience the Hotel Solamar the way it really should be experienced." He took down my address and to no surprise...over two months have gone by since that conversationa and we never received anything from him in the mail! With that said, we have no itentions of ever returning, nor refer any friends, family and especially our clients (we're local corporate business owners) to this hotel. I'd much rather pay more money and stay at a hotel, like the Omni which is not far from there, and receive far better service.

Reviews.Title: “Going to a Padres game?”
Reviews.Author: PKCinLA
Reviews.Content: If you are in town for a Padres game, the Solamar is a great option. The stadium is a block away...it's also close to 5th street in the Gaslamp. Has a modern, hip, boutique vibe reminiscent of the W chain. Nice, clean room on the 10th floor overlooking the pool/bar. Decor is trendy. Bed was great, comfortable chair, great shower. Sinks were stylish but not very functional. Service was low key. Shouldn't be an issue unless you are high maintenance. Valet parking was convenient and efficient. The pool/bar scene seemed lively but a bit touristy. They have a complimentary wine happy hour, but the wine is low grade. Get a head start on your night instead. Very good experience overall. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Solamar, take me away”
Reviews.Author: Elyse1316
Reviews.Content: After a hectic week at work, my boyfriend and I needed a quick get away. We "Pricelined" a 4-star hotel in San Diego and were extactic to come back with the Solamar. I had read some positive and some negative reviews, but i wanted to check it out for myself. I think some travelers must expect their lives to go on without a hitch and no one makes mistakes, which is what I was gathering from some other reviews. However, my experience was top notch. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and polite. We entered our room and I was pleased with the clean, soothing color palate and decor. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom a nice size. We met a local friend at the pool for a few drinks and snacks. The drink menu is creative and delicious as well as the bar appetizer menu. The seating area at the pool has something for everyone, whether it be lounging poolside or having conversation under the canopy. We then joined our fellow guests at the wine hour and enjoyed a couple glasses of wine before getting ready for dinner. We returned from dinner out in the Gaslamp and wanted to join the hip crowd at the pool, but couldn't muster up the energy. Our room overlooked the pool bar and we scoped out the scene for a little while. Overall, I would highly recommend Hotel Solmar.

Reviews.Title: “Not pleased at all.”
Reviews.Author: brig70
Reviews.Content: This property is owned by the Kimpton Brand of hotels. Unfortunately, a far cry from the other properties in its chain. The pluses: It's definitely a "boutique" hotel that offers decent amenities and has a certain feel that appeals to a younger clientel if that's what you look for in a hotel. Every evening from 5-6pm they have a complementary wine social in the lobby. Pretty nice to unwind and relax after a long day. Also, their upstairs pool bar has a nice vibe and very comforting. I stayed at this hotel in January, and I can only assume during the warmer months, this pool bar is busy and packed with the coolest of San Diegoans. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. The bathrooms are stocked with Aveda products and the complementary morning paper greets you at the door. The hotel does have a workout room that offers a few treadmills with cable tv monitors attached, but it is small. If there is more than five people in the room it's packed. So here's why I wasn't so pleased with this hotel. When I checked in, there was nobody at the front desk. Granted, it was 9pm on a Sunday..But I feel this is the second opportunity for your hotel to make a first impression. (The first opportunity is valet, but when my cab pulled up..The valet attended looked at the cab and casually walked back in the hotel.) At the front desk, I waited about three minutes for someone to show. When they finally did, they didn't apologize for the wait nor welcome me to the hotel. The second day, I was supposed to receive a UPS Package. UPS records showed it was delivered, the hotel showed they received it, but the package was "misplaced". It was an important package I needed for a tradeshow the next day. Although the package was never found, the hotel manager did send one of his employees out to purchase a similar item for replacement. One morning, my co-workers and I sat down for breakfast. We were given coffee with our menus. It took about 20 minutes for the waiter to return. When he served our order it was wrong. He was very apologetic and comped the meal, mentioning they were short staffed that morning. It seems as if the hotel staff can make up for their shortgivings, however if you are paying $300+ a night, you shouldn't have to endure a negative experience. I've been very pleased with the Kimpton brand (Hotel Monaco in Denver and Washington, D.C.)so I expected the same level of service at this property. In their defense, it is a fairly new property. However, the hotel business isn't new. If a guest pulls up in a cab, don't walk inside. If a guest is standing at the counter for a few minutes, apologize and welcome them to the hotel. If a guest has a package sent to the hotel, don't lose it. It seems like they need to pay attention to the small details in order to make this a property worth coming back to. Since it's right in the Gaslamp District, there are many others to chose from. I doubt I would stay here again. They had an Omni attached to the ball park, so I may give that a try next time I'm in SD.

Reviews.Title: “A Place to Stay but don't Overpay”
Reviews.Author: cineart
Reviews.Content: I don't know what's up with San Diego but it seems that all the hotels in the gaslamp area are charging New York prices. The convention center is very busy with New Orleans convention overflow and any decent place within walking distance of gaslamp is charging about $300/night plus $22 parking. I decided to play Russian roulette with Hotwire and bid a four star gaslamp area hotel for $204/night +taxes (for a Thursday and Friday night stay) I got the Solamar, a new boutique hotel that bills itself as four stars. I’ve read the other reviews here and thought I’d add some comments. The staff was all top notch and I encountered no rude or sub par service as mentioned before. The lobby is well appointed and a nice place to relax and the 4th floor bar is also a nice hangout. The workout room is a joke- the smallest I’ve ever seen with about four pieces of equipment. The pool is also a ridiculous 3’ deep and therefore useless. The hotel is new so the rooms and furnishings are clean. But here is the real point of my review –value. Our room was very, very small –so small that it didn’t have the requisite ‘two chairs and a table by the window set-up’ in case you wanted to invite a guest up to your room. More importantly, the rooms were poorly insulated. Any seasoned traveler knows the awful sound of heavy fireproof hotel doors slamming early in the morning as Business Bob leaves at 6:30AM for a meeting. We could hear next-door conversations and the maid vacuuming at 8:00AM very clearly. All of this does not fit in my definition of a four star hotel. Yes the room was decorated in a funky hip style. But with the room size and noise it felt like the Solamar built regular, small and acoustically sub par rooms and then hired a decorator to do an ‘extreme makeover’ adding drapes, some funky lamps and art. That just doesn’t cut it for their regular $300/night rates. At $204 I felt neither screwed nor did I feel I got any value. If I paid just $5 more a night I might have been pissed. The lobby and bar may look four star but after all I am paying for a room. I’d stay here again but if I had to pay $300 I’d choose the Marriot Gas lamp (NOT the other Marriot monster convention hotel by the water!!) The Marriot Gas lamp may not have a basin type Kohler sink and funky drapes but the standard rooms are big, immaculate, and have an equally unique California Craftsman style about it. Hope this helps!
